On 21 June 2024, security forces (coded as police) arrested five CPI (Maoist) cadres, including the 'vice president' of Gaganpalli RPC (Revolutionary Party Committee) Jantana Sarkar (the people's government of the Maoists) and a member of the Usur Local Organization Squad (LOS) with a bounty of Rs.100000, from the forest near the Pusbaka village under Basaguda Police Station limits (Bijapur, Chhattisgarh) during an anti-Maoist operation. Security forces seized a cache of explosives, a 'tiffin' bomb, a battery, spikes, splinters, gelatin sticks, cordex, and electric wires, as well as anti-government Maoist pamphlets, from their possession.

On 21 June 2024, two religious groups (likely Hindu and Muslim as the clash has been reported as a 'communal clash') clashed, vandalized local shops, houses, and vehicles, and set alight a tractor in the Soorsagar area of Jodhpur city (Rajasthan) after one group threw stones at the other community members over a dispute regarding the building of new gates at the Eidgah (Islamic place of worship). Two policemen were injured. Police resorted to lathi-charge and fired four to five rounds of tear gas to disperse the mob. Police had detained around 51 people linked to the clash.

Other: On 21 June 2024, CPI (Maoists) posters written in Telegu were found in Almonda village under Bandhugaon Police Station limits (Koraput district, Odisha) warned local Biju Janata Dal (BJD) politicians and forest officials. The banners also censured the claimed delay in distributing food items at Anganwadi centres.

Other: On 21 June 2024, CPI (Maoists) posters written in Telegu were found from Sarpali Chowk under Bandhugaon Police Station limits (Koraput district, Odisha) warned local Biju Janata Dal (BJD) politicians and forest officials. The banners also censured the claimed delay in distributing food items at Anganwadi centers.

On 21 June 2024, the IT Army, affiliated with the AJP, protested by picketing the Foreign Employment Department in the Tahachal locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters made various demands, including the return of illegally taken money from workers, action against fraudulent agents, and employment for youth, among others.

On 21 June 2024, members of BKU (Tikait), led by its district president, staged a dharna (sit-in protest) at the Collectorate's Tikoniya Park in Mainpuri city (Uttar Pradesh) over various demands and issues including stray cattle, and the forceful provision of a 2-kilowatt connection.

On 21 June 2024, members of the AITUC and the CPI staged a protest at the main gate of the Sitarama Project Company office in Seetharampuram village (Bhadradri Kothagudem, Telangana) against the company for dismissing women workers without giving any reason. The protesters demanded the company to reinstate them.

On 21 June 2024, more than 70 farmers staged a protest - and around 20 of them climbed a water tank - near Willoughby Hall in Lakhimpur city (Kheri, Uttar Pradesh) against the 2010 Awas Vikas Parishad project under which the protesters claimed their land was being acquired wrongly.

On 21 June 2024, members of the Catholic Nasrani Association and the Church Protection Council staged a protest in front of the Bishop's House in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) against five bishops of the Syro-Malabar Catholic Church for opposing the synod-prescribed unified Mass. The protesters symbolically expelled the five bishops to mark their protest.

notes: On 21 June 2024, members of NSUI and INC led by incumbent MLA and MP, as part of the party's nationwide agitation, held a protest at the collectorate circle in Jaipur city (Rajasthan) demanding justice for students affected by the claimed irregularities in the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test-(Undergraduate) examination.

On 21 June 2024, a large number of contractors staged a protest, raising slogans, outside the Assistant Engineer's office in Naugaon town (Uttarkashi), Uttarakhand) against the suspected irregularities at the Minor Irrigation Office and demanded the transfer of the junior engineer.

On 21 June 2024, members of the Tamil Nadu Noon Meal Workers Association staged a protest outside the Collectorate in Krishnagiri city (Tamil Nadu) with a list of demands including the filling up vacancies, maternity leaves, pension, promotions and increments.

On 21 June 2024, crusher businesspersons, including the Minister of Law, Justice, and Parliamentary Affairs elected from CPN(UML), the Chairman of the State Order and Good Governance Committee from NC, the General Secretary of the FCAN, and the President of Bagmati Tipper Industry Association, led by the Federation of Nepal Crushers and Mining Industry Professionals, staged a protest at Maitighar Mandala in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding the renewal of crusher industry licenses, including operational permissions.

On 21 June 2024, AIADMK MLAs staged a protest outside the Tamil Nadu Assembly in Chennai city (Tamil Nadu) against the DMK-led state government for failing to prevent the consumption of spurious liquor in Kallakurichi which resulted in many deaths and hospitalisations. The protesters shouted slogans and wore black shirts to mark their protest.

On 21 June 2024, about 20 members of the AIDWA affiliated to the CPI(M) staged a protest near Chinappa Park in Pudukkottai town (Tamil Nadu) against the DMK-led state government for failing to prevent the consumption of spurious liquor in Kallakurichi which resulted in many deaths and hospitalisations. The protesters demanded the state government to take measures to stop the sale of illicit liquor.

On 21 June 2024, a section of DYFI, members, members the AIYF and the NFIW affiliated to the CPI, and members of the farmers wing of the TMC staged separate protests in many locations in Tiruchirappalli city (Tamil Nadu) against the DMK-led state government for failing to prevent the consumption of spurious liquor in Kallakurichi which resulted in many deaths and hospitalisations. The protesters also demanded compensation for the victims' kin.

On 21 June 2024, members of several student organisations including the Ambedkar Students Association (ASA), the All India OBC Students Association (AIOBCSA), the Bahujan Students' Front (BSF), the Dalit Students Union (DSU), Fraternity Movement, Muslim Students Federation (MSF), the Tribal Students Forum (TSF), and a BJP MLA staged protests at the University of Hyderabad (UoH) in Hyderabad city (Telangana) demanding the university authorities to not consider the National Eligibility Test (NET) and Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) tests conducted by the National Testing Agency's (NTA) for PhD admissions citing allegations of corruption and malpractice. Members of the IYC staged a protest in front of a Union Minister's residence while the ABVP staged a protest at the Osmania University in Hyderabad city (Telangana) demanding the BJP-led Union government to cancel the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) over allegations of malpractice and corruption. The protesters also demanded in investigation into allegations of irregularities by the National Testing Agency (NTA) which conducted the NEET exam. The protesters also burned an effigy of the NTA to mark their protest.

On 21 June 2024, SCS staged a protest and burned an effigy in Varanasi city (Uttar Pradesh) against the suspected irregularities in the NEET exams. The protesters scuffled (likely non-violent based on absence of injuries or other reports of violence) with the police.
On 21 June 2024, people held a protest in front of the police station in Delft Island (Jaffna, Northern), demanding justice for a murdered youth during a clash between two groups (coded separately).
On 21 June 2024, villagers held a protest in Kallundai village (Jaffna, Northern), demanding to unite the two Grama Sevaka (village servant) divisions.

On 21 June 2024, activists associated with the Chure (hill range) and Forest Protection Campaign staged a protest rally in Janakpur city (Dhanusha district). The protesters were demanding solutions to various issues such as shortage in drinking water, illegal exploitation of rivers, and conservation challenges related to the Chure Hill range.
On 21 June 2024, local people staged a protest in Narendra Nagar town (Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand) opposing the inclusion of Badeda village in the Narendra Nagar Palika (council).

On 21 June 2024, family members of the deceased staged a dharna (sit-in protest) along the road in Gaura village (Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of a boy who was hit and killed by a tractor.

On 21 June 2024, family members of a worker who died when a pillar of an under-construction college building collapsed staged a protest in Medak town (Telangana) accusing the building contractor of negligence. The protesters demanded compensation for the victim's kin.

On 21 June 2024, members of the BRS including a former MLA staged a protest at a former BRS Speaker's residence in Hyderabad city (Telangana) against the INC after rumours started circulating that the former Speaker was planning to join the INC. The protesters shouted slogans and were arrested by the police.

On 21 June 2024, hundreds of members of the Muslim community scuffled with police personnel and broke through barricades in Raipur city (Chhattisgarh) during a demonstration against the police for failure to arrest those accused in the lynching of three cattle traders in Arang town (coded earlier). Police arrested demonstrators. The demonstrators later submitted a memorandum to the additional district magistrate (ADM) listing their demands.

On 21 June 2024, local people and family members of the deceased staged a demonstration, pelted stones at the police, and burned a police vehicle in Firozabad city (Uttar Pradesh) after the death of a man (jail inmate) at the district hospital - whose health had deteriorated at the jail. The demonstrators also stopped the ambulance carrying the deceased's body. Some policemen were suspected to have suffered injuries.

source: Aamaj News; Hasht-e Subh; National Resistance Front of Afghanistan
notes: On 21 June 2024, two Taliban members were killed and two were wounded following an attack by National Resistance Front militants on a checkpoint in the Gul Surkh intersection of PD4, Kabul city.

On 21 June 2024, protesters gathered in Sofia, demanding the resignation of the mayor due to recent construction in the capital that has changed the traffic and pedestrian routes around the National Palace of Culture.
On 21 June 2024, protesters gathered in front of the city court in Sofia to demand a life sentence for a man who killed a 15-year-old in a traffic accident in the capital.

On 21 June 2024, rioters gathered in front of the municipality of Tirana, demanding the mayor resign due to corruption and nepotistic practices, throwing Molotov cocktails at the building. Police threw tear gas at the demonstrators to disperse their gathering. The event was organized by the Alliance for Protection of the National Theater, the Democratic Party, and the Freedom Party.

On 21 June 2024, animal rights activists gathered outside the city prosecutor's office in Atyrau city in protest of an animal cruelty incident, which took place 2 days earlier in the Atyrau region. The protesters demanded that the authorities fully serve justice in the case and raise public awareness regarding animal rights to prevent cruelty toward animals.

On 21 June 2024, supporters of detained journalist Duman Mukhamedkarim gathered outside the court building in Qonayev township (formerly Kapchagay township of Kapshagay district) of Almaty region, demanding that the authorities release Mukhamedkarim from detention due to his health condition.

On 21 June 2024, people protested in front of the Buiucani Court in Chisinau - Buiucani, in support of Evghenia Gutul and accusing Maia Sandu and PAS of persecuting the convicted oligarch Shor and his supporters and provoking them.

On 21 June 2024, employees of the National Agency for Mine Action were hit by landmines, likely planted by Artsakh forces, in the Hadrut region (coded to Jabrail), while conducting demining works. As a result of the accident, one of the employees died while others received various injuries.
Other: On 21 June 2024, the Armenian government formally recognised the State of Palestine (coded to Yerevan, Armenia).

source: Agora.md; Deschide; Gagauzinfo; Moldpres; Nokta.md; TV8; Unimedia; Ziarul de Garda
notes: Other: On 21 June 2024, the president, Maia Sandu, signed the decree regarding the initiation of the accession negotiations of the Republic of Moldova to the EU. (Coded to Chisinau - Buiucani)
On 21 June 2024, about 200 unionized employees of a national motorway company gathered for a rally in Ljubljana, demanding a pay rise.
On 21 June 2024, Women's Strike movement activists demonstrated in Falun, Dalarna, in support of women's rights and to oppose violence against women.
On 21 June 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Lund, Skane, to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.
On 21 June 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Umea, Vasterbotten, to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.
On 21 June 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Malmo, Skane, to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.
On 21 June 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Stockholm to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.

On 21 June 2024, around 40 pro-Palestinian demonstrators chained themselves and blocked the entrance to the Norwegian parliament in Oslo, demanding to stop all the economic relations with Israel and Israeli companies. Activists from the Action Group for Palestine took part in the event. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, around 10 people were detained.

On 21 June 2024, activists from the Emergency Break movement blocked a major road in Copenhagen, calling for an end to motorway construction due to environmental concerns. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, and five people were detained.

On 21 June 2024, around 20 shellfish harvesters of the estuary of O Burgo blocked the A Pasaxe Bridge in A Coruna (Galicia) to demand better renovation works on the bridge so the estuary can be productive, as well as financial compensation until they can work again.

On 21 June 2024, people, called by the 'Alicante where are you going?' platform (Plataforma Alicante, donde vas?), held a protest in Alicante (Valencia) against mass tourism in the city. The spokesperson of Podemos took part in the event.

On 21 June 2024, around 40 people, including parents and children, participated in a protest in Alzey (Rheinland-Pfalz) to call for daily school transport to be guaranteed and suggested the introduction of a round table with all involved parties, including employers, Ver.di, municipal associations, district councils, and representatives from the Ministry of Transport and the Ministry of Education, to find a solution. The protest occurred in the context of repeated bus strikes in the region due to ongoing collective bargaining negotiations.

On 21 June 2024, an unknown number of masked pro-Palestinian demonstrators occupied a corridor, two classrooms and a toilet block in the B building of the University of Amsterdam in Amsterdam (Noord-Holland) to express solidarity with the Palestinian people and to demand the university to cut all ties with Israel. The university asked them to leave, among others because of property destruction. Some of them did not comply and the police came. Police officers were pelted with objects. Police arrested 9 people during the evacuation process.

On 21 June 2024, an unknown number of people staged a protest action by installing 45 helmets and white roses in the Zuidzin elementary school in Antwerpen (Vlaanderen) where a construction site collapsed in 2021 and killed 5 workers, to denounce the malpractices in the sector. The event was organized by the ABVV-FGTB and the ACV-CSC trade unions. The protesters also denounced poor communication in the aftermath of the incident and slow compensation for the victims.

On 21 June 2024, activists belonging to Comitato No Besta staged a protest inside the municipality in Bologna (Emilia-Romagna) to protest against the mayor and the police after clashes took place in Don Bosco Park on June 19 2024 following the clearing of occupants by the police.

On 21 June 2024, 100 people, among which students from the French-speaking and Dutch-speaking Free University of Brussels (ULB and VUB) protested in front of the town hall in Brussels - Ixelles (Brussels) to demand that the municipality cut its twinning arrangement with the Israeli region of Megiddo.

On 21 June 2024, about 100 people, including employees of ThyssenKrupp Steel and IGM delegates and affiliates, participated in a protest at Villa Hugel in Essen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to call on the Krupp Foundation to invest more money in the preservation of jobs.

On 21 June 2024, under the motto 'Stop the daycare crisis in Freising' and at the call of 'Initiative for Freising's children' (Initiative fur Freisings Kinder), people, including parents, children and daycare staff and educators, participated in a protest in Freising (Bayern) for sufficient daycare spots, to demand the right to early childhood education, and to call for concrete measures.
On 21 June 2024, around 50 social workers of the departmental council gathered in Le Mans (Pays de la Loire) to demand the payment of the CTI (Indicative Salary Supplement) to all social workers.

On 21 June 2024, at the call of Marburger Bund and the Student Council, medical students participated in a protest in Leipzig (Sachsen) to call for better working conditions, standardized medical learning and training concepts, better regulations on absenteeism and nationwide standardized wages of at least 1,500 euros during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.

On 21 June 2024, several workers of UPM (Union of Misericordies) held a protest outside the UPM headquarters in Lisboa (Lisboa) to demand a new collective labor agreement with salary upgrades. Members of PCP and BE took part in the protest.

On 21 June 2024, workers of the Red Cross, called by CCOO, held a protest at the Spanish Red Cross offices in Logrono (La Rioja), to demand a new collective labor agreement with a salary upgrade, harmonizing the differences between regions.

On 21 June 2024, some Femen activists held a protest in Madrid - Centro (Madrid) against the visit of Argentinian Prime Minister Javier Milei, on a visit to receive awards from the Region of Madrid and Instituto Juan de Mariana.

On 21 June 2024, people held a protest in Puerta del Sol in Madrid - Centro (Madrid) in support of the visit of the Argentinian Prime Minister, Javier Milei, who received awards from the Region of Madrid and Instituto Juan de Mariana.

On 21 June 2024, people, called by several Argentinian and Spanish-Argentinian collectives like Argentinians in Movement (Argentinxs en Movimiento) and Sovereign Argentina Madrid (Argentina Soberana Madrid), held a protest in Alcala Street in Madrid - Centro (Madrid) against the visit of the Argentinian Prime Minister, Javier Milei, who received awards from the Region of Madrid and Instituto Juan de Mariana. Protesters were removed by the police amid some pushing and shoving, which caused the fall of one of them. Separately, members of Femen held a protest for the same reasons in the same district.

On 21 June 2024, hundreds of members of the self-managed social center Foa Boccaccio marched from Milano Street to Castello Square in Monza (Lombardia) to protest against the removal from the occupied area in the former hockey rink next to the Royal Palace. Protesters occupied a new building in Pogdora Square. They hung a banner in the building with the words 'You will not stop our anger'.

On 21 June 2024, several hundred people gathered in front of the City Hall in Nice (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to condemn the rape of a Jewish girl. The group protested against sexual violence and antisemitism.
On 21 June 2024, at the call of the SUD, 60 firefighters protested in Nimes (Occitanie) against what they call the 'inhumane' policy of the firefighters' director, Colonel Thierry Carret.

On 21 June 2024, more than 30 teachers represented by NEU protested outside of the Nottingham Catholic Diocese on Castle Boulevard in Nottingham (England), following Bishop Patrick McKinney's recent guidance that teachers in the diocese's secondary schools should not celebrate Pride Month, and advocating against such recommendation.

On 21 June 2024, at the call of the Instagram group 'Together for Peace in Palestine' (Gemeinsam fur den Frieden in Palestina), people participated in a protest in Ravensburg (Baden-Wurttemberg) for an end to the war and violence in Gaza, to commemorate the victims of the war, call for a halt to further arms deliveries from Germany to Israel, an immediate ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, and for Germany's recognition of Palestine as a sovereign state.

Around 21 June 2024 (as reported), people, including VCD, BUND, ADFC, OEDP and 'Architectural Circle' (Architekturkreis) affiliates, participated in a protest in Regensburg (Bayern) against the construction of a new parking garage near the old town and the prospect of increased traffic pollution. The participants also criticized the lack of a concept for commuter traffic and called on politicians to focus on a sustainable mobility transition.
On 21 June 2024, at the call of CGT, people gathered at the Lumieres Factory in Saint-Georges-de-Mons (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes), to defend the working rights of the factory workers.

On 21 June 2024, dozens of people, including students and teachers, held a protest in Tierz (Aragon) against the regional government's layoff plan for teaching staff across the region. Protesters demanded more resources and decent student ratios per classroom. The mayor (PSOE) of Tierz took part in the protest.

On 21 June 2024, about thirty students at the Utrecht School of the Arts (HKU) demonstrated in Utrecht (Utrecht) to demand their school make a statement against the violence in Gaza and to cut ties with Israeli institutions.

On 21 June 2024, dozens of farmers, called by ASAJA and the Farming and Stockbreeding Union (Unio Llauradora i Ramadera), held a protest in front of the Department of Agriculture in Valencia (Valencia) against the mismanagement of the department by Vox, arguing the party's promises for the sector had not been fulfilled.

On 21 June 2024, police officers held a protest in Villafranca de los Barros (Extremadura) during the local government's plenary session to denounce the removal of the bonus scheme for their sector and their management.

On 21 June 2024, people, called by 20 associations of mothers and fathers, held a protest in Zaragoza (Aragon) against the regional government's lay-off plan for teaching staff across the region. Protesters demanded more resources and decent ratios per classroom.

On 21 June 2024, about 200 delivery workers affiliated with the Rider Union (KCTU affiliate) and shop owners held a rally in front of the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to provide measures to regulate 'unfair' labor practices of a delivery platform company.
On 21 June 2024, residents and the Paju city mayor held a protest at the border area in Paju. They urged the authorities to stop sending anti-regime leaflets in the borderland.

On 21 June 2024, Joint Action to Rectify the Human Rights Commission members and a DPK-affiliated lawmaker held a press conference and picketed at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to pass a bill on the National Human Rights Commission of Korea reform act.

On 21 June 2024, about 50 supporters of Lee Jae-myung (DPK members), chairman of the main opposition Democratic Party of Korea (DPK), staged a protest in front of the Suwon District Public Prosecutor's Office (Suwon). They called for the impeachment of a judge, condemning the court's decision to arrest the DPK chairman over corruption charges.

On 21 June 2024, protesters, including a DPK-affiliated lawmaker, held a demonstration at Incheon Metropolitan City Hall (Incheon - Namdong). They urged the government to extend the Incheon subway line 1 and to stop their plan to establish Songdo truck parking lot.

On 21 June 2024, about 20 members of the Gongsinyun (a civic group reporting public corruption) and members of the Reform Party held a press conference with a banner at Yeongju City Council (Yeongju). They urged the authorities to expel a councilor, condemning his violation of the Act On The Prevention Of Conflict Of Interest Related To Duties Of Public Servants.

On 21 June 2024, about 10 members of Suwon Civil Society Council and Gyeonggi City, County, and Village Network held a press conference and picketed in front of Suwon City Hall (Suwon). They urged the authorities to stop abolishing an ordinance on supporting residents-led village activities.
On 21 June 2024, protesters held a demonstration at Cheongju Jungang Park (Cheongju) to urge the doctors to call off the strike.

An 11-year-old cow herder was killed, and two other cow herders were injured.

Displacement: Around 21 June 2024 (as reported), in Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), thousands of villagers from ten villages, including Yaw, Lel Hla, Su Poke Kone and Min Kone villages, were forced to flee their homes in fear of People's Militia Forces raiding and abducting villagers.

The No.5 Border Guard Police fired back with artillery rounds and some of the rounds landed in Ka Nyin Tan ward. Casualties unknown.

notes: On 21 June 2024, near Pan Chin Pauk village (Thandwe township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), the military engaged in intense fighting with the Arakan Army by using air, navy and ground forces since the morning. Casualties unknown.

actors: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
notes: On 21 June 2024, between Pat Lel village and Nay Pu Taung area (coded as Toungup) (Toungup township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), the Arakan Army continued to attack about 150 military soldiers heading to the Nay Pu Taung small outpost and both sides exchanged fire for two days (20 - 21 June). During the fight, the Arakan Army blocked and attacked the military reinforcements from Toungup townships heading to the battlefield. The military from the Ib-544 base and the Tet U Taung area fired artillery rounds on the battlefield. During the fight, the military also conducted airstrikes on the battlefield. There were nearly 60 fatalities, including a captain, on the military side split across two days (20 - 21 June), and coded as 30 for this event.

On 21 June 2024, dozens of community members, the Alderman of the 27th Ward Walter Burnett, and family members of a 7-year old shot and killed on June 18th marched down South Hoyne Avenue in Chicago - Southwest Side (Illinois) to call for justice for the victim and an end to gun violence.
On 21 June 2024, workers at Saputo's Dairy rallied with members of Teamsters Local 317 in Delhi (New York) to call on the employees to vote for the unionization and joining IBT.

On 21 June 2024, roughly two dozen community members and the Whitneyville Civic Association rallied and delivered a petition to Mayor Lauren Garrett in Hamden (Connecticut) to demand a reduced speed limit on Whitney Avenue due to reckless driving which endangers people.

On 21 June 2024, hundreds of community members gathered in north Houston (Texas) to mourn the death of a 12-year-old girl and to call for justice. Mayor John Whitmire (D) and the chief of the Houston Police Department were present at the demonstration. Two men of Venezuelan nationality and undocumented status were charged for the murder of the girl, and during the demonstration the mayor called for the current administration and congress to implement immigration reform.

On 21 June 2024, around 200 farmers protested in Lebanon (Tennessee) against the industrial rezoning of agricultural land. Wilson County is reviewing an application to rezone 1,400 acres of currently agricultural land to light industrial.

On 21 June 2024, protesters gathered outside of Metro Hall in Louisville (Kentucky) to protest against the new city budget and to call for the budget to prioritize social services and spend less on the police department. The protest was organized by the Black Leadership Coalition of Kentucky (BLACK), VOCAL KY, and Forward Justice Action Network.

actors: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 21 June 2024, pro-Palestinian protesters and members of Climate Defenders staged a rally outside Citibank headquarters in New York - Manhattan (New York) to call for 'free Palestine' and to condemn the bank for supporting 'oppression' amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023, as well as to demonstrate against the bank's investment in the fossil fuel industry. The rally was part of 'Summer of Heat' action. Police arrested several protesters.
Training: Around 21 June 2024 (as reported), Great Plains Active Club (loosely affiliated with the Rise Above Movement) affiliates held a sparring training in Omaha (Nebraska).

On 21 June 2024, protesters, family members of the victim, law enforcement, and supporters rallied in Patchogue (New York) to support Nick's Law, which would make the punishment stricter for those who flee after fatal hit-and-run incidents. State Senator Dean Murray (R) spoke at the rally.
On 21 June 2024, hundreds of SCFP/CUPE members staged a rally in front of the City Hall in Quebec City (Quebec) to demand a new contract.

On 21 June 2024, pro-Palestinian demonstrators gathered outside of John Marshall Courthouse in Richmond (Virginia) in support of 9 pro-Palestinian demonstrators who had blocked the I-95 highway ahead of their trial. This demonstration occurred amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 21 June 2024, 4,000 SEIU 6 janitors held a demonstration in downtown Seattle (Washington) to call for a 'fair contract' that includes a living wage and benefits for workers. King County Councilmember Girmay Zahilay (D) was also present.

On 21 June 2024, pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment with about 16 tents at the University of Waterloo campus in Waterloo (Ontario) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divest from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. The rally was organized by the Palestinian Youth Movement and Occupy UW. This was the 40th day of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. The university issued a legal trespass notice to protesters. This campus demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 21 June 2024, dozens of laborers from the Suing People Movement peacefully protested in front of the council building in Yogyakarta city (Yogyakarta province). They opposed the Public Housing Saving program, which obliged them to spare 2.5 percent of their monthly salary. They claimed it would create a financial burden for them. They also voiced concerns regarding other issues, including the increase in fuel prices, basic food prices, and consumer taxes. They marched to the Zero Kilometer monument in the same city.

On 21 June 2024, hundreds of people peacefully protested in front of the Bakauheni Port, Bakauheni district (South Lampung regency, Lampung province). They opposed the new port regulation that limits access to informal port workers. They claimed it would negatively affect their incomes.

On 21 June 2024, a group of Papuans from the Special Autonomy Monitoring Alliance peacefully protested in front of the Indigenous People Agency building in Fakfak district (Fakfak regency, West Papua province). They demanded that the Papuan candidates be prioritized in the regional election.

On 21 June 2024, dozens of people from the United Kabah Cadre Forum (FKKB), members of the PPP political party, peacefully protested on Diponegoro Road, Menteng district, Central Jakarta city (Jakarta province) (coded as Jakarta - Central). They criticized the leadership of the PPP party leader and demanded his resignation. Meanwhile, hundreds of PPP members staged a counter-protest and voiced support for the party leader.
On 21 June 2024, a group of people peacefully protested in Rumpin district (Bogor regency, West Java province). They opposed the presence of an illegal landfill in the Leuwi Peso hamlet.

On 21 June 2024, hundreds of people peacefully protested in front of the city hall in Malang city (East Java province). They voiced support for Palestine and condemned the occupation of the Palestinian territory by Israel.

On 21 June 2024, members of the National Wing movement within the DP gathered with banners outside the DP headquarters in Ulaanbaatar - Chingeltei. The protesters demanded the resignation of the party leader over allegations of embezzling funds from the Education Loan Fund and placing associates in key positions.

On 21 June 2024, employees of Monpolymet group gathered with placards in Ulaanbaatar - Ulaanbaatar demanding the reopening of the oil factory, which had been shut down by the Independent Authority Against Corruption and the City Prosecutor's Office. The protesters called for a swift resolution and an explanation.

On 21 June 2024, Sofitel Philippine Plaza Manila workers and members of labor groups staged an indignation rally and candlelight protest in front of the hotel in Pasay City (Metropolitan Manila, National Capital Region) in response to the hotel's scheduled closure on 1 July and what the demonstrators perceived as union-busting tactics by the hotel.

On 21 June 2024, over 30,000 people, including members of the Taiwan Citizen Front, the Economic Democracy Union, and 48 other citizen's groups gathered to protest with placards, banners, and flags around the Legislative Yuan in Taipei City - Zhongzheng district (Taipei City). They demanded the rejection of seven major KMT 'democratic regression' bills that arrogated executive and judicial power to the legislature. This continuation of Operation Bluebird coincided with the third reading of the KMT and TPP's reform bills. KMT-supporters, known as 'Blue Eagles' also gathered on the scene holding placards and a Nazi swastika flag.

notes: On 20 June 2024, in San Antonio Limon, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents and farmers demonstrated against a company accused of contaminating the aquifers in the sea and looting thousands of liters of water in Totalco. State police officers arrived at the scene to disperse the crowds, where gunshots were fired. State police officers attempted to arrest two leaders of the movement, which was prevented by the National Guard, who reported that the police were not in their jurisdiction to do so. The authorities confirmed two fatalities, while peasant associations say there were three. Several people were injured. At least 2 fatalities.

The demonstrations, motivated by demands related to public works in the Usme locality, also led to the closure of several public transit stations, including Molinos, Consuelo, and Socorro.

The three pools would store over 35 thousand gallons of crude oil.
On 20 June 2024, in a rural area of the Puerto Lleras municipality (Meta), two farmers, a father and son, were abducted inside their farm by unidentified individuals in the Casibare vereda.

Property destruction: On 20 June 2024, in a rural area of San Jose de Ure municipality (Cordoba), military forces destroyed two cocaine laboratories belonging to the Gulf Clan in the Vista Hermosa and El Pavo sectors. The laboratories stored 310 kilograms of coca leaf, 275 gallons of gasoline, 75 gallons of coca base, 22 cans, 7 shovels, ammonia, and ACPM, among other materials. These would produce 17 kilograms of coca base paste monthly, resulting in a value greater than 52 million pesos.

Demonstrators called a 96-hour strike nationwide as part of their demonstration.

The demonstrators carried signs, banners, and posters and held a sit-in in front of the State Attorney General's Office building.

Around 20 June 2024 (as reported), in Trujillo (La Libertad), dozens of locals, supporters of the provincial mayor (affiliated with Democratic Party We Are Peru: PDSP), currently suspended, carried out a demonstration outside the local administration after the National Elections Jury decided to uphold the suspension of the representative. On 20 June 2024, Turkish forces shelled YPG positions in Tall Refaat town in Aleppo countryside with artillery. Casualties unknown.

On 20 June 2024, a Jubo League leader along with 4-5 accomplices assaulted and injured a supporter of mayoral candidate in Gaurnadi municipality (Barisal), over electoral rivalry amid upazila parishad elections.
