The police officers managed to immobilize and arrest the 2 individuals before a group of rioters attacked them. Police used tear gas. 4 police officers were injured lightly.
Around 20 June 2024 (as reported), people protested in Chisinau against non-traditional European values and LGBTQ+ policies.
On 20 June 2024, people demonstrated in Molde, More og Romsdal, to oppose proposed budget cuts affecting welfare and social services that would affect senior citizens.

On 20 June 2024, an Azerbaijani civilian was hit by an anti-tank mine, likely planted by Artsakh forces, in Horovlu, Hadrut region, while conducting agricultural work in his truck. As a result of the accident, he received various injuries.

On 20 June 2024, about 20 activists gathered for a rally in Szczecin, demanding higher solidarity with refugees globally, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine and Ukraine and criticizing the actions of the perpetrators.

On 20 June 2024, activists, including students, gathered in Lublin, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine, criticizing the ongoing Israeli operations in Gaza and demanding immediate suspension of joint activities between Polish and Israeli academic institutions.

On 20 June 2024, activists, including students, gathered in Wroclaw, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine, criticizing the ongoing Israeli operations in Gaza and demanding immediate suspension of joint activities between Polish and Israeli academic institutions.

On 20 June 2024, several dozen students gathered in front of their university in Warsaw, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine, criticizing the ongoing Israeli operations in Gaza and demanding immediate suspension of joint activities between Polish and Israeli academic institutions.

On 20 June 2024, students gathered in front of their university in Krakow, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine, criticizing the ongoing Israeli operations in Gaza and demanding immediate suspension of joint activities between Polish and Israeli academic institutions.

On 20 June 2024, students gathered in front of their university in Poznan, declaring solidarity with civilians in Palestine, criticizing the ongoing Israeli operations in Gaza and demanding immediate suspension of joint activities between Polish and Israeli academic institutions.

On 20 June 2024, several hundred activists, including farmers, employees in the forestry industry and other related sectors gathered in Bielsko-Biala, protesting against what they see as extensive and harmful environmental agenda of the state and the EU.

On 20 June 2024, about a dozen farmers gathered with their vehicles in Gniew, protesting against what they see as extensive and harmful environmental agenda of the state, especially the so-called Green Deal, and against imports of cheaper grain from Ukraine.

On 20 June 2024, activists, including lawyers, gathered for a rally in Warsaw in front of the Constitutional Court, protesting against what they see as a harmful political meddling into the judicial sector in the country.

On 20 June 2024, several dozen employees of the TV and Radio broadcast of the public service gathered for a march through Bratislava, protesting against what they see as harmful meddling of the current government into freedom of press in Slovakia.

Agreement: On 20 June 2024, Norway, Sweden, and Finland signed an agreement to establish a military transport corridor in Northern Scandinavia, aimed to enhance military mobility and cooperation among the three nations. The event is coded to Narvik, Nordland.

On 20 June 2024, activists from the Emergency Break movement blocked several major roads in Copenhagen, calling for an end to motorway construction due to environmental concerns. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands.
On 20 June 2024, six activists from the Animal Save movement demonstrated in Stockholm to oppose animal rights violations, to promote animal welfare and plant-based diets.

On 20 June 2024, around 50 health workers, called by SATSE, held a protest at the Catalan Institute of Health (ICS) in Barcelona - L'Eixample (Cataluna) against the cuts in resources and the lay-off plan of medical staff announced over the summer.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of IAC-CATAC, CGT, SAE, White Tide and Intersindical, around 200 people, including health workers, held a protest outside the Health Department in Barcelona - Les Corts (Cataluna) against the lay-off plan announced over the summer.
On 20 June 2024, around 30 residents, called by the Pedro da Salsa Association (Asociacion Pedra da Salsa), held a protest at the DP0506 near Barranan (Galicia) to demand the renovation of the road.

On 20 June 2024, 7 homeless people occupied a vacant house in Berlin - Lichtenberg (Berlin) to demonstrate against vacancies and in favor of affordable housing. The police intervened, cleared the house, and arrested the squatters after they refused to leave the premises and threw objects at the owners of the house when asked to leave.

Property destruction: On 20 June 2024, overnight, unknown people threw stones and paintballs at an FDP party office in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin), causing material damage (unspecified) to the front door. A graffiti left by the perpetrators and reading 'anti-capitalist overtime' was found nearby.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of GEW and Ver.di, around 3,000 teachers and educators staged a protest in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) for better working conditions and against staff shortage in daycare centers. The participants also called for a collective agreement with regulations on group sizes, compensation for workloads and better training. The protest was organized in front of the House of Representatives, where the State Parliament held a session at the same time.

On 20 June 2024, about 140 people participated in a pro-Palestine demonstration in Moabit in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin), some uttering anti-Semitic slogans. Police forces intervened to end the demonstration, arrested several people, and charged 10 participants with criminal complaints. Two police officers were assaulted by participants in the process, though injuries were not specified.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of 'Palestine Committee' (Palestinakomittee), around 50 students staged a protest in front of the Henry-Ford building near the Freie University in Dahlem in Berlin - Steglitz-Zehlendorf (Berlin) and set up a pro-Palestine protest camp against all forms of discrimination, anti-Semitism, the shift to the right, repression, the war in Gaza, and the new Higher Education Act of the Berlin Senate, which allows for an easier exmatriculation of politically active students. The participants also called for the renaming of the Henry Ford Building, which they argued was an anti-Semite.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the 'General Students Committee (Asta)' (Allgemeiner Studierendenausschuss) and the group 'Hands off student rights', about 60 people, including students and pro-Palestine activists, participated in a protest at the Freie Universitat in Dahlem in Berlin - Steglitz-Zehlendorf (Berlin) against the new Higher Education Act of the Berlin Senate which allows for an easier exmatriculation of politically active students and which the participants consider creating an exacerbation of the power imbalance between professors and students. Some of the participants were also against what they claim to be Israel's genocide in Gaza, and criticized German politics and Germany's role in the Israel-Palestine conflict.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, CFDT, UNSA and CFE-CGC, around 500 Naval Group workers gathered in Brest (Bretagne), to protest against the proposed new company agreement.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, around 20 herdsmen gathered in Briancon (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest against the far-right ideology and to demand better working conditions.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the Abaco association, about 20 staged a protest in front of the headquarters of the regional health department in Roma Street in Cagliari (Sardegna) against the shortcomings of the local healthcare system.

On 20 June 2024, around 300 people, including students, held a protest in Castell de Ferro (Andalucia) against gender-based violence, after a resident was killed by her partner. The mayor (PSOE) took part in the protest.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of FSU, people gathered in Chambery (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to protest against far-right ideology.

On 20 June 2024, an unknown number of people protested in front of the Social and Economic Council in Den Haag (Zuid-Holland) to denounce the youth wage existing for 50 years and being less than the minimum wage. The action was organized by the youth section of the FNV, which denounced what constituted cheap labor for employers.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, around 100 people demonstrated in Dreux (Centre-Val de Loire) to protest against far-right ideology and the RN party.

source: Confederation Generale du Travail; La CGT
notes: On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, workers of the Public Service Management Center gathered in Dunkerque (Hauts-de-France) to protest against far-right ideology.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the alliance 'Grevesmuhlen for all' (Grevesmuhlen fur alle), between around 460 (according to police) and 500 (organizers) people, including the mayor (independent), students, a district administrator (CDU), associations, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern's Minister of Culture (SPD) and a Bundestag Member (SPD), participated in a protest in Grevesmuhlen (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) and formed a human chain against violence, racism, xenophobia and for cohesion, tolerance and a peaceful society. The event took place following a racist attack on a Ghanaian family in Grevesmuhlen.

On 20 June 2024, a small group of pro-Palestinian protesters disturbed a conference attended by the Chairman of the Executive Board of the University of Groningen, Jouke de Vries, at the Students Cultural Center in Groningen (Groningen) to demand that the Chairman resign over his management of the pro-Palestinian protests on campus, and in particular the police interventions. The protesters want the university to cut all ties with Israel and hold the Chairman accountable for the police intervention.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the Medical Student Council, around 200 medical students participated in a protest in Hannover (Niedersachsen) to call for better working conditions, standardized medical learning and training concepts, better regulations on absenteeism and higher wages in line with the maximum Bafog student loan rate of up to 930 euros during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.

On 20 June 2024, hundreds of music school teachers participated in a protest in Kiel (Schleswig-Holstein) and called for greater financial support from the state of Schleswig-Holstein. The protest occurred in the context of a new law introducing the need for Schleswig-Holstein's music schools to employ their freelance teachers on a permanent basis, causing additional costs and a funding gap of 5 million euros.

On 20 June 2024, people staged a protest outside the Guildhall in Kingston upon Hull (England), calling on the council to 'reinstate funding' for Endike Community Care, which supported people with dementia at the time of reporting.

On 20 June 2024, around 30 students' parents and students gathered in front of the George-Desnos school, in La Ferte-Bernard (Pays de la Loire), to protest against the government project to set up level groups within school classes.

On 20 June 2024, around 200 people from the Nalon area, called by the Platform for Public Healthcare (Plataforma por la Sanidad Publica), held a protest at the Valle del Nalon Hospital in Langreo (Asturias) against cuts on resources and medical staff envisaged at the hospital.
On 20 June 2024, judges, lawyers and education workers gathered in front of the Courthouse in Le Havre (Normandie) to denounce the lack of resources in family and children's courts.

On 20 June 2024, an unknown number of AI and Flemish Refugee Action (Vluchtelingenwerk Vlaanderen) members staged a protest action in Leuven (Vlaanderen) to oppose the increasing hostility and exclusion of refugees and migrants in the country and to raise awareness for the situation of migrants.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, FSU and SUD, people gathered in Lille (Hauts-de-France) to protest against far-right ideology in light of the upcoming legislative elections.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, people gathered in the Saint-Jean-de-Dieu Hospital Center in Lyon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to protest against the closure of psychiatric beds in the institution.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of teachers, called by CSIF, held a protest in front of the Ministry of Education in Madrid - Centro (Madrid) to demand better working conditions and structural reforms that would improve the education system.

On 20 June 2024, several groups of people held a protest at Ramiro de Maetzu High school in Madrid - Chamartin (Madrid) against the regional government's plans to create inside the facility for an international school for children of EU officials, as it would create segregation, giving preference in admission for those children and reducing the resources and spaces of the center.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of people held a protest in Malaga (Andalucia) against the New Pact on Migration and Asylum, considered to be a direct threat to the human rights of migrants and refugees. Members of Malaga Welcome (Malaga Acoge) and Solidarity with Migrants Platform (Plataforma Solidarid con los migrantes) took part in the protest.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of FSU and UNSA, teachers gathered in front of the Enilea school in Mamirolle (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte) to protest against the sale of two buildings on Mamirolle campus' premises.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, around 900 people, including students, left-wing parties and anti-racist movements, gathered in Marseille (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest for higher salaries and against austerity policies and far-right ideology.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, around 100 energy workers gathered for a rally in Maubeuge (Hauts-de-France) to announce a strike and demand for better working conditions and higher salaries.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of FNSEA and JA, around 30 farmers staged a protest and dumped manure in front of the Direction Department of Territories' headquarters in Metz (Grand Est). The farmers demand the payment of financial incentives.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT and CFDT, around 250 people gathered in Montlucon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to protest against far-right ideology.

On 20 June 2024, firefighters hired by the Orthem company and in charge of forest monitoring held a protest in front of the Department of Environment in Murcia (Murcia) to call on the regional government to take over this service so they would be hired as public servants. Protesters demanded better working conditions.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGIL, including its FP and SPI branches, people, including health workers, marched from Parlamento Square to Palazzo d'Orleans in Palermo (Sicilia) to ask for the relaunch of the public health system and to protest against healthcare problems, including waiting lists and the shortage of healthcare personnel.

On 20 June 2024, around 450 people held a protest in front of the regional parliament in Palma de Mallorca (Islas Baleares) to call for the resignation of the president of the regional parliament (Vox), after he tore a picture of Aurora Picornell, a political activist who was tortured and executed without trial by Francoist forces during the Spanish Civil War, during a plenary session. Members of PSOE took part in the protest.

On 20 June 2024, people, including teachers, held protests in different schools in Palma de Mallorca (Islas Baleares) against the behavior of the regional parliament president (Vox) during a plenary session, in which he tore a photo of Aurora Picornell, a political activist who was tortured and executed without trial by Francoist forces during the Spanish Civil War. Protesters also expressed support for the Historical Memory Law.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of SOS Racism and LDH, people gathered in the Bastille Square, in Paris (Ile-de-France), to condemn the rape of a Jewish girl. The group protested against sexual violence and antisemitism.

On 20 June 2024, at the call CGT, several hundred culture workers and artists gathered in Paris (Ile-de-France), to protest against far-right ideology and to denounce the disintegration of public services.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the CGT, chemical industry workers gathered in front of the Ministry of Industry headquarters in Paris (Ile-de-France) to protest against the closure of job positions and against union discrimination.

On 20 June 2024, workers of Leonardo staged a protest with a rally and a two-hour strike in Pomigliano d'Arco (Campania) to ask for greater attention and more investments in the aeronautical sector in the Campania region and in Italy. The secretary general of UILM and UIL affiliates participated in the event.

source: CGTP: Confederacao Geral dos Trabalhadores Portugueses
notes: On 20 June 2024, CP workers held a protest at the train station of Campanha in Porto (Porto) to demand better working conditions.

source: CGTP: Confederacao Geral dos Trabalhadores Portugueses
notes: On 20 June 2024, retail and distribution workers held a protest in Porto (Porto) to demand better working conditions and a new collective labor agreement with a salary upgrade. The president of CGTP took part in the protest.

On 20 June 2024, around 300 people, including refugees, representatives of aid organizations, the refugee association 'We'll tackle it' (Wir packen's an) and 'Etehad', staged a protest near the venue of the Conference of State Interior Ministers in Potsdam (Brandenburg) against Germany's migration policy, the exclusion of refugees in policy discussions, and a policy of isolation. Simultaneously, members of the Yezidi community gathered nearby for a general ban on the deportation of Yazidis from Germany to Iraq and calling for permanent protection and security for genocide survivors. The protest was organized on the occasion of World Refugee Day and in the context of the ministers' ongoing discussions on migration policy.
On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, CFDT, UNSA, SUD, FSU and FO, around 1,500 people demonstrated in Rennes (Bretagne) to protest against far-right ideology and the RN party.

On 20 June 2024, a group of unidentified hooded individuals assaulted four RN activists, including an RN candidate, in a supermarket in Saint-Etienne (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The candidate was injured and taken to the hospital, and the suspects escaped. There were no fatalities.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of the cathedral parish in Schwerin, people, including the State Justice Minister (The Left) and the Catholic Archbishop of Hamburg, participated in a protest in Schwerin (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) and formed a human chain against racism. The context of the protest was a recent racist attack against a Ghanaian family in Grevesmuhlen.

On 20 June 2024, several labor groups held protests in Sevilla (Andalucia) during the local government's plenary session. Cab drivers, called by the Taxi Union of Sevilla (Union Sevillana del Taxi), protested against the liberalization of licenses, while farm laborers demanded the coverage of casualties, vacancies, and retirements.

On 20 June 2024, people, called by SATSE, CSIF, UGT, and CCOO, held a protest at the Andalusian Health Service in Sevilla (Andalucia) against the regional government's management of local healthcare services, notably in terms of resources and medical staff, claiming it was harmful to the system.

On 20 June 2024, activists from Just Stop Oil gathered at London Stansted Airport in Stansted Mountfitchet (England), where they sprayed orange paint on private jets, including one used by Taylor Swift, demanding an emergency treaty to end fossil fuels by 2030.

On 20 June 2024, around 50 parents, including members of the 'State parents' council' (Landeselternbeirat), staged a protest in Trier (Rheinland-Pfalz) for reliable transportation for pupils and to call for better contracts with bus companies. The protest was organized in the context of recent bus driver strikes.

On 20 June 2024, people held a protest in Utebo (Aragon) against the regional government's layoff plan for teaching staff across the region. Protesters demanded more resources and decent ratios per classroom.

On 20 June 2024, at the call of CGT, people gathered in front of the Sanofi headquarters in Vitry-sur-Seine (Ile-de-France), to protest against the announced layoffs and the closure of the oncology department.

On 20 June 2024, civil servants of the Justice Department, called by the STAJ, CCOO and CIGA unions, held a protest in Zaragoza (Aragon) to demand better working conditions, in particular, an increase in the general work allowance and the possibility of voluntary job mobility.
On 20 June 2024, crowds of people held a protest in Zaragoza (Aragon) against the demolition of a kiosk located in La Aljaferia Park. Protesters demanded it to be preserved and rehabilitated.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of people, called by the Zumaia Osasun Publikoaren Alde Basque association, held a protest in Zumaia (Pais Vasco) in defense of public healthcare, demanding more medical staff in the city's health centers.

On 20 June 2024, over 20 members of Mother Nature, dressed as ghosts and monks, staged a protest outside the Ministry of Environment in Tonle Basak, Chamkar Mon (Phnom Penh). They demanded the designation of Koh Kong Krao as a marine national park, citing the ministry's persistent failure to protect the area despite promises made by the Minister.

Other: On 20 June 2024, dozens of North Korean soldiers crossed the border of DMZ (Joint Security Area). South Korea fired warning shots immediately, but the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff acknowledged the border crossing seemed a mistake. It was the third time this month.

On 20 June 2024, members of KCTU-affiliated Korean Public Service And Transportation Workers' Union Education Workers Solidarity Division (KPTU EDUSOL) Jeonbuk branch held a press conference and picketed at Jeollabukdo Office of Education (Jeonju). They urged the authorities to improve poor working conditions of school meal workers during a summer heat wave.

On 20 June 2024, members of Korean Parents' Network for People with Disabilities (KPNPD) Daejeon branch held a rally near Daejeon Metropolitan City Hall (Daejeon - Seo). They called for a comprehensive support plan for people with developmental disabilities.

On 20 June 2024, members of Rainbow Refugee Network and Queers in Solidarity with Palestine (LGBTQ Group) held a press conference and picketed in front of the Embassy of Israel (Seoul City - Jongno). They condemned Israel's attack against Palestinian civilians. They demanded that Israel stop the massacre.

On 20 June 2024, residents of Cheongnim-dong held a rally at Pohang City Hall Plaza (Pohang). They condemned Pohang City for discharging wastewater from the Blue Valley Industrial Complex's secondary battery plant into Yeongil Bay, citing devastated coastal waters already suffering from various types of pollution.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Pan-Citizen Countermeasure Committee against Yeongnam Alps Cable Car held a press conference at Ulju-gun Office (Yul-ri, Cheongnyang-myeon, Ulju-gun), denouncing the authorities for advancing the funicular project without submitting the initial environmental impact assessment.

On 20 June 2024, councilors from Boeun, Okcheon, Yeongdong, and Goesan townships held a press conference at the Chungcheongbuk-do Provincial Office (Cheongju), displaying a banner. They urged the normalization of the medical system, prompt resolution between the government and doctors, and the return of medical professionals to their duties amid a doctors' crisis and strike.

On 20 June 2024, members of the KCTU Gyeongnam regional branch and Geoje regional branch held a press conference and picketed at Gyeongsangnam-do Provincial Government Office (Changwon), demanding the reversal of the decision not to establish a memorial for Korean victims of Japan's wartime forced labor in Geoje.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Korea Federation of Micro Enterprise (KFME) held a press conference in front of the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo), displaying a banner. They urged the authorities to reconsider the uniform application of the minimum wage rate, citing deteriorating business conditions, and appealed for supportive measures.

On 20 June 2024, family members of the deceased young worker involved in the accident at Jeonju Paper Company, along with civic groups, held a press conference with a banner at the Ministry of Employment and Labor Jeonju Branch (Jeonju). They called for an apology from the Company for the alleged industrial accident, the establishment of a robust safety system, and punishment under the Serious Accidents Punishment Act if negligence was found.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Ansan Citizens' Network for Healing and Reconciliation for Sungam Institute Victims and lawyers from Minbyun held a press conference in front of the Seoul Central District Prosecutors' Office (Seoul City - Seocho). They called on Gyeonggi Province to compensate for damages incurred by victims of forced labor and harsh treatment at the government-managed Sungam Institute.

On 20 June 2024, 24 women's rights organizations, including the Gyeongnam Women's Association United, held a press conference with a banner in front of the Changwon District Court (Changwon), urging aggravated punishment for the assailant who targeted a female part-time worker, citing the act as misogyny.

On 20 June 2024, members of the 2024 Homeless Housing Team, a coalition of 16 organizations, including Homeless Action and Dongcheon Foundation lawyers, held a press conference in front of the Seoul Metropolitan Government (Seoul City - Jung), urging intervention in the forced evictions of single-room ('goshiwon') residents near Hoehyeon Metro Station facing hardships.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Korean Public Service And Transportation Workers' Union Education Workers Solidarity Division (KPTU EDUSOL; KCTU affiliate) Jeonbuk branch held a press conference with a banner at Jeollabukdo Office of Education (Jeonju). They called for countermeasures against summer heat waves for school cafeteria workers, facility management workers, and cleaning workers, including installing cooling facilities in rest areas, guaranteeing respite rights, and suspending outdoor work during extreme conditions.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Korean Metal Workers' Union (KMWU; KCTU affiliate) Daegu branch held a press conference near the DPK Daegu Office (Daegu - Jung), urging the 22nd National Assembly to amend the national labor laws to align with fundamental International Labour Organization (ILO) conventions.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Chungbuk branch of the Korean Teachers and Education Workers Union (KTU; KCTU affiliate) held a press conference at the Chungcheongbuk-do Office of Education (Cheongju), criticizing the 'Elementary Skills Improvement Project' as ranking exams that encourage academic competition and private education.

On 20 June 2024, members of PSPD Center for People's Livelihood Improvement and People's Livelihood and Economy Institute held a press conference with a banner in front of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency (Seoul City - Jongno). They called for an investigation into the surge of spam text message incidents, citing violations of the Personal Information Protection Act and the Information and Communications Network Act.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Narinjara News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Thea Kan Htaung village (Ann township, Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), the military conducted airstrikes by firing two rockets on the village at around 11 am, hitting and destroying four residential buildings. A 4-year-old, a 17-year-old and a 25-year-old from a family were killed and a 45-year-old and a 68-year-old from the same family were injured.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Narinjara News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Sin U Taik village (Ann township, Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), the military conducted airstrikes on the village, hitting and destroying the village monastery. There were no casualties.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Narinjara News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Ka Zu Kaing village (coded as Zu Kaing) (Ann township, Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), the military conducted airstrikes on the village, hitting and destroying three houses. There were no casualties.

actors: Budalin Daung Man Aphwe: Budalin Prideful Peacock Group
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Ku Taw village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a combined force of the Budalin Prideful Peacock Group and their allied local defense forces attacked a military base camp by dropping six bombs attached to 4 drones at around 1 pm. The military also fired back small guns. The combined force lost two drones due to the military's jammer. Casualties unknown.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Chaung-U township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), a combined force of the Area 71 Defense Force, Northwest Plains Revolutionary Forces, Chindwin Land Defense Force, Black Hero Local PDF, Myingyan Danger Dynamite, United People's Army and the People's Liberation Army attacked a military convoy of five vehicles near Chaung-U township Livestock Farm with small guns and grenades at around 9:40 am. The military soldiers also fired back with small guns. Three military trucks were destroyed. DVB reported that 4 military soldiers were killed. Khit Thit Media reported that at least three military soldiers were killed. Fatalities coded as 3, using the lowest estimate.

On 20 June 2024, in Tin Thar village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military conducted drone strikes on the village at around 6 pm, hitting and injuring three 15-year-old students who were on their way to a tuition near the Se Htoo Seik area in No.6 ward.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia; Shan Herald Agency for News
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Lashio town (Lashio township, Lashio district, Shan-North state), a bomb explosion occurred on 6 Nyaung Oo Hpee Street in No.7 ward. The explosion occurred as a 13-year-old girl picked up a bomb and played with it at around 12:20 pm. Shan Herald Agency for News reported that the explosion injured three children, aged 13, 8, and 5. Shwe Phee Myay News Agency, DVB and RFA reported that the bomb explosion wounded four children.

On 20 June 2024, in Ma Yoe Kone village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military killed a 25-year-old IDP from Shwe Bo Gyi village, who came out to buy groceries, at noon.

actors: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Nyaung Chaung village (Maungdaw township, Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), the Arakan Army (AA) raided and attacked the military soldiers stationed at the village. Both sides then exchanged fire. The military soldiers then retreated to an area near the Bridge Asia Japan (BAJ) office in Myo Ma Ka Nyin Tan ward in Maungdaw town. Casualties unknown.

source: Khit Thit Media; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Ho Weik village (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military conducted airstrikes with two aircraft on the village at around 4:55 pm. A house and a monastery were destroyed. A local was injured.

actors: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Mogoke township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military attacked the TNLA base camps and both sides then exchanged fire. During the fight, the military conducted airstrikes and fired artillery rounds. The fighting occurred in three townships (Nawnghkio, Mogoke, and Mongmit) for three days (18 - 20 June), and a total of three members of the TNLA were killed and 6 others were injured. 3 fatalities split across 9 events (Nawnghkio, Mogoke and Mongmit townships between 18 to 20 June), and coded as 0 for this event.

actors: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Mongmit township (Mongmit district, Shan-North state), the military attacked the TNLA base camps and both sides then exchanged fire. During the fight, the military conducted airstrikes and fired artillery rounds. The fighting broke out in three townships (Nawnghkio, Mogoke, and Mongmit) for three days (18 - 20 June), and a total of three members of the TNLA were killed and 6 others were injured. 3 fatalities split across 9 events (Nawnghkio, Mogoke and Mongmit townships between 18 to 20 June), and coded as 0 for this event.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Mizzima; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Mon Yway village (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military from the Mya Pale security gate conducted two drone strikes on the village at around 2 pm. A building inside the Aung Chan Thar buddhist monastery compound was destroyed, and a woman was injured.

actors: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Nawnghkio township (Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), the military attacked the TNLA base camps and both sides then exchanged fire. During the fight, the military conducted airstrikes and fired artillery rounds. The fighting broke out in three townships (Nawnghkio, Mogoke, and Mongmit) for three days (18 - 20 June), and a total of three members of the TNLA were killed and 6 others were injured. 3 fatalities split across 9 events (Nawnghkio, Mogoke and Mongmit townships between 18 to 20 June), and coded as 0 for this event.

On 20 June 2024, near Inn Tein village (Pauk township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the Myanmar military forces launched airstrikes near the village at around 8:30 am. The sound wave of the explosion from the airstrikes killed a male civilian from Tin Ngoke who was tending goat near the village. There were no casualites.

On 20 June 2024, near Koke Ko Su village (Pauk township, Pakokku district, Magway region), intense fighting broke out between the Myanmar military troops and local PDFs near the village. The Myanmar military forces responded with airstrikes. Casualties unknown.

actors: KNU/KNLA: Karen National Union/Karen National Liberation Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Kywe Nwe Goke village (Phyu township, Taungoo district, Bago-East region), a combined force of the KNLA, People's Defense Force - Phyu, People's Defense Force - Thayarwady District and the Alawaka Column (People's Defense Force - Thaton District Battalion 3) attacked a military base camp at around 11 pm and both sides exchanged fire. During the fight, the combined force seized a revolver gun, a Uzi gun, four G-3 cartridges, 198 G-3 bullets, four Uzi cartridges, 20 MA-1 bullets, 16 pieces of 38 mm bullets, 60 pieces of 9 mm bullets, a notebook and 22,000 MMKs from the military base camp. The combined force then took control of the base camp and set it on fire. There was a fatality on the military side.

On 20 June 2024, in Len Hkan village (coded as Len Hkan (East)) (Pinlaung township, Pa-O Self-Administered Zone, Shan-South state), the military fired artillery rounds at night, hitting and injuring a family of four.

Displacement: On 20 June 2024, in Salingyi township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), over 15,000 locals from 15 villages, including Htan Taw, Oe Ma, Pa Laung, Ku Toet Kone, Wet Hma, Kan Taw, Shwe Hla, Ywar Shey, Thein Taw, Hnin Taw, Htan Taw Gyi, Yone Pin Yoe and Nyaung Pin Gyi villages, were forced to flee their homes due to military raiding the villages.

source: Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Taingen village (Tedim township, Falam district, Chin state), about 100 military soldiers engaged in intense fighting with the Civic Defense Militia - Siyin stationed at the Taingen base camp and both sides exchanged fire. The military regained the Taingen base camp as the Civic Defense Militia - Siyin retreated from the base camp. Casualties unknown.

source: Khit Thit Media; Narinjara News; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 20 June 2024, in Shwe Hlay village (Thandwe township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), the navy vessel stationed between Sin Gaung and Sin Kyet villages fired artillery rounds at around 11 pm and some of the rounds landed in Shwe Hlay village, hitting and killing an 88-year-old IDP woman, a 54-year-old IDP woman, and a 50-year-old IDP woman from Sin Gaung village. A 17-year-old youth and a 70-year-old Shwe Hlay villager were injured.

actors: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
notes: On 20 June 2024, between Pat Lel village and Nay Pu Taung area (coded as Toungup) (Toungup township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), the Arakan Army intercepted and attacked about 150 military soldiers heading to the Nay Pu Taung small outpost since morning and both sides exchanged fire for two days (20 - 21 June). During the fight, the Arakan Army blocked and attacked the military reinforcements from Toungup townships heading to the battlefield. The military from the IB-544 base and the Tet U Taung area fired artillery rounds on the battlefield. During the fight, the military also conducted airstrikes on the battlefield. There were nearly 60 fatalities, including a captain, on the military side split across two days (20 - 21 June), and coded as 30 for this event.

source: Karen Information Center News; Myanmar Now
notes: On 20 June 2024, near Nam War village (Waingmaw township, Myitkyina district, Kachin state), the military conducted drone strikes near the village at around 10:30 pm, hitting and killing a 40-year-old man who was working in a rubber field.
On 20 June 2024, nurses with National Nurses United gathered in Baltimore (Maryland) to call for safe staffing levels.
On 20 June 2024, a group of people with Renew Baltimore gathered in Baltimore (Maryland) to call for lower property taxes.

On 20 June 2024, workers picketed outside the Smart & Final grocery store distribution center in Commerce (California) to demand they not be laid off as part of consolidation with another center. The workers were organized by Teamsters Local 630.

On 20 June 2024, around 50 students and nonteaching staff members held a rally outside of Magruder Hall at Oregon State University in Corvallis (Oregon) to oppose the dismissal of seven employees at the college's veterinary teaching hospital.
Recruitment: On 20 June 2024, the Dewey Preppers held a recruitment and public information meeting in Dewey-Humboldt (Arizona).

On 20 June 2024, family and supporters of a 79-year old prisoner and member of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa held a demonstration in front of the Federal Courthouse in downtown Fargo (North Dakota) to call for his release before a parole commission issues its ruling on his status.
On 20 June 2024, half a dozen protesters staged a rally outside the Parkside Drive home in Hamilton (Ontario) to demand answers from the pet-sitter's home about the death of two dogs.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Hood River (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.
On 20 June 2024, people rallied at the capitol building in Lansing (Michigan) to call for lawmakers to raise the minimum wage to $15 per hour. The event was organized by One Fair Wage.

On 20 June 2024, pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment on the lawn outside the University Community Centre at Western University's campus in London (Ontario) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divest from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. This was the 46th day in a row of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. Another group of about 200 pro-Palestinian protesters gathered outside the graduation ceremony at the Richard Ivey School of Business. This campus demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Medford (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Milwaukie (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 20 June 2024, about 50 of the University Medical Center's nursing staff and members of National Nurses United gathered in New Orleans (Louisiana) to protest against workplace violence and demand action against it.

On 20 June 2024, pro-Palestinian protesters and defendants rallied at a park near the courthouse in New York - Manhattan (New York) to call for 'free Palestine' and to support Columbia University students and staff who were arrested on 30 April at a pro-Palestinian protest after the judge dismissed their cases. The rally took place amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023. In a counter-demonstration, a group of protesters rallied opposite the courthouse to oppose the judge's decision to dismiss cases against Columbia University students and staff who were arrested at a pro-Palestinian protest on 30 April. Protesters condemned the ruling for being different from those issued for the protesters who were arrested at the same event but were unaffiliated with the university.

On 20 June 2024, local residents, victims, and supporters rallied in front of City Hall in New York - Manhattan (New York) to demand that all e-bikes undergo mandatory registration, and to support the passage of Priscilla's Law which would put license plates on e-bikes after several people were injured and six people died in e-bike crashes. Queens Councilmember Robert Holden (D) spoke at the rally.

On 20 June 2024, pro-Palestinian protesters marched and rallied outside of Maersk office in New York - Manhattan (New York) to call for 'free Palestine' and an end to what they called a 'siege' of Gaza amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023. A few pro-Israel demonstrators marched behind the rally in support of Israel.

source: Make the Road New York; VOCAL-NY
notes: On 20 June 2024, protesters and members of Justice Committee, Homelessness Union, AQE New York, Jews for Racial & Economic Justice, VOCAL-NY, and Make the Road NY rallied at City Hall in New York - Manhattan (New York) to call on New York City Council to pass the budget with more funding for the 'People's budget' investing in education, libraries, and housing. Protesters also supported the CareNotCuts campaign, opposed the funding of police, and called for a police training center in Atlanta Forest to stop construction. Councilmember Pierina Sanchez (D) joined the rally.

On 20 June 2024, local residents and members of New Yorkers United for Child Care rallied at City Hall in New York - Manhattan (New York) to demonstrate against the proposed budget reduction for early childhood education programs. Protesters called for more investment in 3-K programs.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Newberg (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 20 June 2024, protesters and members of Earthjustice and the North Tonawanda Climate Smart Task Force rallied on Sherwood Avenue in North Tonawanda (New York) to demand that Gov. Hochul and the State Department of Environmental Conservation not extend an air permit application for Digihost/Fortista crypto-mining plant due to environmental concerns for the increase in greenhouse gas emissions and noise pollution. Protesters also called for a two-year moratorium on crypto-mining.

source: 5 On Your Side; St. Louis Post-Dispatch
notes: On 20 June 2024, around 40 students, teachers, parents, and members of the LGBTQ+ community gathered outside the Francis Howell School District Board of Education meeting in O'Fallon (Missouri) to demonstrate against three proposed policies which would allow any community member to challenge the 'appropriateness' of teaching materials, bar teachers from discussing gender identity without parent approval, and discipline teachers for campaigning for school board candidates.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Oregon City (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.
On 20 June 2024, demonstrators rallied outside City Hall in San Francisco (California) to demand the city address animal deaths at the San Francisco Zoo.

On 20 June 2024, nurses picketed outside Little Company of Mary Medical Center in Torrance (California) to demand safe staffing and a 'fair' contract. The nurses were organized by the California Nurses Association (affiliated with NNU).

On 20 June 2024, local residents of North Park held a rally at the city hall in Victoria (British Columbia) to protest against the city's plans for a new homeless service hub and drug consumption site on Dowler Place. Demonstrators did not want the services hub in their neighborhood and claimed they were not consulted.

On 20 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in West Haven-Sylvan (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage. U.S. Rep. Suzanne Bonamici (D), Oregon Nurses Association Executive Director and American Federation of Teachers President were also present.

On 20 June 2024, suspected NPA militants clashed with the military and Special Action Force in Barangay Abuyo (Alfonso Castaneda, Nueva Vizcaya, Cagayan Valley). Soldiers conducted aerial attacks against NPA positions. There were no casualties.

region: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
notes: On 20 June 2024, 2 people were wounded in a firefight between two rival clans affiliated with MILF in Barangay Meta (Datu Unsay, Maguindanao del Sur, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). Houses were burned during the clash. Authorities said the clans were involved in a rido (clan blood feud) and were engaged in political and land disputes with each other.

On 20 June 2024, a police asset was killed by armed drug suspects in Barangay Don Bosco, Paranaque City (Metropolitan Manila, National Capital Region). Authorities said the motive for the attack might be drug-related, as the victim was a police informant on illegal drug activities.

On 20 June 2024, more than 70 activists rallied outside Stamford Plaza Melbourne in Melbourne - Central, Victoria, against AUKUS. Some protesters held Palestinian flags. The event was called by No AUKUS Coalition Victoria and supported by the anti-Elbit campaign and Palestine supporters.

On 20 June 2024, a group of PMKRI members (likely to be Papuans) peacefully protested on Sorong-Aimas Road, Kilometer 16, Sorong city (Southwest Papua province). They demanded the investigation of a hit-and-run case in Sorong that killed a PMKRI member.

On 20 June 2024, a group of Greenpeace activists peacefully protested in front of the PT Unilever Indonesia company building at Green Office Park, BSD Grand Boulevard Road, BSD City, Cisauk district (Tangerang regency, Banten province). They criticized Unilever products' single-use plastic packaging and displayed thousands of plastic trash generated from Unilever products in front of the building.

On 20 June 2024, a group of people from the JSKK organization peacefully protested in front of the Presidential Palace in Central Jakarta city (Jakarta province) (coded as Jakarta - Central). They opposed the plan to revise the Indonesian Police Forces bill, claiming it might harm the country's democracy. They also demanded the resolution of human rights violation cases in Indonesia. It was a part of the Thursday Act movement.

On 20 June 2024, a group of laborers from the KSPSI organization peacefully protested in front of the police station on Jendral Ahmad Yani Road, Makassar city (South Sulawesi province). They opposed the Public Housing Saving program, which obliged them to spare 2.5 percent of their monthly salary. They claimed it would create a financial burden for them.

On 20 June 2024, hundreds of laborers peacefully protested in front of the council building on Diponegoro Road, Bandung city (West Java province). They opposed the Public Housing Saving program, which obliged them to spare 2.5 percent of their monthly salary. They claimed it would create a financial burden for them.

On 20 June 2024, a group of people from Ngemplak hamlet peacefully protested in front of the Al-Mahdiy Muslim boarding school in Pagerwojo village (Buduran district, Sidoarjo regency, East Java province). They demanded the closure of the school. They claimed the school staff committed sexual harassment against the students.

On 20 June 2024, a group of Muslim students from the PMII organization peacefully protested in front of the mayor's office on Merdeka Road, Palembang city (South Sumatra province). They demanded that the newly appointed acting mayor resolve the city's problems, including flood issues, road damage, and traffic jams.

On 20 June 2024, around 100 students from the PMII student organization peacefully protested in front of the police station in Situbondo district (Situbondo regency, East Java province). They opposed illegal mining activities in Situbondo without specifying the reason. They marched from Plaosa Road in the same district.

On 20 June 2024, around 20 Papuans from the Southwest Papuans Forum, supporters of a legislative member candidate from the Democrat Party, peacefully protested in front of the General Election Commission building in Sorong city (Southwest Papua province). They criticized the election result, claiming it was fraudulent.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of Papuans, including students and a lawyer, peacefully protested in front of a police station in Salatiga city (Central Java province). They criticized the forest exploitation in Sarmi regency by a company from Salatiga, the Bahana Lintas Nusantara (BLN) Group.

Around 20 June 2024 (as reported), hundreds of villagers from Lekopadis village peacefully protested in front of the regent's office on Manunggal Road, Madatte sub-district, Polewali district (Polewali Mandar regency, West Sulawesi province). They demanded the resignation of the Lekopadis village head, claiming he was involved in a corruption case.

On 20 June 2024, a group of people from the Democracy and Justice People's Movement (GRDK) peacefully protested in front of the court building in Surabaya city (East Java province). They demanded the investigation of a fake academic title claimed by a politician during his campaign.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of parents peacefully protested in front of the Indonesian Ombudsman office in Palembang city (South Sumatra province). They criticized the Indonesian Ombudsman's new regulation regarding the student selection process in the new school term.

On 20 June 2024, dozens of villagers from Lekopadis village peacefully protested in front of the regent's office on Manunggal Road, Madatte sub-district, Polewali district (Polewali Mandar regency, West Sulawesi province). They voiced support for the village head, who was accused of being involved in a corruption case. Previously, a group of people demanded he resign (coded separately).

On 20 June 2024, 23 people, including the NAJAT representative, protested in front of Sumisho Aero-Systems Corporation (Tokyo - Chiyoda) and then moved to Kawasaki Heavy Industries (Tokyo - Minato) to criticize their business relationships with Israel. They blamed the Israeli attack on Gaza and held Palestine's flags. The protests were part of the two-day '#NO Slaughter Drone 4 Companies Tour Demonstration.' The Association of National Defense Academy Graduates against Genocide organized the event.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Zenroren held a press conference inside the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare in Tokyo - Chiyoda, holding a banner that read, 'Minimum wage anywhere now over JPY 1,500!' They demanded that the Ministry realize a nationwide uniform minimum wage system and raise the minimum wage to JPY 1,500.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Ushiku Immigration Detention Center Problem Study Group, a citizens' group supporting foreign detainees at the East Japan Immigration Center, protested in front of Ushiku station in Ushiku, Ibaraki, to mark World Refugee Day. They called on the government to recognize refugees.
On 20 June 2024, people staged a standing in front of Shinjuku station in Tokyo - Shinjuku to mark World Refugee Day.

On 20 June 2024, people, including the representative of the Gamahuya, protested at the Prefectural Plaza in Naha, Okinawa, against the government's plan to use soil from southern Okinawa Island, where the remains of Okinawa War victims rest, for landfill in the construction of the new Henoko base for the U.S. military. On the same day, the Gamahuya member began a hunger strike.

On 20 June 2024, members of the National Wing movement within the DP gathered with banners outside the DP headquarters in Ulaanbaatar - Chingeltei. The protesters demanded the resignation of the party leader over allegations of embezzling funds from the Education Loan Fund and placing associates in key positions.

On 20 June 2024, one DPP legislator, one former DPP legislator, DPP Nantou County councilors, and hundreds of citizens gathered at a protest rally with placards and chants in Nantou City (Nantou). They demanded the protection of democracy and freedom by opposing the perceived abuse of the legislative process by the KMT and TPP.

On 20 June 2024, a DPP Kaohsiung City councilor and students held a press conference with placards in Kaohsiung City (Kaohsiung City). They demanded an end to the alleged constitutional abuses and undemocratic reforms pushed by the TPP and KMT, and called on KMT Kaohsiung legislators to repeal the reform bills. The councilor and students also held an outside press conference in Kaohsiung City on the same day.

On 20 June 2024, members of the Formosa Plastics Corporation Ha Tinh Monitoring Coalition and the TTNC: Taiwan Transnational Corporations Watch held a press conference with placards and banners at a shareholder meeting at the Formosa Plastics Corporation headquarters in Taipei City - Songshan district (Taipei City). They demanded that the Formosa Plastics Corporation immediately divest from Russian coal.

On 19 June 2024, NDC private security guards beat and seriously injured a member of the Tertiary Students Confederacy of the New Patriotic Party (NPP) - TESCON in Accra (Accra, Greater Accra). The victim was attacked after he allegedly disrespected the NDC party's flagbearer, former President John Dramani Mahama who was giving a speech at the Christian Service University 50th anniversary event. It is alleged that the private security guards assaulted several other students.
On 19 June 2024, a mob almost lynched a suspected LGBTQ+ member in Assin Fosu (Assin North, Central) for allegedly trying to have an affair with a man.

On 19 June 2024, the Locked-Up Investment Bondholders' Forum protested at the Finance Ministry for the third consecutive week in Accra (Accra, Greater Accra), demanding the release of their locked-up funds from NDK Finance and three other deposit-taking institutions. The protesters further demanded that the Bank of Ghana (BoG) and Finance Ministry declare as insolvent and revoke the licenses of four deposit-taking institutions that have failed to release their funds to them.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of traditional fishers held a protest sit-in in Nouadhibou (Dakhlet Nouadhibou, Dakhlet Nouadhibou) to denounce the increase of the annual fishing ban period by the Ministry of Fishery.

On 19 June 2024, members of the student union government of Moshood Abiola polytechnic demonstrated in Abeokuta (Abeokuta South, Ogun) and disrupted the examinations at the school over claims of the school management's incompetence.

On 19 June 2024, NSVC and Sara-Suka Cult militia clashed and killed one person in the Dadin-Kowa and Tudun-Wada areas of Kontagora (Kontagora, Niger). The two groups, armed with cutlasses and other dangerous weapons, injured five others, including a member of NSVC. The police arrested the leader of Sara Suka and two others as they regrouped for a reprisal on the following day.

On 19 June 2024, suspected Fulani pastoralists attacked and killed two people at the palace of the district head in Chinkai, also spelt as Chinka (Wukari, Taraba). They opened fire sporadically as they entered the town, and the residents scampered for safety.

The armed group set fire to the trucks and destroyed it. Al Shabaab suspected the vehicles were carrying logistics to security forces in Middle Shabelle.

Movement of forces: On 19 June 2024, several Al Shabaab fighters arrived in Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), Dhagaxow, Shanlow, and Xawaadleey villages (coded separately). The armed group fighters were seen taking positions and patrolling along the Balcad- Mogadishu road.

Movement of forces: On 19 June 2024, several Al Shabaab fighters arrived in Shanlow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), Dhagaxow, Galoley, and Xawaadleey villages (coded separately). The armed group fighters were seen taking positions and patrolling along the Balcad- Mogadishu road.

Movement of forces: On 19 June 2024, several Al Shabaab fighters arrived in Xawaadleey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), Dhagaxow, Shanlow, and Galoley village (coded separately). The armed group fighters were seen taking positions and patrolling along the Balcad- Mogadishu road.

On 19 June 2024, MK youth members staged a protest outside the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) against the Government of National Unity (GNU) formed by the African National Congress (ANC) and Democratic Alliance (DA). They accused the ANC of being sell-outs and the suspected rigging in the recent elections, claiming nine million votes were unaccounted for. The government of national unity (GNU) was proposed because the African National Congress (ANC) lost its parliamentary majority for the first time since the country's democratic elections in 1994 and required the support of other parties to govern.

On 19 June 2024, protesters gathered at Church Square holding placards that read: 'No to DA-ANC' in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) against the inclusion of the Democratic Alliance (DA) in the Government of National Unity (GNU). They viewed this inclusion as a form of 'new apartheid' and opposed the GNU structure. The government of national unity (GNU) was proposed because the African National Congress (ANC) lost its parliamentary majority for the first time since the country's democratic elections in 1994 and required the support of other parties to govern effectively. The protesters intended to march from Church Square to the Union Buildings in Pretoria, however, they were stopped by police before reaching the Union Buildings. The police escorted them to the Pretoria Museum and prevented them from continuing their march.

On 19 June 2024, for the second day, MK members gathered outside the Palm Ridge Magistrates Court in Palm Ridge (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng), demanding that bail be denied to the suspects arrested in connection with the murders of their fellow members after a confrontation with a taxi driver and subsequent involvement of members of a crime-fighting unit (The Star) who resorted to using excessive force, leading to the deaths of the victims.

On 19 June 2024, unknown armed men attacked a boat at a fishing site in Baidit payam (Bor South county, Jonglei state). 2 fishermen were killed. The victims are likely Bor Dinka, based on the location.

On 19 June 2024, for the fifth day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county including in Pulturuk and Chuil payams (location coded to Pulturuk, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Three children aged five to seven were abducted. Fatalities split over the five days, coded as 3.

On 19 June 2024, SSPDF (military) and armed local youths from Yirol East county (likely Ciec Dinka pastoralists, based on the location) pursued and clashed with armed raiders suspected of being from Panyijar county (likely Nyong Nuer, based on the county), following a goat raid at Yinhkar village in Billing boma (located coded to Billing in Adior, Yirol East county, Lakes state). 6 people were killed (3 SSPDF soldiers and 3 armed locals). 2 individuals were injured. During the raid, an elderly woman was abducted but later released. All the raided goats were recovered.

On 19 June 2024, residents held a protest in Jikharra (Al Wahat, East) to demand the release of a citizen who had been arrested after sharing a video on social media complaining about the lack of gasoline and living conditions in the region. They also called for an improvement in health, public administration, and the provision of more gasoline services.

On 19 June 2024, unknown gunmen shot and killed three civilians in separate incidents that occurred in three different neighborhoods in Az Zawiyah (Az Zawiyah, West). It is not clear whether one or more unidentified armed groups are involved. No further information is available.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of activists staged a protest sit-in in front of the parliament in Rabat, Hassan (Rabat, Rabat-Sale-Kenitra) to denounce Israeli military operations in Gaza and Morocco's normalization deal with Israel. The protest was organized by the Working for Palestine.
On 19 June 2024, RSF shot and killed a resident in Faris Al Kitab (Al Hasahisa, Al Jazirah). Motivation unknown/not reported.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), Zankaha Al Khawalda, Wad Al Bur, and Wad Rahma communal militias clashed with RSF in Wad Matar (Janub Al Jazirah) after RSF looted nearby Najaru village (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 19 June 2024, clashes between RSF, backed by allied militias (described as Arab militias, coded as Darfur Arab militia), and SAF, backed by police and Darfur Joint Forces/JSAMF continued in north El Fasher (Al Fasher, North Darfur), with artillery shelling being reported. RSF advanced from the southern front into the city and were repelled by the Joint forces. About 40 households were displaced. Many civilians were killed. Unspecified fatalities coded as 10.

On 19 June 2024, health workers and university faculty protested at the Weizmann Institute of Science in Rehovot (HaMerkaz) against the recent increase in police violence at anti-government demonstrations, specifically regarding recent incidents of violence against doctors present at the protests.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of health workers and university faculty protested at the Tel HaShomer Hospital in Ramat Gan (Tel Aviv) against the recent increase in police violence at anti-government demonstrations, specifically regarding recent incidents of violence against doctors present at the protests.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of displaced residents of northern Israel set up an encampment and protested outside of Prime Minister Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea (Hadera, Haifa) against the Netanyahu government. Protesters also spoke out against the government's inability to address the destruction of northern communities and the displacement of northern Israeli residents.

On 19 June 2024, about 1,000 protested in Ashqelon (HaDarom), calling for early elections and Netanyahu's dismissal due to the government's handling of the Israel-Hamas War. Protesters also called on the government to secure the immediate release of all hostages being held in Gaza. During the protest, some government supporters threw eggs at protesters and shouted insults.

On 19 June 2024, about 150 local residents protested in Haifa city, against the municipality's planned solution to the 'pig problem' in the city. Protesters called for a more humane solution, instead of killing the pigs.

On 19 June 2024, anti-government activists held a protest inside the gallery area of the Knesset in Jerusalem - Givat Ram (Judean Mountains). Protesters waved signs, knocked on the glass windows, spoke out against the government, and called for the release of hostages. Knesset guards physically removed protesters.
