On 19 June 2024, in Santiago Tilapa, Mexico, for a second consecutive day, residents protested and blocked the Tenango-La Marquesa highway to demand access to water services.

On 19 June 2024, in Apatzingan de la Constitucion, Michoacan de Ocampo, state police officers protested and blocked the entrance of headquarters to demand the dismissal of the head of guard and better working conditions.

On 19 June 2024, in La Piedad de Cabadas, Michoacan de Ocampo, state police officers protested and blocked the entrance of headquarters to demand the dismissal of the head of guard and better working conditions.
On 19 June 2024, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, state police officers protested and blocked the entrance of headquarters to demand the dismissal of the head of guard and better working conditions.

On 19 June 2024, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals in a taxi opened fire at two men on a motorcycle in Colonia Los Laureles (drive-by). Both men were left uninjured but one boy was hit by a stray bullet and died. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2024, in Heroica Zitacuaro, Michoacan de Ocampo, state police officers protested and blocked the entrance of headquarters to demand the dismissal of the head of guard and better working conditions.

actors: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Atlatlahucan, Morelos, armed individuals opened fire at military officers, state police and the National Guard when they carried out a search of a house. Three people were injured, including one woman. Authorities seized weapons, drugs, vests, motorcycles and a truck. It is suspected that the arrested men are linked to a criminal group and have a history of extortion. There were no fatalities.
On 19 June 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, armed men in a vehicle chased a 16-year-old girl in Colonia Obrerista (drive-by). The victim was injured by a gun wound in her shoulder. 1 injury.

On 19 June 2024, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, feminist organizations protested outside the offices of the Civil Registry and the government palace to denounce the 'unjustified' dismissal of the head of the Civil Registry of Oaxaca. Protesters demanded justice and an end to gender violence within the government cabinet.

On 19 June 2024, in San Martin de los Cansecos, Oaxaca, two armed individuals intercepted a man and his wife on the highway San Martin de los Cansecos, tied up the man and then shot him. The individual died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 19 June 2024, in Sanctorum, Puebla, unknown armed individuals shot and killed a man inside a building. The attack is being linked to the settling of scores between criminal groups. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2024, in Tehuacan, Puebla, two armed individuals on two motorcycles chased a man and shot him on the Tehuacan-Orizaba highway (drive-by). The victim died as a result. The attack is believed to be linked to the settling of scores. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2024, in Palmillas, Queretaro, about 300 farmers from Hidalgo and Queretaro protested and blocked the Palmillas tollbooth at KM 63 on the Mexico-Queretaro highway to demand attention from authorities and to denounce the presence of planes in the air above their farms that generate chemicals. Protesters demanded access to water services as well.
Security measures: On 19 June 2024, in the state of Sinaloa (coded to capital Culiacan Rosales), 600 military officers were deployed to provide greater security in the state.

On 19 June 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Rosales, armed individuals opened fire from a vehicle and shot a man driving in his vehicle in the Humaya sector (drive-by). The man was transported to the hospital where he died. The victim was identified as a sports promoter. 1 fatality.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands tied to his back and several gunshot wounds in fraccionamiento Alturas del Sur. 1 fatality.
On 19 June 2024, in Tecolutilla, Tabasco, a couple of armed men opened fire at two people selling tacos at a taco stand. Both men were injured as a result. 2 injuries.

On 19 June 2024, in Mecoacan, Tabasco, armed individuals in two vehicles shot and injured two off-duty police officers after they finished their shift. One man died and the other was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Nogales, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, for a second consecutive day, students, teachers and parents protested and blocked a high school to denounce the former head of the board accused of irregularities, threats and intimidation and for immediate accountability of the former head.

actors: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 19 June 2024, in San Andres Tuxtla, Puebla, merchants demonstrated outside the municipal palace to demand justice from the mayor for the death of a fellow merchant at the hands of police officers after being arrested during a demonstration (coded separately). According to the rioters the demonstrator died from police beatings while the official version indicates that he died of a heart attack. The rioters held up the National Guard patrol car in which the Morena party mayoress was trying to flee in disguise and vandalized the vehicle. The mayor was forced to get out of the vehicle and walk to the Prosecutor's Office to testify about the event.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Sayula de Aleman, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, at least three armed men broke into a ranch and killed a man in Colonia Nueva Esperanza. The man was identified as involved in migrant trafficking. 1 fatality.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Veracruz, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents of different neighborhoods protested outside the offices of the Metropolitan Water and Sanitation group to demand adequate services in water distribution.

On 19 June 2024, in Merida, Yucatan, for the second consecutive day, teachers and members of the SNTE protested at the Government palace to demand salary increases. Upon the protest, the salary increase was authorized by the federal government.

On 19 June 2024, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), around 12,000 teachers marched to oppose the proposed education reform. The protest was under the call from the Colombian Federation of Educators (FECODE) for the 'Second Grand Takeover of Bogota'. The demonstrations caused significant traffic disruptions at Seventh Road with 26 Street, 26 Street with 19 Road, and Seventh Road with 118 Street, with the protests concluding at the Bolivar Square. Multiple public bus stations experienced closures, such as San Victorino, Las Nieves, San Diego, and Museo Nacional, impacting around 30,000 daily commuters.

On 19 June 2024, in Bucaramanga (Santander), members of the Santander Educators Union (SES), in coordination with the Colombian Federation of Education Workers (FECODE), carried out a sit-in in front of the Palacio Amarillo, protesting for over two hours. The teachers demanded the immediate dismantling of the proposed education bill, respect for public education, and state funding.

On 19 June 2024, in Cartagena (Bolivar), a group of parents and caregivers protested in front of EPS Sanitas against the cancellation of transportation services for children requiring medical treatments. The service was terminated on June 17. The protesters demanded the immediate reinstatement of transportation services to prevent further disruption of the children's medical care.

On 19 June 2024, in Cucuta - Central (Norte de Santander), at least 100 members of the Guardia Campesina carried out a sit-in in front of the Governorate of the Norte de Santander to support and protect 15 community leaders negotiating with national and departmental governments. The protesters demanded the resolution of structural issues for the Catatumbo region, including the matter of illicit crops, for which the peasants proposed a new substitution program. Protesters held the sit-in for two consecutive days.

On 19 June 2024, near Curumani (Cesar), unidentified individuals shot against the vehicle of an Indigenous leader and member of the national Truth Commission. Armed men fired seven shots after being unable to stop the vehicle. The victim was also the Secretary-General of the Instance of Authorities of Indigenous, Black, Palenquero, and Afro-Colombian Peoples (INEANPE). There were no casualties.

On 19 June 2024, In Florian (Santander), members of the Santander Educators Union (SES), in coordination with the Colombian Federation of Education Workers (FECODE), led a demonstration with public school teachers demanding the rejection of the proposed education bill.

Property destruction: On 19 June 2024, in Los Rastrojos (Cauca), military forces found and seized a cocaine laboratory belonging to an unidentified group. The laboratory stored more than 600 kg of coca leaves ready for processing and 440 gallons of coca base paste in different stages of production, with an estimated value of 500 million Pesos.
On 19 June 2024, in Monteria (Cordoba), masked rioters blocked the Cerete - Monteria road and vandalized buildings inside the Cordoba University. The reason for the demonstration is unknown.

Property destruction: On 19 June 2024, in a rural area of the Pueblo Rico municipality (Risaralda), ELN members closed down a road in the Santa Rita vereda and set fire to a dump truck. Afterwards, military forces approached the area and clashed with the ELN members (coded separately).

On 19 June 2024, in a rural area of the Pueblo Rico municipality (Risaralda), ELN members clashed with military forces in the Santa Rita vereda after they had set fire to a dump truck (coded separately). There were no casualties.

actors: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
notes: Property destruction: On 19 June 2024, in a rural area of the Puerto Asis municipality (Putumayo), military forces seized 2,148 kg of marijuana that belonged to the Second Marquetalia in the Puerto Gallo vereda, valued in at least 79 million dollars.

actors: FARC Dissident - Jaime Martinez: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Jaime Martinez)
notes: On 19 June 2024, in the Robles corregimiento (Valle del Cauca), Jaime Martinez FARC Dissidents shot against a police station for over one hour. Military forces clashed with the dissidents, in support of the police forces, resulting in one soldier injured. The next day, in Timba, two individuals were captured as suspects for the attack, with four bars of pentonite, a revolver with six cartridges, propaganda, and three motorcycles. There were no fatalities.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in a rural area of the San Andres De Cuerquia municipality (Antioquia), military forces clashed with Gulf Clan members in the Montana Adentro vereda, resulting in two arrested and one killed. Additionally, military forces seized a 5.56 caliber Galil rifle, two 9 mm caliber pistols, a 16 caliber shotgun, a 38 caliber revolver, five metal suppliers for a 5.56 rifle, two suppliers for a 9 mm pistol, ammunition, communications materials, quartermaster materials, 499 doses of narcotics, and material for military intelligence. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2024, in Santa Marta (Magdalena), residents of the Colinas de El Pando neighborhood threw rocks against police officers when they were arresting a suspect of damaging a local business. There were no casualties.

Defusal: On 19 June 2024, between the Simiti and San Pablo municipalities (Bolivar), military forces deactivated a gas cylinder bomb placed next to the road by unidentified individuals earlier that morning.

On 19 June 2024, near the Velez municipality (Santander), teachers and members of the Santander Educators Union (SES), in coordination with the Colombian Federation of Education Workers (FECODE), held a protest in El Penon to demand the dismantling of the proposed education bill.

On 19 June 2024, in Arroyito (Concepcion), residents gathered in front of the municipality to reject the Municipal Board's approval of the mayor's accounts declarations, accusing her of mismanagement. The participants threw eggs and garbage at a councilor who was addressing the Municipality.

On 19 June 2024, in Asuncion (Asuncion), workers, retirees, and cancer patients protested in front of the Central Fund of the Social Security Institute (IPS) to demand an increase in pensions, reject the opening of the medical institution's care for those who are not insured, as well as denounce the precariousness of the health services offered by the IPS. The mobilization took place in support of protesters' representatives who, in parallel, met with IPS authorities to address their demands.

source: Biobio Chile; Cooperativa (Chile); El Austral Temuco
notes: Property destruction: On 19 June 2024, near Comunidad Martin Cayuqueo (Araucania), around four unidentified and hooded individuals threatened a worker with weapons, before setting on fire two pieces of forestry machinery belonging to the Sofomad S.P.A. company and stealing property near Km 2 of road S-494. No banners or pamphlets were found at the site, but the Araucania region frequently experiences similar arson attacks against forestry companies perpetrated by Indigenous militias demanding land restitution.

On 19 June 2024, in Coronel (Biobio), around 100 unionized, temporary stevedores blocked the southern access to the Port of Coronel to demonstrate against the creation of a new trade union by the managing company's director. The demonstrators argued that the new union excluded workers who had been on strike between March and May. There were reports of isolated fistfights between workers belonging to the different unions.

On 19 June 2024, around Guayaibi (San Pedro), farmers protested by cutting route PY08 at km 268 for the second consecutive day to demand that the government provide credit under favorable conditions. The protesters highlighted that agricultural production yields have decreased over the past three years due to drought and other climatic factors, leading to a complex economic situation for many. The protest ended in the afternoon following an agreement between the representatives of the producers and the Minister of Agriculture.

On 19 June 2024, in Iquique (Tarapaca), around 50 families belonging to the Portada Mar Pacifico Norte housing committee gathered outside the offices of the Ministry of Housing and Urban Planning (Minvu) to protest against authorities' delay in authorizing the construction site. The housing committee was formed when a trade union at the free-trade zone donated land to its members in 2017.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in Juliaca (Puno), a group of locals, merchants, public transport drivers and Peasant Patrols (Rondas Campesinas) carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city and blocking some streets, among them, the exit to Huancane municipality, near Independencia bridge, and the exit to Arequipa and Cusco with tires and other objects set on fire. Demonstrators were repudiating the killing of a social leader (coded separately), as well as demonstrating against night establishments in the city and denouncing rising crime rates and lack of actions from the administration. Some demonstrators destroyed and looted some night establishments. A 48-hour strike was called demanding public security and police restructuring.

On 19 June 2024, in La Paz (La Paz), a group of small business owners and entrepreneurs and members of the Departmental Federation of Micro and Small Businesses (Fedemype) and the Regional Federation of Micro and Small Enterprises (Fermype) carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city and blocking the Mariscal Santa Cruz Av., denouncing dollar and commodity price increases and calling for intervention from the national government, as well as demanding the resignation of the deputy minister of micro-economy.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in Las Bambas (Apurimac), a group of locals from five different districts in Cotabambas and one from Grau provinces carried out a demonstration by blocking a road near a mining company and partially blocking some of the company's access, demanding an annual social economic compensation from the company and the province for its operation in the area. Demonstrators called a 48-hour strike as part of their demonstration.

source: Diario El Dia; El Libertador; La Nacion (Argentina); La Voz del Interior (Argentina)
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Nueve de Julio (Corrientes), hundreds of friends and relatives of a minor who disappeared in previous days marched from Central Square to the mayor's house to demand clarification and justice for the case.

On 19 June 2024, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), local residents of Carapungo parish organized as a vigilante group tied up and beat a suspected robber of foreign nationality. The suspect was arrested but released minutes later for lack of police complaints. There were no fatalities.

source: El Deber; El Diario (Bolivia); El Mundo (Bolivia)
notes: On 19 June 2024, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), thousands of healthcare workers, university students, and teachers at a local university carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city protesting against a bill (035) that according to demonstrators would force the sectors to retire at age the of 65 years old. Healthcare workers called for a 96-hour strike nationwide as part of their demonstration.

source: Correo del Sur; La Razon (Bolivia); Los Tiempos (Bolivia)
notes: Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in Santa Cruz de la Sierra (Santa Cruz), police forces and Special Police Investigative Centre officers (CEIP) arrested a leader of the First Capital Command (PCC) Brazilian gang in the Ucebol sector, during a police operation. On 19 June 2024, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), family members of prisoners from the Bellavista prison carrying signs held a peaceful sit-in demanding to see their imprisoned relatives which they were not allowed to see for five months. Since the state of emergency began the Armed Forces entered the prisons and confiscated all cell phones and food.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), in Trujillo (La Libertad), a group of locals and business owners from Miraflores and Pucara localities captured, held and severely beat a man accusing him of theft in a local business. The crowd set the victim and his motorcycle on fire. Another suspect managed to flee. Police forces intervened taking the individual to hospital. There were no fatalities.

On 19 June 2024, at least 10-15 people assaulted and severely injured a journalist with hockey sticks in Kushtia city (Kushtia Sadar, Khulna), in a targeted attack over unknown reasons. Police suspect a local dispute behind the incident.

Kuki civil societies made conflicting claims that Manipur police commandos along with armed Meitei assailants attacked Phaitol villagers and armed Kuki assailants. There were no casualties.

On 19 June 2024, two local groups clashed using guns in Alipura village of Nazarpur union, Narsingdi Sadar upazila (coded as Narsingdi, Dhaka), after a long-standing dispute over establishing dominance in the area. At least 6 people were injured in the clash, including an SI of police force.

On 19 June 2024, journalists belonging to Kushtia Press Club staged a protest rally in Kushtia city (Kushtia Sadar, Khulna), against the attack on a journalists by unidentified assailants over unknown reasons.

On 19 June 2024, suspected armed Kuki assailants abducted Kharam Thadoi's (Aimol) village chief and his son near Zonal Education Office (ZEO) in Kangpokpi town (Kangpokpi, Manipur) over suspected land dispute case amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. They were later released near Bongmoul (Laikop).

Police forces also seized Rs 1.15 lakh in cash, a stolen two-wheeler scooter, mobile phones, a sling bag containing incriminating documents along with a wallet.

On 19 June 2024, TMC members abducted and assaulted a BJP member when they did not find his son also a BJP member at their residence at Bhagabanpur town (Purba Medinipur district, WB), after the Lok Sabha election. He was killed in the incident.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), unidentified armed assailants shot and killed a Meitei man at Sangaiyumpham Part 1 Sabal Leikai in Sangaiyumpham village (Thoubal, Manipur) over unknown reasons amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. The deceased was a village volunteer since the onset of the ethnic conflict.

Weapons seizure: On 19 June 2024, police forces retrieved arms and ammunition belonging to unidentified armed assailants (likely Meitei based on geography) after a search operation in the general area of Yangoi in Imphal West (coded to Imphal city, Imphal West, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Recovered items included two SBBL Guns, one Carbine with one Magazine, 12 No. 36 Hand Grenades, seven Detonators, six Tube launching, ten live ammunitions, two 80 smoke hand grenades and one wireless motorola set with one charger.

On 19 June 2024, TMC members as claimed by BJP attacked a BJP member who in a bid to escape met with an accident at Cooch Behar district (WB), after the Lok Sabha election. He was killed in the incident.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
notes: On 19 June 2024, local villagers pelted stones at BSF personnel and a woman attacked a personnel with an axe to assist Bangladeshi smugglers escape Kuliang village (East Jaintia Hills, Meghalaya) after 30-35 of them entered to smuggle sugar. 2 BSF personnel sustained injuries. Conflicting claims were made by the woman and a FIR was filed against BSF personnel for attacking her residence twice, physically assaulting her family, threatening them and sexually assaulting her daughter. BSF denied claims.

On 19 June 2024, a mob of 200 from the Kuki community detained a truck belonging to a Meitei and set it on fire near Alex Farm on National Highway 2 between Kangpokpi town and Changoubung (coded to Kangpokpi town, Kangpokpi, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Police forces, Assam Rifles and CRPF personnel fired several rounds (likely aerial due to lack of injuries) to disperse the mob and also rescued a passenger vehicle from the mob.

On 19 June 2024, AASU activists staged a protest and burned the effigy of Brahmaputra Valley Fertiliser Corporation Limited (BVFCL)'s Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) in front of BVFCL's main gate in Namrup town (Dibrugarh, Assam) condemning the irregularities and suspected corruption in the appointment of over 800 fertilizer dealers. Protesters also demanded the resignation of the CMD.

On 19 June 2024, a large number of AASU activists, students and locals staged a protest near Dimoria College Gate in Khetri village (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam) condemning the hike in prices of essential commodities in Assam.

On 19 June 2024, CPI-M staged a human chain protest at Bamunimaidam locality in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam) condemning the lack of public safety, pollution and issues caused due the ongoing flyover construction from Dighalipukhuri to Noonmati locality.
On 19 June 2024, a large number professionals from the Dogra community held a protest march at Jammu city (J&K) to demand broadcast of a satellite Duggar language channel in the Jammu region.

On 19 June 2024, a large number of locals led by former panches (village government heads) held a protest at Beri Pattan town (Rajouri district, J&K) against the water department over lack of water supply in the area.

On 19 June 2024, medical professionals held a protest at Kolkata city (WB) to demand a judicial probe into irregularities in the conduct of the national level entrance examination for medical students.
On 19 June 2024, locals led by JKNPP members held a protest at Udhampur city (J&K) against the water department over lack of water supply in the area.
On 19 June 2024, waste collectors held a protest at Udhampur city (J&K) over not receiving pending wages for over four months.

On 19 June 2024, locals staged a road block protest and blocked National Highway 8 in Srirampur village (Unakoti, Tripura) condemning the administration for their inaction over the long standing water logging issue in the area. Protesters lifted the blockade after receiving assurances from a CPI-M MLA.
On 19 June 2024, locals held a protest at Dhrella in Kulwanta block area (Udhampur district, J&K) against the water department over lack of water supply in a school in the area.
On 19 June 2024, residents held a protest at Buran Pattan area in Baramulla district (J&K) against the power department over frequent power cuts in the area.
On 19 June 2024, locals held a protest at Karnah town (Kupwara district, J&K) against the power department over doubling of the monthly power bills.

On 19 June 2024, relatives held a protest demonstration outside the press club in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh), after a police personnel killed an under-trial prisoner at Larkana Central Prison to avenge murder of his maternal uncle.
On 19 June 2024, residents held a protest demonstration in Jam Nawaz Ali town (Sanghar, Sindh), against the disruption of electricity for 3 days due to a faulty transformer.

On 19 June 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) detonated at least four explosives near the ISI headquarters (coded as military) in Qaziabad area of Nushki district (Nushki, Balochistan) after which military forces opened retaliatory fire. Casualties unknown.

On 19 June 2024, militants (coded as Baloch Separatists) conducted a remote explosive attack targeting ground military personnel patrolling in Pir Koh area (Dera Bugti, Balochistan). Casualties unknown.

notes: On 19 June 2024, BLA militants fired several shells from grenade launchers targeting the ISI and MI offices (coded as military) near Degree College Road in Turbat city (Kech, Balochistan). BLA claim military personnel suffered casualties. Casualties unknown.

On 19 June 2024, a cadre associated with Darekasa Dalam (armed squad) of the CPI (Maoist), with a reward of INR 700000, surrendered to the Police in Gondia district (coded to Gondiya, Maharashtra). The surrendered cadre was also the bodyguard of a senior Naxal-Maoist leader.

The bombs were wrapped in a plastic cover and was initially discovered by traders.

On 19 June 2024, members of the BJP, including MPs, staged protest marches at various places in Delhi (coded as Delhi - New Delhi city (Delhi)) condemning the AAP-led state government for failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 19 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by an MP, staged a protest march at Moti Bagh next to the Delhi - Vasant Vihar area (New Delhi, Delhi) condemning the AAP-led state government for failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 19 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by an MP, staged a protest march along Mandira Road in the Delhi - Rithala area (North West Delhi, Delhi) condemning the AAP-led state government for failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 19 June 2024, members of the CPI(M) and the Tamil Nadu Untouchability Eradication Front (Dalit group) staged a protest in Chinnappa Park in Pudukkottai town (Pudukkottai, Tamil Nadu) against the attack on a CPI(M) office in Tirunelveli for facilitating an inter-caste marriage (coded separately). The protesters demanded action against the accused and police protection for the couple.
On 19 June 2024, dozens of farmers staged a sit-in protest at the power station in Dangrol village (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh) against the power outages in the area.

On 19 June 2024, scores of farmers from Amaravati staged a protest in front of vice-chancellor's (VC) chamber in Acharya Nagarjuna University (ANU) in Namburu village (Guntur, Andhra Pradesh) demanding his resignation for his allegiance to the YSRCP and for supporting the former state government's three capital cities concept. On 19 June 2024, local people, led by 13 councillors, staged a protest in Charkhi Dadri city (Uttar Pradesh) against the shortage of drinking water in the city.

On 19 June 2024, Anganwadi (female health) workers launched a protest at the Freedom Park in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka) against the INC-led state government's decision to open pre-primary classes in government primary schools in the state. The protesters demanded the authorities to withdraw the order.

On 19 June 2024, local people (likely from the Hindu community) staged a protest at the Tedi Bagiya locality in Agra city (Uttar Pradesh) after blood and flesh (likely of an animal) were found at a religious shrine (Hindu) on top of a house.

On 19 June 2024, Hindu priests staged a protest and locked the administrative officer (in a room) in Kedarnath town (Rudraprayag, Uttarakhand) against the demolition of houses of local priests as part of development works.

On 19 June 2024, members and supporters of a trader family from the Hindu community, led by BJP leaders, closed the shops and staged a protest in Aligarh city (Uttar Pradesh) against the detention of 6 people from the traders family who were accused of assaulting and murdering a young Muslim man over suspicions of stealing on 18 June (coded separately).

On 19 June 2024, councillors belonging to the INC and the BJP staged a protest at the Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation premises in Dharwad city (Karnataka) against the municipal authorities for not taking measures to curb the increasing cases of dengue in Hubballi and Dharwad cities.

On 19 June 2024, INC councillors of the Kochi corporation staged a protest in front of the Cochin Smart Mission Ltd.'s (CSML) office in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) against the installation of defective LED streetlights in various localities in the city.

On 19 June 2024, members of the INC including an MP, a former MP, and an MLA staged a protest at the Ashoka Circle in Koppal city (Karnataka) against a Kalyana Rajya Pragathi Paksha MLA making derogatory comments against the Chief Minister.

On 19 June 2024, members of the Jain community held a protest in front of the Collector's Office in Pune city (Maharashtra) against the claimed vandalization of idols of Jain Tirthankaras near the stairs leading to Kalika Mata temple in the Pavagadh area in Gujarat.
On 19 June 2024, members of the Jain community held a protest in Surat city (Gujarat) against the claimed vandalization of idols of Jain Tirthankaras in the Pavagadh area of the state.

On 19 June 2024, members and religious leaders of the Jain community held a protest in Halol city (Panchmahal, Gujarat) over the claimed vandalization of idols of Jain Tirthankaras in the Pavagadh area in the district.

On 19 June 2024, members and religious leaders of the Jain community held a protest in Vadodara city (Gujarat) over the claimed vandalization of idols of Jain Tirthankaras in the Pavagadh area of the state.

On 19 June 2024, members of the OBC community held a road blockade protest along the Dhule-Solapur Highway at Ambad city (Jalna, Maharashtra) during a bandh (shutdown strike) in support of an OBC leader observing an indefinite hunger strike (coded earlier) to safeguard OBC reservation apprehending dilution after possible inclusion of Maratha caste group into OBC list. The bandh was announced after the leader's health deteriorated due to fasting.

On 19 June 2024, roadway conductors and drivers staged a protest along the road in Budaun city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding action against illegal operators of private vehicles who were accused of misbehaviour with an Assistant Regional Manager (ARM) from the Transport Corporation.
On 19 June 2024, 40 employees staged a sit-in protest in Sansarpur village (Kangra, Himachal Pradesh) against the removal of workers without notice and the non-payment of salaries.

On 19 June 2024, close to 300 members of the Domestic Workers Rights Union staged an 'application protest' at the Labour Department office in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka) demanding the administration to provide Smart Cards to workers in the unorganised sector and to set up a Domestic Workers Taskforce with a helpline.

On 19 June 2024, locals, including businesspersons, staged a protest at the New Road locality in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district) against the metropolis' proposal to designate the New Road area as a no-vehicle zone.

On 19 June 2024, business owners (scrap dealers) staged a protest rally in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were against the metropolis' decision to remove scrap collection centers, despite a court injunction against it.

On 19 June 2024, president of the Peradeniya University Trade Union Federation participated in a satyagraha protest organized by the Peradeniya University Trade Union Federation in Peradeniya town (Kandy, Central), demanding solutions to their demands, including salary discrepancies.

On 19 June 2024, president and secretary of the South Eastern University Staff Union participated in a satyagraha protest organized by the South Eastern University Staff Union at the entrance of the university in Oluvil town (Ampara, Eastern), placing several demands, including a salary increase.

On 19 June 2024, non-academic staff held a protest in front of the university in Vavuniya town (Vavuniya, Northern), demanding solutions to their issues, including the salary dispute and an increase in allowance.
On 19 June 2024, traders of the Trincomalee public market held a protest in front of the central bus stand in Trincomalee town (Trincomalee, Eastern), demanding a ban on street vendors.

On 19 June 2024, advocates (lawyers) staged a protest at the Collectorate in Deoria city (Uttar Pradesh) against the misbehaviour of the District Magistrate with the president of the District and Collectorate Bar Association.

On 19 June 2024, members of the Telangana Private Degree & PG Colleges Managements Association staged a protest at the Dharna Chowk in Hyderabad city (Telangana) demanding the INC-led state government to release the pending fee reimbursement dues to colleges.

On 19 June 2024, members of SEWA along with INC MLAs and members of the AITUC took out a protest march to the Assembly in Thiruvananthapuram city (Kerala) demanding the LDF-led state government to implement a law to protect the rights of domestic workers. The protesters also demanded an increase in the minimum wage.

On 19 June 2024, members of the BRSV took out a protest march in Adilabad city (Telangana) demanding the INC-led state government to establish an engineering college affiliated to JNTU-Hyderabad in Adilabad. The protesters condemned the delay in setting up the college.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), tribals staged a protest in Konda Mamidivalasa hamlet in Mentada mandal (coded to Mentada village, Vizianagaram, Andhra Pradesh) demanding the authorities to restore the electricity supply in the village.

Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), tribals staged a protest in the Dandigam locality in Salur town (Vizianagaram, Andhra Pradesh) demanding the authorities to restore the electricity supply in the village.

On 19 June 2024, members of VHP and Bajrang Dal staged a protest, raising slogans, in Allahabad city (Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh) condemning the attack on a bus carrying Hindu pilgrims in the Rajouri district (Jammu and Kashmir) on 9 June and demanded strict action against the accused.

On 19 June 2024, local people including members of the Ex-Servicemen Association, Bar Association, women's organizations, and others, gathered at Ramlila Maidan (field) and staged a protest in Pithoragarh town (Uttarakhand) against the shortage of drinking water in the area.

On 19 June 2024, more than 20 woman of Karapadi village staged a protest on the Puliampatti-Nambiyur state highway near Gobichettipalayam town (Erode, Tamil Nadu) demanding the authorities to ensure a regular supply of drinking water.
On 19 June 2024, parents held a protest in front of the Mullivaikal East A.D.K. School in Mullivaikkal town (Mullaitivu, Eastern), demanding the appointment of a school principal.

On 19 June 2024, locals protested by padlocking the ward office in Durga Bhagwati rural municipality-5 (Rautahat district), accusing the ward chairperson of irregularities in the formation of the consumer committee.

On 19 June 2024, local people staged a protest, raising slogans, along the Inhauna-Rudauli Road near Inhauna village (Amethi, Uttar Pradesh) against the sub-standard quality of the repair work done on the highway.
On 19 June 2024, residents of various sectors staged a protest in Hisar city (Haryana) against the delay in the construction of the Surya Nagar Railway Overbridge.
On 19 June 2024, local people staged a protest near the water tank in Lalpur village (Udham Singh Nagar, Uttarakhand) against the lack of drinking water supply in the area.
On 19 June 2024, local people staged a protest, raising slogans, in Kolara Kalan village (Fatehabad, Haryana) against the shortage of water supply in the area.

On 19 June 2024, parents staged a protest on the Natrampalli-Mallagunda High Road in Thagarakuppam village (Tirupattur, Tamil Nadu) demanding the administration to employ teachers and fill up the vacancies at the Government High School in the village.

On 19 June 2024, residents and parents staged a protest at the Government Primary School in Thethampakkam village (Ranipet district, TN) demanding the authorities to provide basic civic amenities, repair the school building and hire teachers. The protesters locked the school building to mark their protest.

On 19 June 2024, residents staged a protest in Kalamassery town (Ernakulam, Kerala) after nearly 50 houses sustained damages due to a series of explosions at the Carborundum Universal Ltd. The protesters demanded the authorities to take action against the company. The explosions are suspected to have been caused due to negligence in cooling the furnace.

On 19 June 2024, villagers staged a protest in Dongargaon village (Adilabad, Telangana) demanding the authorities to ensure a regular supply of drinking water. The protesters said that they were forced to get water from open wells and held empty vessels to mark their protest.

On 19 June 2024, villagers staged a protest in Indervelly village (Adilabad, Telangana) demanding the authorities to ensure a regular supply of drinking water. The protesters said that they were forced to get water from open wells and held empty vessels to mark their protest.

On 19 June 2024, members of AAP, including its state co-in-charge, staged a protest at Sector 7 in Chandigarh city against the suspected irregularities in the NEET exams. Protesters were detained and later released.

On 19 June 2024, police intervened by arresting more than 34 dairy farmers who were staging a protest at the central office of the Dairy Development Corporation in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding settlement of their outstanding payments from private dairy companies, highlighting ongoing grievances over unmet agreements.

On 19 June 2024, members of the KSU took out protest marches in Kannur district (coded to Kannur city, Kerala) against the LDF-led state government for not allotting more higher secondary seats in the Malabar region in the state. Police resorted to water cannons to disperse the protesters and dragged women protesters.

On 19 June 2024, members of the KSU took out protest marches in Palakkad district (coded to Palakkad city, Kerala) against the LDF-led state government for not allotting more higher secondary seats in the Malabar region in the state. Police resorted to water cannons to disperse the protesters and dragged women protesters.

On 19 June 2024, several members of the KSU took out a protest march to the District Collectorate in Kannur city (Kerala) against the LDF-led state government for not allotting more higher secondary seats in the Malabar region in the state. The protesters raised slogans and were blocked by the police who resorted to water cannons to disperse them. The protesters engaged in a minor scuffledwith the police and were dragged and beaten up.

On 19 June 2024, members of the All Gujarat Students Union (AGSU) held 'lollipops' in their hands and marched towards the M.S. University in Vadodara city (Gujarat) during a protest demanding more BCom seats under the University's faculty of commerce. The police intervened and stopped the protesters. NSUI members staged a separate 'chakka jam' (road block) protest. 8 NSUI members were detained by the police, and released later in the day.
On 19 June 2024, a woman was severely injured in a pressure IED explosion suspectedly planted by Naxal-Maoist cadres in Nadpalli village in the Usoor region (Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh).

On 19 June 2024, hundreds of people (likely from the Hindu community based on the context) staged a demonstration, raising slogans, and vandalized two shops in Nahan town (Sirmaur, Himachal Pradesh) after a man (shop owner) shared photos of cattle slaughter on social media. The demonstrators also reached the Deputy Commissioner's office.

On 19 June 2024, a large number of local people (likely from the Muslim community based on the context), including students (Aligarh Muslim University) and family members of the deceased staged a demonstration and pelted stones along the road in Aligarh city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding the arrest of the accused involved in the assault and murder of a young man over suspicions of stealing on 18 June (coded separately). The police detained 6 accused in the murder.

source: Hasht-e Subh; National Resistance Front of Afghanistan
notes: On 19 June 2024, two Taliban members were killed and four were wounded following an attack by National Resistance Front militants in Gozargah-e-Noor district center, Baghlan.

On 19 June 2024, two Taliban members were killed and two were wounded during clashes between two commanders in Kohistan (Lolash) district [coded to Qala], Faryab. The commanders clashed due to an issue related to 'honor.'

On 19 June 2024, one person was killed and seven were wounded during clashes between two families over a land ownership in the Wardesh Tangi area Dara-e-Pech [coded to Manogai] district, Kunar. Four people were arrested.

On 19 June 2024, residents of Sofia protested in front of the Specialized Criminal Court to demand that the perpetrator of the traffic accident that killed two young people be found guilty and demanding the court system punish those who are making roads across the country dangerous.
On 19 June 2024, locals protested in Kaprije against the newly built docking port. The reason behind their dissatisfaction is that the roads to the port are not accessible enough.

On 19 June 2024, activists gathered for a march around the seat of the government in Prague, criticizing the cabinet for various mishaps ranging from economic issues to what they see as unlawful restrictions of the freedom of expression.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of migrants attempted to cross the Polish-Belarusian border at an unspecified location of the frontier (coded to Bialystok), pelting stones and pieces of wood toward the servicemen. Polish police and military forces clashed with them and prevented them from crossing.

On 19 June 2024, about 70 migrants attempted to cross the Polish-Belarusian border river Przewloka (coded to Bialowieza), pelting stones and pieces of wood toward the servicemen. Polish police and military forces clashed with them and prevented them from crossing.

On 19 June 2024, around 500 people marched in Oulu, Pohjois-Pohjanmaa, to oppose racism and right-wing extremism following the recent stabbings of people of foreign origin. Among others, the mayor of the city took part in the event.
On 19 June 2024, a protest was held in Tbilisi against the planned construction of the skyscrapers on the former hippodrome territory.

On 19 June 2024, workers from more than 70 addiction prevention centers across the country staged a rally in Athens to protest a draft law proposed by the Health Ministry, which they say would threaten the future of their services.

Around 19 June 2024 (month of), residents of Qarajar village near Burabay township in Aqmola region gathered near their homes in protest of the local authorities' failure to build a new bridge after flooding months earlier, demanding that the Kazakh government resolve villagers' grievances.

On 19 June 2024, family members of convicted prisoners in Olymp money laundering and tax evasion case gathered outside the Kazakh government's building near Almaty district in Astana city in protest of unfair sentences in their relatives' cases, calling for the country's president to intervene and ensure revision of their family members' cases.

On 19 June 2024, residents of Pasjane protested in front of the local medical center, claiming that the hospital is guilty of only employing family members and friends of those in power and already employed at the hospital.

On 19 June 2024, employees of a jet ski business that had been engulfed in flames attacked a journalist while he was reporting live on a wildfire from Varis - Koropi road. The attackers punched him in the head and he hit the ground. The attack was transmitted on live television.

On 19 June 2024, protesters gathered in Kocani, demanding that the landfill in the area get closed and a more sustainable solution be found for the landfill which they claim has been causing significant health and environmental issues for the region.

On 19 June 2024, police officers physically assaulted a 43-year-old male in custody at the city police department in Bekabad city of Tashkent region, resulting in victim's death. The police launched an internal investigation into the incident.
On 19 June 2024, farmers suspended their blockade of a local highway near Dunkowiczki, protesting against the proposed construction of a new infrastructure over arable land.

On 19 June 2024, ORP activists gathered for a rally in Warsaw, demanding higher solidarity with refugees coming to Europe through Belarus and criticizing what they see as ineffective management of the whole crisis in Eastern Europe.

On 19 June 2024, members of the National Union of Counselors from Probation Services, protested in the Victory Square, in front of the Government headquarters, in Bucharest, demanding the full payment of their salary rights from existing funds. They highlighted issues such as salary cuts implemented without a legal basis and the necessity for the government's direct intervention to resolve the budget shortfall, emphasizing the challenging work conditions and the inadequacy of current pay levels.

On 19 June 2024, Women in Black and other activists gathered in Belgrade - Stari Grad to raise their voice against sexual violence in conflicts. The protesters also commemorated the victims of sexual violence in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1992-1995.

On 19 June 2024, activists from the Emergency Break movement blocked a motorway exit in Kongens Lyngby, Hovedstaden, calling for an end to motorway construction due to environmental concerns. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, five people were detained.

On 19 June 2024, around 50 pro-Palestinian demonstrators blocked the entrance to the Danish Parliament in Copenhagen to oppose the Danish government's stance on the Palestinian-Israeli conflict and the export of Danish military aircraft components to Israel. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, and around 27 people were detained.

On 19 June 2024, people demonstrated outside of the town hall in Landskrona, Skane, to protest against the decision to convert of the local garden area into a natural reserve, which would involve the eviction of current residents from their land plots.

On 19 June 2024, teachers of the Official School of Languages (EOI) held a protest in A Coruna (Galicia) against the regional government's decision to cancel a post in the Chinese department, leading to a reduction of language groups offered for this language and longer working shifts for teachers.

On 19 June 2024, residents held a protest in A Coruna (Galicia) against the demolition of their homes by the local government, pending the payment of a tax by the owners. Protesters blocked the roads to demonstrate.

On 19 June 2024, health workers held a protest in front of the Sant Joan Hospital in Alicante (Valencia) against the expansion of the emergency unit without hiring new staff, arguing this would involve longer working shifts affecting the service's quality and impacting the staff's well-being. Protesters informed that there would be a protest taking place every Wednesday until their demands were met.

actors: Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
notes: On 19 June 2024, activists from Just Stop Oil sprayed orange paint on the prehistoric Stonehenge stones in Amesbury (England) to call on the new British government to agree to a plan to end the extraction and burning of oil, gas, and coal by 2030. The group said it used orange corn flour paint to spray onto the stones to prevent damage to the historic site. Police forces arrested two protesters.
On 19 June 2024, at the call of FFMC, motorcyclists gathered in Auch (Occitanie) to demonstrate against the introduction of a compulsory technical inspection of powered two-wheelers.

On 19 June 2024, at the call of 'Food, Beverages, and Catering Union' (Gewerkschaft Nahrung-Genuss-Gaststatten (NGG), about 30 employees of the Milchwerk Bad Worishofen GmbH company staged a protest in Bad Worishofen (Bayern) for higher wages. The protest occurred in the context of collective bargaining negotiations, whereby the unions demanded a fixed wage supplement of 411 euros per month for all employees.

On 19 June 2024, around 400 people, called by more than 200 different associations, including Ecologists in Action, held a protest in Barcelona - L'Eixample (Cataluna), against the Formula 1 Live Barcelona Road Show, arguing that such events created an economic model contrary to the welfare of their neighborhood.

On 19 June 2024, people, including people with disabilities, participated in a protest in front of the AOK Nordost health insurance office in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin) to defend higher salaries for personal assistants to people with disabilities. The protest was organized in the context of disputes over the refinancing of collective agreements by the AOK and the Senate agreed upon in December 2023 with Ver.di and two assistance service providers: 'Outpatient Services' (Ambulante Dienste) and 'New ways of Life' (Neue Lebenswege).

On 19 June 2024, hundreds of activists, including anarchists and No Besta activists, demonstrated at Don Bosco Park in Bologna (Emilia-Romagna) against the planned felling of trees to make way for a school, a tram construction site, and a cycling lane. Some participants climbed trees, while others clashed with the police in riot gear. 14 activists and eight police officers were injured.

On 19 June 2024, an unknown number of people protested and prevented an eviction in Brussels - Ixelles (Brussels). The vacant building was occupied by eighty people and an eviction was supposed to take place that day but it was not carried out due to the protest. The protesters denounced the constant eviction threat and a lack of clarity on the responsibilities of the various parties involved. The collective Rockin' Squat was present at the protest.

On 19 June 2024, at the call of Dare to Be Feminist (Osez le Feminisme), students' parents gathered outside the Conservatory in Caen (Normandie) to demand more action from the establishment's management against two teachers who have been accused of sexual harassment.

On 19 June 2024, around 30 students held a protest at the University of Coimbra in Coimbra (Coimbra) to call on the university to promote an immediate ceasefire in Gaza. Protesters denounced the Israeli operation in the Gaza Strip and expressed solidarity with Palestinians.

On 19 June 2024, several dozen people protested in front of the Lower House in Den Haag (Zuid-Holland) to show their support for the Palestinian people. Police moved the protesters across the road, where the demonstration was allowed to take place.
On 19 June 2024, representatives of the Mandate Union held a protest outside the parliament in Dublin (Dublin) against pay rates below the minimum wage for young workers.

On 19 June 2024, around 800 people, including medical students and the state Health Minister (CDU), participated in a protest in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for better working conditions, standardized medical learning and training concepts and higher wages in line with the maximum Bafog student loan rate of up to 930 euros during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.
On 19 June 2024, workers of Navantia held a protest in Ferrol (Galicia) by blocking the entrance to the shipyard to demand a new collective labor agreement.

On 19 June 2024, between 30 (according to observers) and more than 200 (organizers) people, including students, political organizations, student groups, Jusos and GJ, staged a protest at the university in Gottingen (Niedersachsen) and disturbed the lecture of Bundestag Member Mareike Wulf (CDU) on the self-determination-law of the coalition government, causing the termination of the lecture. The participants protested for trans rights and against what they consider to be misanthropic, trans-hostile and discriminatory statements by Wulf, arguing that they caused societal division and queerphobia.

On 19 June 2024, people, including medical students and representatives of the Medical Student council, participated in a protest in Greifswald (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) to call for better working conditions, standardized medical learning and training concepts, better regulations on absenteeism and higher wages in line with the maximum Bafog student loan rate of up to 930 euros during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.

On 19 June 2024, people, called by CCOO, held a protest in Huesca (Aragon) against the regional government's layoff plan for teaching staff across the region. Members of the Defense of Students with Special Educational Needs (Defensa de los Alumnos con Necesidades Educativas Especiales) took part in the protest.

On 19 June 2024, workers of the National Tax Agency, called by SIAT - Independent Trade Union of the Tax Agency (Sindicato Independiente de la Agencia Tributaria), CCOO, UGT, CSIF and CIG, held a protest in Logrono (La Rioja) as a part of a series of ongoing national protests demanding salary improvements and remote working options, among other claims.
On 19 June 2024, around 5,000 employees of the chemical producer BASF staged a protest in Ludwigshafen (Baden-Wurttemberg) to demand higher wages.

On 19 June 2024, at the call of the Jewish group We Will Live (Nous Vivrons), between 100 and 150 people, gathered on Terreaux Square in Lyon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to condemn antisemitism after the rape of a 12-year-old Jewish girl in Courbevoie on 15 June (coded separately).

On 19 June 2024, between 1,000 and 2,000 people demonstrated in Lyon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alps). One person sprayed paint on the Palace of Fine Arts while others set fire to trash cans. Clashes between the police and rioters ensued. The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 19 June 2024, at the call of the Social and Environmental Alliance (Alliance Ecologique et Sociale) et and the 'NOJO' collective, people gathered in Nice (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest against the city's bid to organize the 2030 Winter Olympics, citing the project's environmental and economic impact.

On 19 June 2024, workers of the National Tax Agency, called by SIAT - Independent Trade Union of the Tax Agency (Sindicato Independiente de la Agencia Tributaria), CCOO, UGT, CSIF and CIG, held a protest in Oviedo (Asturias) as a part of a series of ongoing national protests demanding salary improvements and remote working options, among other claims.

notes: On 19 June 2024, 400 pro-Palestinian students marched from Palazzo Nuovo to the Turin Polytechnic University in Duca degli Abruzzi Street in Torino (Piemonte), where they blocked the entrance of the university with wooden barriers. On 19 June 2024, at the call of CGT, striking medical secretaries gathered for a picket line outside the Joseph-Ducuing hospital in Toulouse (Occitanie) to demand a pay rise and better working conditions.

On 19 June 2024, at the call of the local Antifa, people gathered in Toulouse (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections. As the demonstration was unauthorized, police intervened quickly to disperse the demonstrators and handed out fines to the participants.

actors: Military Forces of France (2017-) Gendarmerie Mayotte
notes: On 19 June 2024, youths threw stones at a school bus and clashed with gendarmerie forces in Tsoundzou I (Mamoudzou). The gendarmerie used tear gas to disperse the rioters.

On 19 June 2024, pro-Palestine students at Warwick University occupied Warwick Manufacturing Group's International Digital Laboratory in Warwick (England) to demand the university divest its support of Israel and condemn the Israeli government's actions, pledging to protect Palestinian students on campus, protecting students who are protesting to have the right to 'freedom of speech', rebuilding Palestinian universities, and offering scholarships to their students.

On 19 June 2024, about a hundred employees and executive staff of the chocolate company Callebaut laid off work and protested outside in Wieze (Vlaanderen) to express their anxiety after an information meeting about the impending restructuring and associated layoffs. The abductions were ahead of the third plenary session of the 20th Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, scheduled to be in July 2024 in Beijing.

They demanded the transfer of political prisoners to a less severe zone, which was temporarily granted.

On 19 June 2024, Kim Jong Un signed a deal of mutual defense pledge with Russia when president Vladimir Putin visited North Korea (coded as Pyongyang) which commits to mutual assistance if either nation encounters 'aggression,' a strategic alliance formed as both experiences increasing confrontations with the West. Putin visited North Korea for the first time since July 2000.

notes: On 19 June 2024, nurses with National Nursed United rallied in Asheville (North Carolina) to call for safe staffing levels and better working conditions.

On 19 June 2024, workers picketed outside the Smart & Final grocery store distribution center in Commerce (California) to demand they not be laid off as part of consolidation with another center. The workers were organized by Teamsters Local 630.

On 19 June 2024, pro-Palestinian students displaying Palestinian flags continued their encampment at the University of California in Davis (California) to demand the university divest from Israel in a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April and amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023. The encampment was organized by Davis Popular University for the Liberation of Palestine (Davis PULP). The group began dismantling the encampment that day.

Training: Around 19 June 2024 (as reported), Great Lakes Active Club (loosely affiliated with the Rise Above Movement) affiliates held a sparring training in Southeast Michigan (coded as Detroit (Michigan)).

On 19 June 2024, WestJet aircraft maintenance engineers rallied outside the Edmonton International Airport and issued a 72-hour strike notice in Edmonton (Alberta) to demand better pay and working conditions. It caused the cancelling of WestJet flights. Members of the Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association were present.

On 19 June 2024, Benedictine sisters held a silent march in Erie (Pennsylvania) to call for justice and freedom for the members of the African American community. The event was held in honor of Juneteenth.
On 19 June 2024, dozens of protesters staged a rally outside the Parkside Drive home in Hamilton (Ontario) to demand answers from the pet-sitter's home about the death of a dog.

On 19 June 2024, more than 20 people, including members of Love in Action International Ministries and Harassment and Assault Reporting Program, gathered outside of the Dauphin County Jail in Harrisburg (Pennsylvania) to call for better conditions, protect whistleblowers, and remember those who died in the jail.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Hood River (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Medford (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Milwaukie (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

Property destruction: On 19 June 2024, storefront windows of the Falafel Yoni Restaurant were hit with three projectiles in Montreal - Center East (Quebec). The damage to the building was minor, including cracks and circular holes. The police are not sure what kind of weapon was used in the vandalism. The owner of the restaurant is an Israeli Jew and social media posts about boycotting the restaurant were circulating online before the event. Police investigated the incident as a suspected hate crime. This incident occurred amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 19 June 2024, bodega workers and members of the United Bodegas of America gathered in New York - Bronx (New York) to call for an end to gun violence and for improved safety on the job after a 33-year-old man was shot at the Gourmet Deli on 19 June. Protesters called for the reinstatement of stop-and-frisk policies and more funds for safety features such as security cameras. Demonstrators also called for bodega workers to arm themselves.

On 19 June 2024, local residents and members of Black Lives Matter of Greater New York rallied in New York - Bronx (New York) to oppose the Mayor's decision not to issue a permit for a Juneteenth celebration to the group and in support of the African American community. BLM members claimed the lack of permit was racially motivated. The Mayor said the group failed to submit the request in a timely manner. Police were present to prevent the celebration and towed the organizer's car. The group held the Juneteenth festival in private property instead.

On 19 June 2024, members of Unite Here marched to Trump Tower in New York - Manhattan (New York) to support unions and to demonstrate against former president Donald Trump and his candidacy in the upcoming presidential elections.

On 19 June 2024, Amazon employees and members of Teamsters Union and Amazon Labor Union (ALU) rallied outside the Amazon facility in New York - Staten Island (New York) to support unionization and the Amazon union joining Teamsters.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Newberg (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in Oregon City (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

On 19 June 2024, local residents and supporters held a 'Juneteenth Freedom Walk' from Kittery, Maine across the Memorial bridge in Portsmouth (New Hampshire) to support equality among races, nationalities, and religions. The Seacoast African American Culture Center organized the march. People also held Black Lives Matter flags.

On 19 June 2024, workers picketed outside the Smart & Final grocery store distribution center in Riverside (California) to demand they not be laid off as part of consolidation with another center. The workers were organized by Teamsters Local 630.

On 19 June 2024, pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment with dozens of tents at the University of Toronto's campus at the center of King's College Circle in Toronto - Old Toronto (Ontario) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divests from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. This was the 50th day of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. Demonstrators held a rally and press conference before the hearing at the Ontario Court of Justice in support of Palestine. This campus demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 19 June 2024, about 40 local residents, including farmers, staged a rally outside the Region of Waterloo headquarters in Waterloo (Ontario) to protest against the Waterloo Region's efforts to buy or expropriate farm land in Wilmot Township. Demonstrators also claimed that the loss of farmland would have negative environmental effects.

On 19 June 2024, Oregon Nurses Association members (affiliated with the AFL-CIO) held a demonstration outside of the Providence Medical Center in West Haven-Sylvan (Oregon) to demand an increase in staffing levels, more benefits and a living wage.

region: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
notes: On 19 June 2024, two rival clans affiliated with MILF engaged in a firefight in Barangay Meta (Datu Unsay, Maguindanao del Sur, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). Authorities said the clans were involved in a rido (clan blood feud) and were engaged in political and land disputes with each other. There were no casualties.

actors: TPNPB: West Papua National Liberation Army
notes: On 19 June 2024, TPNPB shot a non-Papuan motorbike taxi driver on Turunan Menuju Kota Lama Road, Mulia district (Puncak Jaya regency, Central Papua province). The motive was unknown. The victim sustained a gunshot wound on his head and had to be hospitalized.

On 19 June 2024, around 5-6 people sprayed red paint, smashed windows, and set two fires at the office of a Jewish ALP MP in St. Kilda, Melbourne - Central, Victoria, in opposition to the MP's pro-Israel stance. The phrase 'Zionism is fascism' was scrawled over an image of the MP, and horns were drawn on his head.

On 19 June 2024, a group of Muslim students from the HMI organization peacefully protested in front of the Coordinating Ministry for Maritime & Investment Affairs building in Central Jakarta city (Jakarta province) (coded as Jakarta - Central). They urged the government not to waste state funds on the new capital city project in Kalimantan.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of students from the Cimahi Civic Solidarity peacefully protested in front of the Corruption Eradication Commission building in South Jakarta city (Jakarta province) (coded as Jakarta - South). They demanded the investigation of corruption cases within the city government in Cimahi.

On 19 June 2024, hundreds of students from the Indonesian Law Students Association (Permahi) peacefully protested on the Siliwangi junction in Cirebon city (West Java province). They demanded the investigation of a fatal armed robbery case in Cirebon.

On 19 June 2024, dozens of people from the United Kediri Alliance (AKB) civic movement peacefully protested in front of the National Land Agency building on Veteran Road, Kediri city (East Java province). They demanded the investigation of extortion within the land registration process.

On 19 June 2024, hundreds of people peacefully protested in front of the public prosecutor's office in Tigaraksa district (Tangerang regency, Banten province). They demanded the investigation of a corruption case related to the construction of Tigaraksa Public Hospital.

On 19 June 2024, about 30 people, including the NAJAT representative and a Palestinian, protested in front of Nippon Aircraft Supply Co., Ltd. (Tokyo - Shinjuku) and then moved to Kaigai Corporation (Tokyo - Minato) to criticize their business relationships with Israel. They blamed the Israeli attack on Gaza and held Palestine's flags. The protests were part of the two-day '#NO Slaughter Drone 4 Companies Tour Demonstration.' The Association of National Defense Academy Graduates against Genocide organized the event.

On 19 June 2024, members of a union of teachers and staff in Nagano Prefecture protested in front of Nagano station in Nagano, Nagano against proposals by a special subcommittee of the Central Council for Education to improve the compensation of teachers. The proposals include a 2.5-fold increase in 'adjustment expenses,' which are paid on top of overtime in lieu of overtime pay. The labor union members called for legal reform to provide overtime pay.

On 19 June 2024, 140 people protested in front of the 2nd Congressional Chamber of the House of Representatives in Tokyo - Chiyoda against what they perceived as corrupt LDP politics. Members of the Grand People's Movement Executive Committee, Tear Up The US-Japan Security Treaty Central Executive Committee, Zenroren, Nihon-Iroren, and Central Council for the Promotion of Social Security, and a Diet member from the JCP attended the event. On the same day, 1,000 people protested in front of the Diet in Tokyo - Chiyoda against the LDP politics. They criticized its efforts to increase military capacity and its failure to disclose the undocumented political fund scandal. Members of the Anti-War Committee of 1000, Christian Peace Network, Women's Democratic Club, Japan Pensioners' Union, Peace Forum, Zeniro, and Shinfujin, a lawyer, Diet members from the SDPJ, CDP, JCP, and Okinawa Social Mass Party attended the event. The Don't Allow War! Don't Break Article 9! Total Action Executive Committee and NO! To Abe's Article 9 Amendment - Citizens Action organized the event.

On 19 June 2024, people protested in front of the Prime Minister's residence in Tokyo - Chiyoda against the proposed reform to Local Autonomy Act. The Okinawa One-Tsubo Anti-War Landowners Association Kanto Block organized the event.

On 19 June 2024, members of the National Wing movement within the DP gathered with banners outside the DP headquarters in Ulaanbaatar - Chingeltei. The protesters demanded the resignation of the party leader over allegations of embezzling funds from the Education Loan Fund and placing associates in key positions.

On 19 June 2024, members of ACT, Bayan Muna, BAYAN, and GABRIELA staged a protest in front of the Quezon City Regional Trial Court in Quezon City (Metropolitan Manila, National Capital Region) to show support for the BAYAN chairperson as her case against 2 Sonshine Media Network International (SMNI) anchors for red-tagging proceeds.

On 19 June 2024, DPP Keelung City councilors gathered to protest with placards and banners outside of Keelung Railway Station in Keelung City (Keelung City). They condemned what they deemed to be legislative overreach within KMT and TPP reforms, and demanded the removal of Keelung City Mayor.

On 19 June 2024, employees at Nan Shan Life Insurance held a protest with banners and placards outside of the company's headquarters in Taipei City - Xinyi district (Taipei City). They demanded that the company negotiate in good faith with the union in order to address unresolved labor disputes.

On 19 June 2024, people gathered to protest with placards outside of Taipei City Hall in Taipei City - Xinyi district (Taipei City). They demanded that the city council oppose an application to expand an elementary school in Beitou district into conserved land, and to instead preserve the natural environment.

On 19 June 2024, a group of people from the Panimbul and Tongon villages held a demonstration at the Pogogul Airport, Momunu district (Buol regency, Central Sulawesi province). They demanded road repairs in their villages. They tore down the airport gate. There were no casualties.
