On 18 June 2024, PKK militants clashed with the Turkish army soldiers in the area of Mount Metin (Jabal Matin) (Al Amadiya, Duhok), in conjunction with Turkish military airstrikes. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 18 June 2024, in the morning, French Navy frigate Forbin intercepted 1 Houthi drone in the Strait of Bab el Mandeb. Potential targets were unidentified/not reported. Houthi forces did not claim the attack.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), ADF killed a civilian in Ngelia, located east of Biakato (Babila-Babombi, Mambasa, Ituri). The lifeless body of the victim, identified as a woman, was discovered on 18 June after 9 days of captivity.

On 18 June 2024, hundreds of Ghanaians protested at the Labadi Beach Hotel in Accra (Accra, Greater Accra), against the sale of most of SSNIT's stake in four hotels to Rock City Hotel. The police intervened using tear gas and pepper spray to disperse the protesters.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), ADF ambushed 3 farmers while going to the field in Ngelia, located east of Biakato (Babila-Babombi, Mambasa, Ituri) last week. 1 person was killed and another injured.
Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, Ambazonian Separatists set a taxi on fire and also fired shots in Ntarikon neighbourhood in Bamenda (Bamenda 3, Mezam, Nord-Ouest).

actors: EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 18 June 2024, Wazalendo clashed with a FARDC soldier from the Hibou Company in Minova (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). 1 FARDC soldier was killed. The victim later succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment at the hospital (unspecified location).

actors: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
notes: On 18 June 2024, unidentified armed group attacked the Okapis Wildlife Reserve (RFO) eco-guard patrol posts in Bebusa locality, west of Epulu, in the Bandaka chieftancy (Mambasa, Ituri). 2 people were killed, including 1 eco-guard and the assailant.

On 18 June 2024, ADF attacked civilians in the locality of Bamande Kartuma (Walese Vonkutu, Irumu, Ituri). 2 civilians were injured. The victims were taken to the Komanda General Referral Hospital. Mass displacement of residents from the region was reported following this incident. The assailants retreated into the Kartuma forest.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), suspected ADF fighters killed 14 civilians in the locality of Kilia/Kilya (Ruwenzori, Beni, Nord-Kivu). The victims' lifeless bodiess were discovered on 18 June. Apparently, most of the victims were tied up before being beheaded.

actors: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
notes: Property destruction: Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), FARDC destroyed Wazalendo underground cells and camps in Nyiragongo teritory (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu) to curb multiple forms of abuse against the population in areas under their control.

actors: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, FARDC destroyed two vehicles belonging to the M23 near Maisafi (also spelled as Mayi Safi) village (Irumu, Ituri). No further details.

actors: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), FARDC-Wazalendo occupied Sake Community Radio Station located on a hill in Sake (Bahunde, Masisi, Nord-Kivu) since February. They also looted equipment. The staff members were forced to flee to Goma.

actors: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), FARDC occupied Community and Environmental Radio of Kanyabayonga (RCEKA-FM) located on a hill of Kanyabayonga town (Bwito, Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The staff members present fled to safe areas. The station was occupied for strategic reasons.

actors: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), FARDC occupied Radio Maendeleo Kaseghe in Kaseghe locality (Batangi, Lubero, Nord-Kivu) on 2 June.

Other: On 18 June 2024, Nande community's economic operators observed a dead city day in Kindu (Kindu, Maniema) to condemn the massacres of civilians by ADF in the Beni, Lubero, and Goma (North Kivu) and Ituri regions. Economic activities were almost completely paralyzed in the outskirts of Beni city. Several businesses belonging to the Nande community remained closed.

On 18 June 2024, private security guards, during their routine patrol, shot and killed an operator in the Nkrabia Forest Reserve (Adansi South, Ashanti). It is alleged that upon hearing of the incident, the youth of Kogyaeme village near Adansi Akrofuom stormed the area with intentions to lynch the suspects, who had taken refuge at the home of a resident. The police intervened, rescued, and arrested the suspects.
On 18 June 2024, a local defense militia and policemen clashed at Eberi (Omumma, Rivers). Two persons; one policeman and one local defense militia member were killed.

On 18 June 2024, an unidentified communal militia attacked civilians at Gugur community in Michihe ward and Tor Donga (Katsina Ala, Benue) and Mbacher (coded separately) and killed six persons. The house of assembly member representing the constituency claimed that the attack was a reprisal following the community's resistance of the militia in April which led to the death of two members, 6 fatalities split across two events coded as 3.

On 18 June 2024, an unidentified communal militia attacked civilians at Mbacher (Katsina Ala, Benue), Gugur community in Michihe ward and Tor Donga (coded separately) and killed six persons. The house of assembly member representing the constituency claimed that the attack was a reprisal following the community's resistance of the militia in April which led to the death of two members, 6 fatalities split across two events coded as 3.

On 18 June 2024, rioters from Unguwan Gaen and Unguwan Lalle clashed among themselves and killed a man who was trying to intervene at Gaen (Gwale, Kano). The victim was the leader of a local defense militia in Gaen.
On 18 June 2024, traders protested at Zuba international market (Gwagwalada, FCT) against the revocation of over 300 of their shops.

On 18 June 2024, youths protested and blocked (through unspecified means) the entrance of the local government headquarters in Degema (Degema, Rivers) to demand that the local government chairman, whose tenure expired the previous day leave office. The protesters also chanted solidarity songs.

On 18 June 2024, about 100 protesters protested and barricaded (means not stated) the gate of the local government headquarters at Buguma (Asaritoru, Rivers) to prevent the local government chairman from entering. The protesters claimed that the chairman's tenure expired the previous day.

On 18 June 2024, youths protested at the local government headquarters in Ahoada (Ahoada East, Rivers) to demand that the local government chairman, whose tenure expired the previous day to leave office.

notes: On 18 June 2024, hundreds of residents, mainly youth organized under the 'Occupy Parliament,' banner, joined by human rights activists and celebrities, protested in Nairobi Central Business District (Starehe, Nairobi) against the government's proposed tax measures in the finance bill 2024. Police lobbed teargas canisters, used water cannons, and live bullets to disperse the group and arrested more than 210 people, including journalists and observers. Several police officers and protesters sustained injuries (one police officer was severely injured after he detonated a tear gas canister and delayed releasing it).

On 18 June 2024, a group of women protested along parliament road in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the ongoing demolitions, following a government directive to demolish properties in the city center. Police lobbed teargas to disperse the group. Some protestors sustained injuries.

notes: On 18 June 2024, a dozen lawyers forced their way into the Nairobi central police station (Starehe, Nairobi) against the move by the police to arrest demonstrators during the protests against the government's proposed tax measures (coded separately). Police lobbed teargas to disperse the group.

On 18 June 2024, residents gathered at the Railways terminus in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against the government's proposed tax measures. The group demanded members of parliament to reject the proposals.

On 18 June 2024, judges, magistrates, lawyers and other judiciary staff marched in Eldoret town (Moiben, Uasin Gishu) against the against the recent killing of their colleague (coded separately). The group demanded the judicial service commission to provide protection for judicial officers.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), residents of Malabar and informal settlers stage a protest by erecting temporary wooden structures on the sites next to the Malabar Extension 6 township in Malabar (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape) against perceived prioritization of outsiders in housing allocation, lack of transparency in the selection process, slow progress in housing development, and the marginalization of long-term residents who continue to live in informal settlements or shack dwellings.

At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Three children aged five to seven were abducted. Fatalities split over the five days, coded as 2.

The Guidance Patrol enforces the Sharia (Islamic law) in Iran, often in the form of implementing the Islamic dress, such as ensuring women wear hijabs under the chastity and hijab program known as 'Noor.' After the Mahsa Amini protest movement, the 'hijab' became a sociopolitical matter, and the religious leaders whom the government and the police support tried to prevent anti-veil activities by Iranian women daily.

On 18 June 2024, women employed in the households of Satellite Town held a protest in front of the press club in Mirpur Khas city (Mirpur Khas, Sindh), against harassment and threats faced by women workers in the area.

On 18 June 2024, women residents armed with sticks staged protest and blocked Indus Highway in Shagai area (coded as Swabi, KPK) against the Peshawar electricity company for excessive power outages and prolonged loadshedding.
On 18 June 2024, relatives held a protest demonstration in Kot Addu town (Muzaffargarh, Sindh), after a girl died due to the negligence of the doctors in a hospital's emergency ward.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) District Reserve Group
notes: On 18 June 2024, a joint team comprising the District Reserve Guard (DRG), Bastar Fighters, and 206th battalion of the Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel clashed with Naxal-Maoist cadres in a forested hill near Karanguda village under Chintalnar Police Station limits (Sukma district, Chhattisgarh), while the joint forces were on an anti-Naxal operation. The Naxal-Maoist cadres retreated to the forest. There were no casualties. Security forces seized a muzzle-loading gun and Naxal-Maoist-related materials from the site.

On 18 June 2024, local people and farmers assaulted a junior engineer (state power department) with sticks and bricks in Mehmoodpur Mafi village (Moradabad, Uttar Pradesh) over lack of adequate electricity supply.

On 18 June 2024, members of the Muslim community from the Kristonagar area of West Bengal entered Jharkhand state, and together with local Muslims, clashed with members of the Hindu community in Gopinathpur village (Pakur, Jharkhand) after local Hindus objected to the slaughter of cow during Eid (holy festival of the Muslims).

On 18 June 2024, a group of people assaulted and killed a man, with sticks, at the Mamu Bhanja locality in Aligarh city (Uttar Pradesh) over suspicions of stealing. A video of the incident was circulated online.

Other: On 18 June 2024, the administration in the presence of police personnel from 15 police stations and revenue staff demolished the houses of six accused in Pipalrawan village (Dewas, Madhya Pradesh) after they were accused of attacking the police team during a raid against illegal liquor trade last week. This led to protests by the locals (coded separately).

On 18 June 2024, AAP members, led by its state vice president, staged a protest, raising slogans, at the Municipal Corporation office in Mahendragarh city (Haryana) demanding the resignation of the Nagar Palika Pradhan (Municipal Council President) over the lack of development works in the city.

On 18 June 2024, members of AAP, including an AAP state minister, staged a protest at Jantar Mantar in Delhi - New Delhi city (Delhi) against the suspected irregularities in the Neet exams and demanded the cancellation of the exam results and called for re-examinations.

On 18 June 2024, members of the ABVP held a protest in Ahmedabad city (Ahmadabad, Gujarat) against the Gujarat University's decision to discontinue some courses like MA and MSc. They further demanded that the students impacted by the decision be accommodated in other colleges.

On 18 June 2024, the IT Army, affiliated with the AJP, staged a sit-in protest at the Foreign Employment Department in the Tahachal locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters made various demands, including the return of illegally taken money from workers, action against fraudulent agents, and employment for youth, among others.

On 18 June 2024, members of the BJP staged protests across Karnataka (coded as Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban district, Karnataka)) against the INC-led state government's decision to increase the fuel prices in the state.

On 18 June 2024, members of the BJP including an MLA staged a protest in Sullia town (Dakshina Kannada, Karnataka) against the INC-led state government's decision to increase the fuel prices in the state.

On 18 June 2024, residents of Akhara villages and members of farmer unions, including the BKU (Ekta Dakauda) district president, staged a protest in front of the residence of an AAP MLA in Jagraon city (Ludhiana, Punjab) demanding the removal of biogas plants from several nearby villages.

The protesters brought along bullock carts and horse drawn carts and raised slogans to mark their protest.

The protesters also demanded in investigation into allegations of irregularities by the National Testing Agency (NTA) which conducted the NEET exam, and raised slogans to mark their protest.

On 18 June 2024, residents of many villages gathered, joined by an INC MP and an MLA, and staged a sit-in protest at the power station in Kailashpur village (Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh) against the frequent power cuts in the area.

On 18 June 2024, members and religious leaders of the Jain community gathered at Navjivan Society and held a protest in Mumbai city (Mumbai Suburban, Maharashtra) over the claimed vandalization of idols of Jain Tirthankaras in Pavagadh area in the state.

On 18 June 2024, stamp vendors under the banner of the All Uttar Pradesh Stamp Vendors Association went on strike and staged a protest, raising slogans, at the premises of the Civil Court in Balrampur town (Uttar Pradesh) over various demands including the provision of a one percent commission in e-stamp.

On 18 June 2024, members of the National Domestic Workers Movement and the Tamil Nadu Domestic Workers Welfare Trust staged a protest in Madurai city (Tamil Nadu) demanding the BJP-led Union government and the DMK-led state government to fulfil their demands which included the protection of their rights, medical insurance, weekly time off, an increase in their salaries and pension benefits. The protesters carried placards to mark their protest.

On 18 June 2024, employees led by the Federal Parliament Secretariat Employees' Union staged a sit-in protest at the office of the General Secretary in the New Baneshwor locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding additional service facilities and allowances for working beyond office hours.

On 18 June 2024, crusher businesspersons and members of the Federation of Nepal Crushers and Mining Industry Professionals staged a protest rally in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding the revitalization of the crusher industry and urging the government to enforce the 2079 B.S. Cabinet decision on regulations for crusher industries, highlighting concerns about the impracticality of the distance-related criteria set in 2077 B.S.
On 18 June 2024, drivers and conductors of the private buses held a protest in Nagasenai in Nuwara Eliya town (Nuwara Eliya, Central), demanding to reconstruct the Thalawakala- Diagama Road.

On 18 June 2024, religious leaders, youth, social activists, women and the general public of Irudhaiyapuram held a protest in front of the divisional secretariat building in Muttur town (Trincomalee, Eastern), demanding the cancellation of the license of a liquor store in Muttur Irudhaiyapuram area.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), Sri Lanka Bank Employees Union held a protest in front of the People's Bank head office in Colombo city (Colombo, Western), demanding that State Bank employees be given a salary commensurate with their tax burden.

On 18 June 2024, around 3000 university non-academic staff participated in a protest organized by the University Trade Union Joint Committee in Colombo city (Colombo, Western), demanding to provide solutions to their issues, including salary discrepancies.

On 18 June 2024, Joint National Organization of Public Service Pensioners held a protest at Polduwa junction in the Battaramulla South suburb (Colombo, Western). The reason for the protest was not specified.

On 18 June 2024, employees of the State Express Transport Corporation (SETC) affiliated to the CITU staged a protest in front of the SETC depot on Ettayapuram road in Thoothukudi city (Tamil Nadu) demanding the DMK-led state government to fulfil their demands which included an increase in their wages, the filling up of vacancies and benefits for retired employees. The protesters threatened to hold a hunger strike if their demands were not met.

On 18 June 2024, members of the TMC staged a protest at Kovilpatti taluk office in Kovilpatti town (Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu) demanding the authorities to provide pattas (land deeds) for the people of Valluvar Nagar.

The protesters also demanded Provident Fund (PF) benefits and Employees' State Insurance Scheme of India (ESIC) benefits.

On 18 June 2024, a large number of students affiliated to the AISF, the SFI, NSUI, PDSU, Vidhyarthi Jana Samithi, AAP Students Wing, the AIYF, and the DYFI, and members of the BRS and it's student wing staged separate protests at the Dr. BR Ambedkar statue on Upper Tank Bund, at the Raj Bhavan and at the Secretariat in Hyderabad city (Telangana) demanding the BJP-led Union government to cancel the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) over allegations of malpractice and corruption. The protesters also demanded in investigation into allegations of irregularities by the National Testing Agency (NTA) which conducted the NEET exam and held flags and placards to mark their protest.

On 18 June 2024, members of the BRS including a former deputy mayor and others staged a protest in front of the Khanapuram Haveli police station in Khanapuram Haveli town (Khammam, Telangana) against the arrest of a BRS corporator based on a complaint by the Khammam Urban tahsildar accusing him of encroaching upon government land. The protesters accused the INC-led state government of targeting Opposition leaders and demanded the authorities to release the BRS Corporator.

On 18 June 2024, family members of the deceased and supporters gathered in huge numbers, joined by the ASP and Bhim Army Chief (MP), and staged a protest, raising slogans, at Ghantaghar Park in Aligarh city (Uttar Pradesh) against the murder of a young man from the Dalit community (coded separately) and demanded action against the accused and compensation for the deceased's family. The protesters also staged a protest outside the District Magistrate's residence. This was the ninth day of the protest. The first day has been coded separately.

On 18 June 2024, an elderly man and his family members from Arepalli village staged a protest on the Tekumatla road in Tekumatla village (Mancherial, Telangana) accusing an Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) of cheating him in a land deal. The protesters demanded the police and elected representatives to take action against the police officer and held bottles of pesticide to mark their protest.

On 18 June 2024, students affiliated to the KSU staged a sit-in protest at the office of the Regional Deputy Director (RDD) of Education in Kozhikode city (Kerala) demanding the LDF-led state government to allot more higher secondary seats in the Malabar region in the state. Police detained the protesters.

On 18 June 2024, hundreds of Teacher Eligibility Test (TET)/ Teacher Aptitude Test (TAT) selected candidates led by incumbent INC member of legislative assembly held a protest march to the secretariat in Gandhinagar city (Gujarat) over regularization of jobs. Police forcefully intervened and stopped the rally and detained around 300 protestors.

source: Ada Derana; Colombo Gazette; Colombo Post; Daily Mirror (Sri Lanka); Hiru News; Lankadeepa; Morning (Sri Lanka); Virakesari
notes: On 18 June 2024, a group of unemployed graduates participated in a protest organized by the Western Province Unemployed Graduates Union in front of the Diyatha Uiyana Park in Battaramulla South suburb (Colombo, Western), demanding employment for all unemployed graduates. Police used water cannons and tear gas to disperse the protesters.

On 18 June 2024, a crude bomb belonging to unidentified assailants exploded in the Eranholi town (Kannur, Kerala) and killed a man when he was collecting coconuts from an empty house near his residence.

On 18 June 2024, a clash ensued between business owners (scrap dealers) and the police in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The incident occurred after the demonstrators pelted stones at the police, resulting in the police charging batons to take the situation under control. The demonstrators were against the metropolis' decision to remove scrap collection centers inside the Ring Road area.

On 18 June 2024, local people and family members of the deceased staged a demonstration at the culvert square (Rispana no. 6) and pelted stones at the house of a man in Dehradun city (Uttarakhand) who was suspected of being involved in the shooting and murder of a man - and injury of 2 others - on 16 June. The demonstrators demanded the bulldozing of the house of the accused.

On 18 June 2024, employees of LARCO, a Mining and Metallurgical company in financial hardship, rallied outside the Ministry of Finance in Athens - Central Athens to protest against the dismissal of its 850 employees and a last minute law amendment by the government. They were supported by labor unions and associations, PAME and OGE, members and MPs of KKE, members of the labor centers of Euboea and Larissa carrying banners, and students from schools in Larymna.

On 18 June 2024, journalist Freard Rista and his cameraman wear attacked and their gear damaged when they were trying to report on an illegal dump site in Vlore. The journalists were attacked by employees of a furniture company who were throwing spare and damaged parts into the environment instead of disposing of them properly.

On 18 June 2024, supporters of detained journalist Duman Mukhamedkarim gathered outside the court in the town of Qonayev (formerly Kapchagay township of Kapshagay district) in Almaty region in protest of his detention, demanding the journalist's release from custody.

On 18 June 2024, residents of Lenger township in Tole bi district of Turkistan region gathered outside their homes in protest of poor supply of drinking water to their households, demanding that the authorities fix the issue and provide stable supply of water in the area.
On 18 June 2024, around 20 people protested in Jelgava, Latvia, calling against the construction of a shopping center on the banks of the Lielupe River.
On 18 June 2024, farmers blocked the main road through Veles, demanding that their water supply be consistent after facing issues with the irrigation of their crops.
On 18 June 2024, farmers continued blocking a local highway near Dunkowiczki, protesting against the proposed construction of a new infrastructure over arable land.

On 18 June 2024, about 1000 activists gathered for a march through Bratislava, demanding preservation of civic freedoms, greater assistance to Ukraine during the Russian invasion as well as immediate climate action. Greta Thunberg also joined the event.

On 18 June 2024, activists from the Emergency Break movement blocked a motorway in Copenhagen to demand an end to motorway construction and to oppose the government's plan to build 15 more motorways in the country. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, six people were detained.
On 18 June 2024, people gathered outside the city hall in Orebro to oppose the proposed 15 percent increase in fees for medical and disability transport services.

On 18 June 2024, Eritrean community members demonstrated outside the city hall in Stockholm to oppose the municipality's decision to allow the Eritrean cultural festival, which is mainly attended by supporters of the current Eritrean government.

On 18 June 2024, demonstrators, including Extinction Rebellion activists, demonstrated outside of the Swedish parliament in Stockholm to oppose the Defense Cooperation Agreement (DCA) between Sweden and the US that would grant the US armed forces access to Swedish military bases.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line in Abbeville (Hauts-de-France). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of FSU and other unions, around 30 people gathered in Aix-en-Provence (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest against the privatization of social housing.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT, striking postal workers gathered for a picket line outside the post office in Alenya (Occitanie) to protest against the closure of 4 post offices in the region.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Amiens (Hauts-de-France). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, people gathered outside the clinic in Arcachon (Nouvelle-Aquitaine). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of The Ecologists, LFI, PS, and PCF, around 100 people gathered on the Pors Pere wharf in Audierne (Bretagne) to protest against President Emmanuel Macron on the occasion of his visit to the locality.

On 18 June 2024, around 50 people gathered outside the Sub-Prefecture in Auxerre (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, around 50 striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Avranches (Normandie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, under the motto 'The Preh family sticks together' and at the call of IGM, 1,400 employees of the automotive supplier Preh staged a protest in Bad Neustadt an der Saale (Bayern) for the preservation of jobs and to call for alternative solutions such as reduction in working hours and short-time work. The context of the protest was a recent announcement of Preh to cut around 420 jobs at its Bad Neustadt site.

actors: Military Forces of France (2017-) Gendarmerie Mayotte
notes: On 18 June 2024, youths set up a roadblock with street furniture before robbing automobilists in Bandrele (Brandrele). Gendarmerie intervened and clashes with the rioters ensued. The rioters were arrested.
On 18 June 2024, residents of the Vallcarca neighborhood protested in Barcelona - Gracia (Cataluna) against plans to build a research institute at the local Doctor Comas i Llaberia Park.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, overnight, unknown people threw a cobblestone at the window of the office of Bundestag member Caren Lay (The Left) in Bautzen (Sachsen), shattering it. There was no report of injuries.

On 18 June 2024, around 400 people demonstrated in Bayonne (Nouvelle-Aquitaine). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, overnight, unknown people set three Tesla vehicles on fire in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin). The property destruction was claimed on Indymedia as a means to denounce Tesla, Elon Musk, and the expansion of the Tesla factory in Grunheide. The perpetrators also said they wanted to raise awareness about the harmfulness of EVs and the associated exploitation of raw materials and workers in lithium mines.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of FO, striking elderly home (EHPAD) workers gathered for a picket line outside their workplace in Bernay (Normandie) to protest against the closure of the home's canteen.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line in Besancon (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, eight men with covered faces assaulted two gay men outside Blackburn Train Station in Blackburn (England) after shouting homophobic slurs and threatening them. Police forces arrested eight people in connection to the case. The victims were hospitalized and had chest and head injuries.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of Young Palestinians of Italy, people, including students, pro-Palestine activists, and members of the Palestinian community in Italy, staged a demonstration at the Rectorate of the University of Bologna (Emilia-Romagna), where they symbolically planted an olive tree to ask the university to boycott the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, and stop all collaboration with Israeli research centers involved in the war in the Gaza Strip.
On 18 June 2024, people, including Mayor Ludovic Chaput (PCF), gathered outside the local elderly home (EHPAD) in Bourbon-l'Archambault (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to protest against its closure.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Bourg-en-Bresse (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, members of ACORN held a protest outside the house of a mom with four kids in Bristol (England) to protest against the bailiff's plans to evict her and her family. The bailiff left as protesters blocked access to the house.

On 18 June 2024, an unknown number of XR activists protested in front of the offices of the AIG and Marsh insurance companies in Brussels - Ixelles (Brussels) to denounce their funding of the EACOP crude oil pipeline project that threatens wildlife habitats in Africa.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers, including CGT affiliates, gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Caen (Normandie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, about 100 people, including members of CGIL, CISL, and UIL, and striking teachers and caregivers employed by public nursery schools, staged a demonstration in front of the Municipality in Como (Lombardia) to protest against the closure of some nursery schools decided by the council.

On 18 June 2024, hundreds of breeders and farmers with their tractors staged a picket outside one of the offices of the Agriculture Department in Cosenza (Calabria) to protest against the presence of wild boars in the area. Representatives of Coldiretti were present.

On 18 June 2024, around 100 people, including parents, children, the mayor (Alliance Germany), childcare employees, and educators, participated in a protest in Dresden (Sachsen) against the withdrawal of funding for the renovation of a childcare center in Ragewitz.

On 18 June 2024, medical students participated in a protest in Dresden (Sachsen) to call for better working conditions, standardized medical learning and training concepts, better regulations on absenteeism and higher, nationwide standardized wages during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.

On 18 June 2024, up to 100 people gathered outside the Parliament in Dublin (Dublin) after disturbing footage of animal abuse filmed at the facility was aired in an RTE Investigates documentary earlier that week. Protesters called on authorities to shut down the facility. Charity My Lovely Horse organized the protest.

On 18 June 2024, employees of restaurants, including Brewers Fayre, Table Table, and Beefeater, represented by Unite, protested outside a building holding the Premier Inn investor meeting in Dunstable (England), denouncing plans to cut 1,500 jobs despite rising profits. Protesters held banners and signs.
On 18 June 2024, students' parents and teachers gathered outside the Simone-Veil school in Elven (Bretagne) to demand the opening of an additional class.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line in Epinal (Grand Est). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, dentists staged a protest in Esslingen am Neckar (Baden-Wurttemberg) for better political framework conditions, against bureaucracy, and for higher budgets for treatments and digitalization. The participants also expressed their concerns regarding medical care in rural areas.

On 18 June 2024, about 50 students and pro-Palestine activists staged a picket in Firenze (Toscana) to ask the Academic Senate to vote on a motion to interrupt agreements with Israeli universities, accusing the University of Florence of being complicit in the killing of Palestinian civilians.

Around 18 June 2024, a 36-year-old male member of the LGBTQ+ community was insulted and physically assaulted by a group of people in Foggia (Puglia). The assailants also racially insulted a foreign girl present at the scene, and injured a friend of the victim who had intervened. The police were investigating the matter and believed the attack was a hate crime at the time of reporting.
On 18 June 2024, more than 100 people held a protest in Fornelos de Montes (Galicia) to denounce the removal of the pediatric service and the lack of doctors in their health center.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT and SUD, railway workers gathered in Grande-Synthe (Hauts-de-France) to demand more state funding for the national freight system.

On 18 June 2024, more than 50 residents held a peaceful protest outside Edward Moore House on Trinity Road in Gravesend (England) over a lack of communication about plans to house unaccompanied asylum-seeking children in their street.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT, striking nuclear research center (CEA) employees gathered for a picket line in Grenoble (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to demand a pay rise to cover for inflation.

On 18 June 2024, around 50 residents and shop owners gathered outside the town hall before the municipal council in Guemene-sur-Scorff (Bretagne) to protest against the locality's mismanagement by the Mayor and his team.

On 18 June 2024, around 80 teachers of the Hamburg Adult Education Center (VHS) and GEW staged a protest in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg), calling for better working conditions and better funding for adult education, and criticizing the lack of social security and pay in cases of illness.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT, striking GEPOR (ArcelorMittal) employees blocked access to their factory in Illange (Grand Est) to protest against the sale of their company.

Around 18 June 2024 (as reported), 10 activists staged a protest in the courtyard of the faculty of social and economic sciences of the University in Innsbruck (Tirol) and set up an encampment in solidarity with Palestine and for peace.

On 18 June 2024, under the motto 'Immediate end' and at the call of 'Koblenz District Dental Association' (Bezirkszahnarztekammer Koblenz), several hundred employees from dental clinics (medical and non-medical) took part in a protest in Koblenz (Rheinland-Pfalz) for a reduction in bureaucracy and to draw attention to staff shortage and the rising costs of dental clinics.
On 18 June 2024, people participated in a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to call for fair debt relief for poor countries, as well as global debt reduction.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT and CFDT, striking Sarthe Habitat employees gathered for a picket line outside their workplace in Le Mans (Pays de la Loire) to protest against a planned increase in working hours.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of the local Antifa, UCL - Libertarian Communist Union (Union Communiste Libertaire), CSL - Highschool Collective in Solidarity (Collectif Solidaire Lyceen), CGT, and FSU, around 100 people demonstrated in Le Puy-en-Velay (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 18 June 2024, around 200 employees of CPI Clausen&Bosse participated in a protest in Leck (Schleswig-Holstein) for higher wages. The protest was organized as part of a nationwide action in the context of collective bargaining negotiations, whereby Ver.di demanded a 12-percent wage increase for employees of the printing industry.

On 18 June 2024, under the motto 'Rally for diversity, democracy and respect for human dignity', people participated in a protest in Lehre (Niedersachsen) against an AfD citizens' dialogue taking place simultaneously.
On 18 June 2024, several dozen people protested in Lugo (Galicia) to demand farmers on medical leave not to pay social security fees.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of several organizations, around 200 people, including climate activists, gathered outside the Court of Justice in Lyon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to demand the release of 8 climate activists who broke into the Arkema factory in Pierre-Benir on 2 March 2024 to protest against the production of toxic chemicals by the company.
On 18 June 2024, at the call of CFDT, FO, and SNU (FSU), around 50 France Travail employees demonstrated in Mamoudzou (Mamoudzou) to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT and CFDT, several dozen striking security guards gathered for a picket line outside the Marseille airport in Marignane (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to demand better working conditions and the payment of a bonus during the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of Coldiretti, more than 1,000 breeders and farmers staged a demonstration in Duca d'Aosta Square in Milano - Municipio 2 (Lombardia) to protest against the health, social, economic, and environmental problems caused by wildlife, and in particular wild boars, present in the area.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of FSU, teachers and students' parents gathered outside the Lou-Blazer school in Montbeliard (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of SNES-FSU, striking teachers gathered for a picket line outside the Lucie-Aubrac school in Montevrain (Ile-de-France) to protest against what they deemed toxic management.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of France Israel and other Jewish organizations, around 100 people, including Mayor Michael Delafosse (PS), national deputy Laurence Cristol (Renaissance), Senators Hussein Bourgi (PS) and Jean-Pierre Grand (Horizons), as well as Castelnau Mayor Frederic Lafforgue (political affiliation not specified) gathered in Montpellier (Occitanie) to demand the release of all hostages detained by Hamas and condemn antisemitism.

On 18 June 2024, around 20 striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the Saint-Odilon clinic in Moulins (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, overnight, an unidentified group of people smashed the windows and sprayed paint on cybersecurity company Obvious Technologies in Nanterre (Ile-de-France) to protest against state repression and mass surveillance. The act was claimed by a far-left group on Attaque.

On 18 June 2024, people, including children from the St. Pius daycare center belonging to the church, staged a protest in Neustadt an der Weinstrasse (Rheinland-Pfalz) for children's rights and to demand more child participation and involvement. The occasion of the protest was an action day for freedom organized by the foundation 'Children research' (Kinder Forschen).

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Nimes (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, more than 100 people protested in front of the regional parliament in Palma de Mallorca (Islas Baleares) against the repeal of the Democratic Memory Law of the Balearic Islands, which was recently approved in the Balearic Chamber.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2024, 8 people broke into the headquarters of microchip company Exxelia in Paris (Ile-de-France). They ransacked the lobby and sprayed paint on furniture. Police intervened and arrested all people, including one journalist covering the event. The action was carried out against the sale of military-use microchips to the Israeli army, whose military offensive in Gaza they condemned.

On 18 June 2024, striking workers gathered for a picket line outside the clinic in Perigueux (Nouvelle-Aquitaine). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.
On 18 June 2024, around 30 assistants for students with disabilities (AESH) gathered outside the Bernard-de-Ventadour in Privas (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to demand permanent work contracts.

On 18 June 2024, people, including residents, students, and workers, demonstrated in Rabat (Northern) to protest against the excessive occupation of public space in St. George's Square by commercial venues. Representatives of the St. George's Parish, La Stella Philharmonic Society, Belt Victoria Foundation, Moviment Graffitti, Gozo This Sweet Art, and Together for a Better Environment (FAA) were present.

On 18 June 2024, under the motto 'Rastede's future is young', more than 600 people, including members of school parents' councils, participated in a protest in Rastede (Niedersachsen) for better equipment for schools, to draw attention to existing issues such as lack of space, canceled lessons, a refurbishment backlog, poor IT equipment, and a lack of school social workers, and to call for a permanent citizens' council to deal with these issues.

On 18 June 2024, a large group of people gathered in Santi Apostoli Square in Roma - City Center (Lazio) to protest against a law proposal providing for the implementation of differentiated levels of regional autonomy across Italy. Representatives of PD, M5S, AVS, More Europe, CGIL, and ANPI were present. MP and PD national secretary Elly Schlein, and M5S party leader Giuseppe Conte also attended the demonstration.

On 18 June 2024, around 100 employees of various broadcasters, including SR, SWR, WDR, and ZDF, staged a protest in Saarbrucken (Saarland) for fair pay, temporarily blocking the access road to a meeting of ARD directors at the Halberg. The participants demand a 10.5-percent wage increase.

On 18 June 2024, around 50 striking workers gathered for a picket line and slowed down traffic outside the local clinic in Saint-Aubin-sur-Scie (Normandie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, around 30 striking workers gathered for a picket line in Saint-Esteve (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, around 100 striking workers gathered outside the clinic in Saint-Etienne (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.

On 18 June 2024, striking municipal workers gathered for a picket line and blocked access to the garbage truck depot in Saint-Flour (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to demand better working conditions and a pay rise.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of CGT, CFDT, UNSA, CFTC, CFE-CGC, between 90 and 250 striking nuclear research center (CEA) employees gathered for a picket line in Saint-Paul-les-Durance (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to demand a pay rise to cover for inflation.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of UFTAD - Federal Union of Waste Workers (Union Federale des Travailleurs du Dechet), striking garbage collectors gathered for a picket line in Saint-Pierre-les-Nemours (Ile-de-France) to demand better working conditions and protest against insecurity as well as the lack of respect from residents.
On 18 June 2024, around 7,000 people, including CCOO representatives, held a protest in Sevilla (Andalucia) to denounce the deterioration of public services such as healthcare and education.
On 18 June 2024, students' parents gathered outside the Academic Inspection in Strasbourg (Grand Est) to protest against homeschooling bans, which they considered unfair.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of BUND and the citizens' initiative 'Nessa', around 50 people participated in a protest in Teuchern (Sachsen-Anhalt) against the planned construction of an inter-municipal industrial and commercial area along the A9 motorway, with some citing environmental concerns.

On 18 June 2024, people demonstrated in Torino (Piemonte) in defense of the Constitution and against the policies of Meloni's government. Representatives of PD, M5S, local officials, and the local association 'Ecological Left' (Sinistra Ecologista) were present.

On 18 June 2024, between 25 and 30 striking workers gathered for a picket line in Tregueux (Bretagne). The event was part of a nationwide strike movement by private clinic health workers, thermal spa employees, and elderly home (EHPAD) employees called by CFDT and UNSA to demand a pay rise and better career opportunities.
On 18 June 2024, youths clashed with each other before clashing with gendarmes in Tsararano (Dembeni). The motives were likely linked to rivalries between youth groups from different localities.

On 18 June 2024, at the call of Ver.di, around 300 employees of the printing industry participated in a protest in Ulm (Baden-Wurttemberg) to demand higher wages. The protest was organized as part of a nationwide action amid collective bargaining negotiations, in which Ver.di demanded a 12-percent wage increase.

On 18 June 2024, in the afternoon, about 200 students and professors protested at the Academiegebouw in Utrecht (Utrecht) to denounce the police violent action the week before following the occupation of a university building by pro-Palestinian protesters.

On 18 June 2024, 300 people protested outside the Intum headquarters in Valladolid (Castilla y Leon) to defend jobs following an Employment Regulation File proposal by the company, which they argued could impact a third of the company's workforce.

On 18 June 2024, over 300 members of Northern Peasant Federation gathered at Lampang Provincial Hall in Phra Bat, Mueang Lampang (Lampang) staged a protest and submitted a letter to the Governor and the Forest Resource Management Office, demanding a halt to the inspection of traditional farming plots under the Prairie Protection Action Plan. This move followed an unannounced inspection by officials on June 13, which threatened the confiscation of these plots.

On 18 June 2024, members of the June 24 Democracy Group and Thai Academic Network for Civil Rights (TANC; led by professors) staged a protest outside Bangkok South Criminal Court in Bangkok - Sathon to demand the release on bail of a political activist, imprisoned for violating Section 112.

On 18 June 2024, protesters, including members of the Daegu Conference of Civic Groups, held a press conference and picketed in front of the February 28th Jungang Memorial Park (Daegu - Jung). They called for the normalization of medical care amid a medical vacuum, condemning doctors' strikes and the government's negligence.

On 18 June 2024, protesters, including members of the Jeonbuk Network for Strengthening Public Healthcare, held a press conference and picketed in front of the Jeonbuk Bank headquarters (Jeonju). They urged the doctors to return to hospitals from their strike, during which they opposed the government's decision to increase the medical school enrollment quota next year. They also urged the government to initiate a social dialogue regarding the matter for the normalization of medical care amid a medical vacuum.

On 18 June 2024, members of the local civic groups, including Ulsan Healthy Society Citizens' Union, held a press conference with a banner and picketed at the Ulsan Metropolitan City Hall (Ulsan - Nam) to urge the doctors to call off the strike.

On 18 June 2024, about 200 members of local occupation organizations held a rally in front of the Wangjo 1-dong Office (Suncheon) and marched to Homeplus in Jorye-dong (Suncheon). They urged the authorities to establish a medical school at the Sunchon National University and a university hospital in Suncheon.

On 18 June 2024, members of the Korea Federation of Micro Enterprise (KFME) held a press conference with a banner and picketed at the KFME office (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to revise the minimum wage system to adopt differential application by industry.

On 18 June 2024, members of the anti-nuclear groups, including No Nukes Busan, held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Busan Metropolitan City Hall (Busan - Yeonje). They urged the authorities to shut down the Gori Nuclear Power Plant Units 2 to 4 due to safety concerns.

On 18 June 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Korean Mart Labor Union held a press conference and picketed in front of the Busan Metropolitan City Hall (Busan - Yeonje). They urged authorities to revise the Distribution Industry Development Act and strengthen the right to rest and health for mart workers.

On 18 June 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Incheon International Airport Labor Union held a press conference with a banner and picketed at the Incheon International Airport (Incheon - Jung). They condemned the Incheon International Airport Corporation, citing they have made employees take care of tasks that the bomb disposal team should take charge of.

On 18 June 2024, members of the Solidarity Against Disability Discrimination (SADD) held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Incheon District Prosecutors' Office (Incheon - Michuhol). They urged the authorities to thoroughly investigate a local psychiatric hospital for alleged abuse and harassment against a patient.

On 18 June 2024, about 40 teachers affiliated with the Daejeon Teachers Union (FKTU affiliate) and Elementary School Teachers' Union, held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Ministry of Personnel Management (Sejong City - Dodam). They urged the authorities to acknowledge the death of a teacher at an elementary school in Daejeon, as a death in the line of duty.

On 18 June 2024, protesters, including KCTU and FKTU members and lawmakers affiliated with the Democratic Party of Korea, Progressive Party, Social Democratic Party, and Rebuilding Korea Party, held a press conference with a banner at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged authorities to promote laborers' rights and legislate the revised bill of the Trade Union And Labor Relations Adjustment Act Articles 2 and 3 (yellow envelope bill).

Carmen Amato Jr. (R), and the New Jersey Business and Industry Association President was present.

Human rights group Karapatan said the soldiers did not have a search warrant, were not accompanied by the police or barangay officials, and planted a firearm in the house. On 18 June 2024, people protested in Perth, Western Australia, against the China's human rights abuses against Muslim Uyghur minority groups in Xinjiang, oppression in Tibet, and Beijing's crackdown on dissent in Hong Kong. They opposed the sudden termination of their contract. They engaged in scuffles with the police and set fire to umbrellas.

They submitted 51,726 signatures to the Ministry, holding banners that read, 'I don't want to allow a made-in-Japan weapon to take the life of a child in another country.' Members of the NAJAT, Shufuren, Association Against Arms Trade Shows at Makuhari Messe, Moms Against the Security Laws - Chiba, Zenroren, and Aichi Peace Committee (affiliated with the Japan Peace Committee), monks of Nipponzan Myohoji Temple, and a JCP Diet member attended the event.

They held a banner that read, 'Don't use soil which includes the remains of Okinawa War victims for the construction of the Henoko military base.'

region: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
notes: On 18 June 2024, a civilian was wounded by a bomb planted by unidentified assailants at a gasoline station in Barangay Matibay, Lamitan City (Basilan, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). The SLM/A-Nur coordinated their movement with RSF as they were neutral. 5 of SLM/A-Nur were killed, including their leader, and many were wounded, in addition to 20 soldiers and 8 military were captured. The soldiers were released later.

notes: On 17 June 2024, clashes between SAF, backed by Darfur Joint Forces/JSAMF, and RSF, backed by allied militias (described as an Arab militia, coded as Darfur Arab militia), continued in Um Baar (location coded to Wadi Dor, Um Baru, North Darfur) and Al Zorg (coded separately). Both claimed to inflict huge losses on the other, in addition, RSF claimed they destroyed 30 Joint Force military vehicles, and captured 162 vehicles, 8 armored vehicles, and other equipment. RSF claimed they killed 400 Joint Forces soldiers (unverified) and repelled and forced them to withdraw until Arori, Mazabd, and Al Haraz areas. Unspecified fatalities coded as 10.

On 17 June 2024, RSF, backed by allied militias (described as an Arab militia, coded as Darfur Arab militia) attacked and burned three villages including Um Baar (location coded to Wadi Dor, Um Baru, North Darfur) and Roro (coded separately). RSF looted civilians' properties. Casualties unknown.
On 17 June 2024, RSF on 7 military vehicles withdrew from Al Gaili and surrendered to SAF in Shendi (Shendi, River Nile).

On 17 June 2024, thousands of protesters held a demonstration in Jerusalem (Jerusalem, Jerusalem), near Netanyahu's official residence and at a separate demonstration near the Knesset, calling for new elections, a ceasefire and hostage release deal with Hamas, and against laws giving draft exemptions to ultra-Orthodox Jews and another against 'incitement' in academia. Near Netanyahu's home, Labor Party chairman Yair Golan spoke and police dispersed the demonstration while arresting nine people.

On 17 June 2024, one Taliban member was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in the limits of Charikar city, Parwan. He had been accused of crimes by Jabulussaraj district residents including murder, robbery and extortion. The Taliban didn't provide any comment.

On 17 June 2024, in Palmichal, San Jose, parents of students protested at Palmichal School to prevent the return of the school cook, who had been detained the previous week on suspicion of drug dealing. Although the cook was released with precautionary measures and scheduled to resume work, parents blocked her entry.
On 17 June 2024, around Palencia, Guatemala, a long-distance bus driver was killed by unidentified attackers. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2024, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, former employees of the Leonardo Martinez Valenzuela hospital protested demanding the payment of two months of back wages. The protesters reported that their contract was canceled and they were sent away without their respective salaries.

On 17 June 2024, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, a group of motorcyclists protested demanding justice for the death of a minor killed by a police officer when he was driving a motorcycle. The exact location of the protest within the capital was not reported.

On 17 June 2024, in Gracias, Lempira, several armed men kidnapped and later killed an underage boy in the Borjas neighborhood. The victim was at a park with friends when the individuals took him away by force. The body of the victim was found later on the same day and showed signs of torture. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2024, in Kingston, Kingston, in the morning, a group of about 10 armed response officers employed to KingAlarm security services held a protest with banners outside the company's Caledonia Road head office (Saint Andrew parish) calling for higher wages and a better work environment, among other labor-related claims.

Around 17 June 2024 (as reported), in Changuinola municipality, Bocas del Toro, parents protested at the Basic General Education Center (CEBA) at Finca 4, demanding action from the school director regarding alleged cases of sexual abuse, drug use, and irregular behavior among students. They also demanded involvement in monitoring through the school's security cameras, a request denied by educational authorities due to confidentiality laws.

Around 17 June 2024 (week of), in Panama City, Panama, protesters that are residents of the Huerta Sandoval area blocked the street in front of Amelia Denis de Icaza Park to protest an 11-day water outage and the poor condition of local roads.

source: Loop News Trinidad and Tobago; Newsday Trinidad and Tobago; Trinidad and Tobago Guardian
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Enterprise, Chaguanas, an armed man exited a tinted grey vehicle (driven by an accomplice) and opened fire on a man on Mc Carthy Street. The shooter fled the scene in the waiting car. Motivation unknown. 2 injured.

All the involved, both perpetrators and victims, were members of the PCC. The victims were involved in a plan to kidnap and kill a senator and other public security authorities. 2 fatalities.

The bill makes the process stricter and equivalent to homicide if done after 22 weeks of pregnancy, even for rape victims.

Around 17 June 2024 (as reported), in Ananindeua (Para), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found in the Icui-Guajara neighborhood with gunshot wounds to the head and with his hands and feet tied up with wire. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2024, in Recife (Pernambuco), a group of building owners protested in the city center. The group questioned the determined compensation amounts to be received by structurally condemned property owners.

Authorship and motivations for the event are unknown. 1 fatality.

actors: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

They were suspects of killing three people on a shooting in Barra de Sao Miguel (coded separately). 4 fatalities.

actors: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police

actors: Military Forces of Brazil (2023-) Military Police
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Missao Velha (Ceara), military police officers exchanged fire with an armed suspect. The officers were conducting a patrol when received reports about an armed man inside a supermarket. The officers approached the suspect, who tried to escape and fired against the officers. An armed clash took place, and the suspect was shot and injured. Even after being shot, the suspect continued to escape but ended up being arrested. Police seized a firearm and ammunition. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2024, in Santa Rita (Paraiba), two unidentified armed individuals shot and injured a teenaged boy in the Alto das Populares neighbourhood. The suspects approached the victim and fired against him, escaping afterwards. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

notes: On 17 June 2024, near Sinamaica village (Zulia), a group of residents of the Elias Sanchez Rubio parish, including some Wayuu Indigenous people, blocked the Troncal 6 road in protest after being left out of an ID registration process that took place the week prior. According to them, at least 2500 people were unable to renew their identity cards. The ID card issuance day had been organized by the Ministry for Indigenous Peoples. Likewise, they demanded the provision of new electric transformers.

On 17 June 2024, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), CICPC police forces shot and killed a member of the Los Teletubies Gang, and arrested three others, including an adolescent girl, during an armed clash in the San Juan parish. The CICPC officers were investigating the theft of a vehicle belonging to a taxi driver in the area, when they spotted the suspects negotiating the return of the car to its owner. These initiated a shooting, and one of them was injured in the gunfire and pronounced dead in hospital. Another one managed to escape; three others were arrested. The gang is linked to thefts of taxi cabs, which they would then sell back to their legitimate owners. Police collected a gun, and seized two vehicles. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2024, in Maiquetia (La Guaira), a group of demonstrators, including human rights activists, members of the LCR opposition party, and representatives of the Women for Vargas feminist group, protested against the arrests of a journalist, and two members of the VP and VV opposition parties, which they consider arbitrary, and to demand their immediate liberation, and the cessation of repression and political persecution in the country. They gathered in the Soublette Avenue.

actors: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Leonardo Infante municipality (coded to Valle De La Pascua, Guarico), GNB military forces clashed with members of the Tren del Llano Gang, killing one, during an armed clash part of a security operation against the gang in a rural sector known as El Corozo. The soldiers collected a gun and a grenade, and seized a motorcycle. In the El Kilombo sector of the neighboring Jose Tadeo Monagas municipality the security forces arrested a man, and collected the grenade and 57 grams of crack cocaine that he was carrying. Three other women were arrested in an unspecified nearby location. 1 fatality.

notes: On 17 June 2024, around San Pedro Las Playas, Guerrero, the elected municipal president of Copala of the MA party was shot and killed by armed individuals who intercepted him when he was travelling on the Acapulco-Pinotepa Nacional federal highway. The perpetrators forced the driver of his unit to stop, boarded the car and fatally shot the elected mayor. A woman was also injured in the attack. The victim was a retired captain of the Navy Secretariat. He was travelling back from Mexico city after meetings with the Navy authorities. The victim decided to run for the municipal presidency of Copala after the coordinator of the Green Ecologist Party of Mexico in Copala was found killed in June 2023. 1 fatality.

Around 17 June 2024 (between 16 - 17 June), in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, two men were killed and their bodies were found in a house in Colonia Valle de Lincoln. Also in the same colonia, another man and a woman were killed, and their bodies were found in another home. Also, another man and a woman were killed, and their bodies were found in a house in Colonia Los Parques. Also, in Colonia Valle de Lincoln, a man was killed, and his body was found with his face unrecognizable due to the gunshot wounds received in the face inside a house. All the victims were attacked during the night, and the four attacks are related to a dispute between criminal groups. In at least two of the attacks (unknown which ones), threatening banners were left. 7 fatalities.

On 17 June 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, two armed men shot at a house in Colonia Las Sabinitas. A man who was inside the house was injured. The victim had previously been attacked years before. 1 injured.

This event is held after the lynching of 5 people of which 4 died after they were accused of stealing vehicles in the area (coded separately).
On 17 June 2024, in Ayotoxco de Guerrero, Puebla, around 10 workers of the Comprehensive Hospital started a strike and demonstrate outside the hospital against irregularities and mistreatment.

On 17 June 2024, around Santiago de Queretaro, Queretaro, people blocked the Mexico-Queretaro highway to demand the presence of authorities from the Attorney General's Office of the State of Mexico (FGJEM) against an unjust arrest.

On 17 June 2024, in Comalcalco, Tabasco, two armed men shot and killed a man in his business for repairing cell phones. The killing was related to his refusal to pay the 'floor fee' (extorsion). The victim had received threats days before for refusing to pay the so-called 'floor fee'. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2024, in Altamira, Tamaulipas, merchants and residents blocked the streets to demand the attention of the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) against the power failure that they have been experiencing in the last days.

On 17 June 2024, in Altamira, Tamaulipas, families members from at least four neighborhoods protested against the construction of a fence on the neighborhood crossing on Dr. Burton Grossman Street. The residents stated that this would block the access to several services.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Villa Emiliano Zapata, Veracruz, residents of Colonia Santa Lucia demonstrated and block the Las Trancas-Coatepec highway with stones to demand service from the Municipal Water and Sanitation Commission (CMAS) of the city of Xalapa.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, residents from Colonia Cerro Colorado blocked the street Martires 28 de Agosto to protest against the lack of water service.
On 17 June 2024, in Jerez de Garcia Salinas, Zacatecas, armed individuals from an organized criminal group shot and killed a man in Alameda central. 1 fatality.

actors: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
notes: Around 17 June 2024 (as reported), in the rural area of Barbacoas municipality (Narino), two military soldiers were injured after stepping on a landmine planted by members of the Second Marquetalia FARC dissident group in the Guayabal vereda. One of the soldiers lost a foot due to the explosion. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2024, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), unidentified assailants shot and killed two men in the La Castellana informal settlement. There is no further information about the motives and perpetrators behind the attack, but the area is known for the presence of armed groups. 2 fatalities.

On 17 June 2024, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), more than 22,000 teachers from different regions of the country arrived in Bogota and marched from various locations in the city to Bolivar Square as part of the national teachers' strike called by the Colombian Federation of Education Workers (FECODE). Demonstrators rejected the statutory bill that seeks to regulate education as a fundamental right in Colombia, arguing that the bill was modified following agreements reached with opposition sectors, including provisions that would allow the use of public funds for the financing of private entities. According to the demonstrators, the bill would pave the way for the privatization of public education. Students and members of Indigenous communities also participated in the demonstrations. During the marches, several Transmilenio stations were vandalized, and a community mediator from the city's Security Department was injured with a knife under unclear circumstances. There were no fatalities.

actors: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
source: El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia); RCN Radio
notes: On 17 June 2024, in El Plateado (Cauca), suspected members of the Carlos Patino FARC dissident front clashed with military soldiers. Amid the clashes, members of the armed group launched several explosives (unspecified) from drones, intending to attack the military. The explosives fell in a residential area in the municipal seat, causing multiple damages to houses and commercial establishments, and injuring a civilian woman and a girl. It is still unclear if other armed groups were also involved in the attack. There were no fatalities.

On 17 June 2024, in La Guajira department (coded as Riohacha), for three consecutive days, local communities blocked kilometer 127 of Cerrejon's railway line and national road, motivated by underlying social issues and demands for improved public services, quality education, and resolution of territorial conflicts. Cerrejon stated that the blockades directly affect over 13,000 workers and their families, as well as about 164 communities that receive drinkable water from the company.

On 17 June 2024, in Arequipa (Arequipa), a group of locals and animal advocates from Yanahuara district gathered outside the workplace of a man who ran over a dog to demonstrate, demanding justice and sanctions against the individual for not having assisted the injured animal.

On 17 June 2024, in Asuncion (Asuncion), parents of students from the Ysaty National School demonstrated in front of the institution, demanding the reinstatement of four teachers removed from their positions at the request of the former director.

On 17 June 2024, around Berazategui (Buenos Aires), around 50 cyclists mobilized from La Plata to this locality to demand the protection of the recently discovered Crystal Tree that a construction company wants to cut down to carry out work in its place.

On 17 June 2024, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), members of various social and political organizations, including the FIT, protested in front of the Peace and Justice Service (SERPAJ) to demand the release of those detained in the previous weeks' mobilization against the 'Bases Law'.

Around 17 June 2024 (as reported), in Chupaca (Junin), a group of parents of students at a local school carried out a demonstration outside the local education management office demanding the dismissal of a teacher in the institution, accusing her of encouraging students to turn against their parents.

source: El Diario (Bolivia); La Patria en Linea
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), a group of pharmacy owners carried out a demonstration outside the Health Department, protesting against the deputy minister of consumer affairs, who blamed the sector for the increase in the price of medicines. Demonstrators were arguing the prices have increased due to increase in imports and suppliers charges.

source: Correo del Sur; El Deber; El Diario (Bolivia)
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), locals from Sacaba, Colcapirhua, and Quillacollo municipalities, as well as cargo drivers and merchants, supporters of President Luis Arce (affiliated with Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples: MAS-IPSP) carried out two demonstrations by marching through the main streets of the city voicing their support to the national government and repudiating blockades and demonstrations that other sectors have been carrying out regarding the lack of fuel and dollars.

On 17 June 2024, in Juliaca (Puno), an unidentified armed suspect shot and killed a social leader woman in the Circunvalacion Av., near the Hermosa del Misti complex.
