On 17 June 2024, protesters and residents gathered in Berkovitsa to demand that large and heavy load trucks not be allowed to pass through their area in Montana, citing traffic safety and damage to the roads.
On 17 June 2024, people demonstrated outside of the town hall in Esbjerg, Syddanmark, to show their dissatisfaction with the local authorities' handling of services for children with disabilities.
On 17 June 2024, three people protested in Heroes' Square, Budapest - XIV, District 14, against milk consumption and production.

On 17 June 2024, residents of Qastek village near the town Uzynagash in Zhambyl district of Almaty region gathered outside their homes in protest of planned operation of the gold mining project in the area, demanding that the authorities cancel the project due to public concerns regarding environmental pollution.

On 17 June 2024, people protested in front of the Romanian Embassy in Moldova, in Chisinau - Buiucani, against proposed changes to the Romanian citizenship process. Protesters opposed the requirement for a Romanian language exam and the extension of the document review period from five months to two years, arguing these changes would complicate or hinder obtaining citizenship.

On 17 June 2024, feminist activists protested against violence towards women in Podgorica, demanding death verdicts for individuals committing rape. The protesters also urged the authorities to create a register of sex offenders.
On 17 June 2024, seven men attacked and beat up an activist in Tbilisi who had participated in the protests against the Foreign Influence Law.
On 17 June 2024, farmers continued blocking a local highway near Dunkowiczki, protesting against the proposed construction of a new infrastructure over arable land.

On 17 June 2024, activists from the Emergency Break movement blocked a motorway exit in Herlev, Hovedstaden, calling for an end to motorway construction in the country due to environmental concerns. Police later removed the activists from the site after they failed to comply with police demands, five people were detained.

On 17 June 2024, around 100 environmental activists blocked a pulp factory in Skutskar, Uppsala, to raise awareness on what they perceived as the company's significant negative environmental impact, as well as its violations of indigenous peoples' rights both within Sweden and internationally.

On 17 June 2024, an unknown number of students, university staff and other activists set up a new pro-Palestinian encampment at the Science Park in Amsterdam (Noord-Holland) to express their solidarity with the Palestinian people and to demand the university be transparent about its relationship with Israel and to cut all ties with Israeli universities and companies.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of FILCAMS CGIL, FISASCAT CISL, and UILTUCS and as part of a national protest event, a small group of striking cemetery workers demonstrated outside the Commonwealth cemetery of Assisi (Umbria) to protest against the decision of the UK-based Commonwealth War body Graves Commission to fire two lawn care employees working at the cemetery.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of the Banana Grower Collective in Action (Collectif des Planteurs de Banane en Action), banana growers demonstrated in Basse-Terre (Bas-Terre) to protest against conformity controls and sanctions against farmers, which they deemed unfair and too harsh.
On 17 June 2024, striking bus drivers gathered for a picket line outside the bus depot in Beauvais (Hauts-de-France) to demand a pay rise.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of ELA, LAB, CCOO and National Police Union (Sindicato Abertzale de la Ertzaintza, ESAN), Independent Union of the Basque Police (Euskal Poliziaren sindikatu independentea, ERNE), around 200 municipal police officers protested in Bilbao (Pais Vasco) against planned municipal cuts to their vacations and release schedules.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of the Bihotzean association and the 'SOS Alde Zaharra' platform, several dozen residents protested in Bilbao (Pais Vasco) against mass tourism, claiming it pushed residents away.

Property destruction: On 17 June 2024, unknown people smashed several windows of the meeting place of the Grey Wolves in Bremen (Bremen) and wrote the slogan 'Never again fascism' on the building's wall.

On 17 June 2024, as the 27 EU heads of state meet in Brussels, an unknown number of Greenpeace activists staged a protest action by recreating da Vinci's 'Last Supper' painting in the Parc du Cinquantenaire in Brussels - Etterbeek (Brussels) to demand EU leaders to protect the rights and interests of youth and future generations, citing environmental concerns.

On 17 June 2024, hundreds of Sardinian farmers with their tractors and representatives of Coldiretti demonstrated against the hardships caused by drought and wildlife, especially wild boars, on the island. Demonstrators drove at a slow pace from Siniscola to Budoni (Sardegna), where they staged a picket and were joined by farmers arriving from Gallura.

On 17 June 2024, migrants hospitalized at the Naval Hospital of Cartagena held a protest in Cartagena (Murcia) to demand a meeting with the Secretary of State, Pilar Cancela, who was visiting the area.

On 17 June 2024, the teachers and students of the Official School of Languages as well as councilors of the Compromise Coalition protested in Castello de la Plana (Valencia) against cuts that the government wanted to implement in the school.

On 17 June 2024, pro-Palestine students from University College Cork held a protest outside the Gluckman Gallery on the university campus in Cork (Cork) to oppose a visit by Ireland's Minister for Foreign Affairs. Protesters demanded 'No government politicians on campus until the Occupied Territories Bill is enacted'. Police forces arrested two demonstrators.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of CGT, construction workers gathered outside the Territorial Collectivity (CT) offices in Fort-de-France (Fort-de-France) to demand swifter payment of their salaries and more state support for the construction sector.
On 17 June 2024, people protested in Granada (Andalucia) against the lack of staff at the Loja Hospital.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of Ver.di, around 1,000 people, including port workers, participated in a warning strike and a protest in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) to demand better wages. The protest was organized in the context of the third round of collective bargaining negotiations, in which Ver.di demanded a 3-euro-per-hour pay raise for employees.

On 17 June 2024, around 150 medical students participated in a protest in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) to call for better working conditions, standardized medical learning, and training concepts and higher wages in line with the maximum Bafog student loan rate of up to 930 euros during the practical year taking place between the second and third state exam in medical studies. The protest was part of a nationwide action week.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of 'Palestine Initiative Tirol' (Palestina Initiative Triol), people participated in a protest in front of the university in Innsbruck (Tirol) to call for an end to the university's cooperation with Israel.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of CGT, CFDT, and UNSA, more than 200 people demonstrated in Lamballe (Bretagne). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

actors: Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
notes: On 17 June 2024, activists from Palestine Action held a protest outside the Scotiabank building in the Bishopsgate area of London - City of London (England) against the bank's investments in Israel. Protesters spray-painted over the building and police forces arrested 10 participants.
On 17 June 2024, at the call of San Pedrena option (Opcion San Pedrena), more than 300 people protested in Marbella (Andalucia) against the municipal's import of sand to its beaches.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of UJFP - French Jewish Union for Peace (Union Juive Francaise pour la Paix), Palestine Emergency Marseille (Urgence Palestine Marseille), several hundred people, including national deputy Sebastien Delogu (LFI), demonstrated in Marseille (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to demand a ceasefire in Gaza, express solidarity with the Palestinian people, and condemn what they deemed a 'genocide' of Gazans by the Israeli army. Some protesters also condemned the National Rally (RN), which they deemed racist.

On 17 June 2024, about 30 people, including residents, demonstrated by gathering and collectively waving sponges during a meeting of the city council in Milano - Municipio 1 (Lombardia) to protest against tax amnesties granted to owners and builders of illegally-built or -restored buildings. Protesters also demanded that a defamation lawsuit against journalist Gianni Barbacetto be dropped. A city councilor and member of Green Europe took part in the protest.

On 17 June 2024, workers from a residence for people with disabilities protested at the doors of the center dependent on the Murcian Institute of Social Action in Murcia (Murcia) to denounce numerous attacks on staff and demand an increase in security measures.
On 17 June 2024, at the call of FCPE, students' parents peacefully blocked access to the local school in Oussoy-en-Gatinais (Centre-Val de Loire) to protest against the closure of classes.
On 17 June 2024, students' parents gathered outside the local school in Oust-Marest (Hauts-de-France) to protest against the dismissal of the school principal.

On 17 June 2024, over 300 people, including sympathizers of far-right groups, demonstrated in solidarity with Giuseppe Mazzola and Graziano Giralucci in Padova (Veneto), killed around 50 years ago by the Red Brigades at the then-local headquarters of the MSI - Italian Social Movement. Activists gave the fascist salute to honor the two victims of the killing.

On 17 June 2024, around 70 people, including municipal workers as well as LFI, Palestine Reims, and Libre Pensee (Free Thinking) affiliates, gathered outside the town hall in Reims (Grand Est) to protest against far-right ideology and racism, police violence, and defend the right to homeschooling.

On 17 June 2024, around 300 high school students staged a protest in Riesa (Sachsen) to draw attention to the shortage of teachers and the loss of lessons at their school, citing the negative consequences this would mean for their education and future.

On 17 June 2024, at the call of CGT, striking DS Smith employees gathered for a picket line outside the Sub-Prefecture in Rochechouart (Nouvelle-Aquitaine) to demand job security amid the reorganization of the company.
On 17 June 2024, around 20 striking municipal workers gathered for a picket line in Saint-Flour (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to demand better working conditions and a pay rise.

On 17 June 2024, a climate activist threw a Molotov cocktail and set fire to a truck in Saix (Occitanie) to demonstrate against the construction of the A69 highway between Toulouse and Castres, which climate activists deemed damaging to the environment. A construction worker was on board but managed to exit the vehicle before he got hurt. Later on, the police arrested the perpetrator.

actors: Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
notes: On 17 June 2024, activists from Palestine Action broke into the Instro Precision factory in Discovery Park in Sandwich (England) against the company's ties with Israel's Elbit Systems company. On 17 June 2024, at the call of CGT, 7 people, namely 3 doctors and their 4 secretaries, gathered for a picket line in Tulle (Occitanie) to protest against local authorities' reluctance to award them state subsidies for health workers.

On 17 June 2024, hundreds of Sardinian farmers with their tractors and representatives of Coldiretti demonstrated against the hardships caused by drought and wildlife, especially wild boars, on the island. Demonstrators drove at a slow pace from Tertenia to Villaputzu (Sardegna).
On 17 June 2024, 100 people protested in Villaquilambre (Castilla y Leon) against the arrival of 180 refugees from Mali and Senegal to the municipality.

On 17 June 2024, Stop Arming Israel affiliates gathered outside the Eurosatory armament conference in Villepinte (Ile-de-France) to demand an arms export ban on Israel, express solidarity with the Palestinian people, and condemn what they deemed a 'genocide' of Gazans by the Israeli army.

On 17 June 2024, around 100 people protested in Vitoria-Gasteiz (Pais Vasco) to demand increased safety for women after a new case of sexual assault was uncovered in the city.

On 17 June 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Korean Public Service and Transportation Workers' Union (KPTU) National Logistics Center Branch held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Coupang headquarters (Seoul City - Songpa). They urged the authorities not to install a resource recovery facility in Maewol-dong due to concerns over possible damages, including exhaust gas.

They urged the authorities to arrest a local cleaning company representative who allegedly formed a company-dominated union and oppressed the labor union members.

On 17 June 2024, about 300 local residents staged a protest in front of the Saemaeul Hall (Chuncheon) and opposed the Gangwon Saemaeul Organization's plan to install a funeral hall in Sinsawoo-dong without people's consent.

On 17 June 2024, DPK-affiliated lawmakers held a press conference with a banner at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to enact and revise three acts that can guarantee the birth basic income.

On 17 June 2024, protesters, including a DPK-affiliated lawmaker, held a press conference with a banner and picketed at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to enact a law that could guarantee the rights and working conditions of home laborers.

They opposed the government's decision to abolish large retailers' mandatory closures and strengthen the authorities to promote the right to rest and health for mart workers.

actors: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army

notes: On 17 June 2024, near Maung Mei Shaung village (Dawei township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), joint forces of the Yebyu People's Defense Force (YPPDF) and Dawei Guerrilla Revolution Force (DGRF) attacked with snipers against about 30 Myanmar military troops stationed at Hpa Yar Me security gate at around 9:30 pm. actors: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South

The motorcycle and a tractor were destroyed. Casualties unknown.

actors: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army

notes: On 17 June 2024, in Kyaukpyu township (Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), the Arakan Army (ULA/AA) intercepted over 100 Myanmar military troops at around 6 am as they advanced towards the Thit Poke Taung road located near the Danya Waddy navy base. The two sides then exchanged fire for around three hours. During the clash, the military stationed on Hnan Hpe Taung mountain and at the No.32 police station fired artillery rounds to assist the ground troops. Casualties unknown.

notes: Displacement: On 17 June 2024, in Kyunhla township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), thousands of villagers from Inn Taing, Kywe Te, In Hla, and Mya Hnit villages were forced to flee after the Myanmar military and Pyu Saw Htee raided and were stationed at Inn Taing village.

notes: On 17 June 2024, in Man Tauk village (Manton township, Pa Laung Self-Administered Zone, Shan-North state), a 34-year-old woman stepped on a landmine near an old camp of the Myanmar military (IB-130) at around 9:30 am while she was looking for mushrooms. She died on the spot.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Khonumthung News; Mizzima; Myanmar Now; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Radio Free Asia; VOA
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the Chin Brotherhood comprised of CDF-Mindat, CDF-Matupi Brigade-1, CDF-Kanpetlet, Maraland Defense Force (MDF), Zoland PDF, and Chin National Defense Force (CNDF), the Arakan Army (ULA/AA), and Yaw Army attacked and captured the Myanmar military LIB-304 headquarters as part of Operation Chin Brotherhood (Operation CB). During the fight, the military conducted airstrikes on the battlefield. The joint forces also claimed the capture of some military soldiers and seized some Howitzers rounds and weapons from the military. VOA reported that about 100 military soldiers died in the fighting. Shwe Phee Myay News Agency and Khonumthung News reported that three members of CDF - Matupi Brigade-1 died in the fighting.

actors: CNF/CNA: Chin National Front/Chin National Army
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the Chin National Army (CNF/CNA) attacked the Chin Brotherhood comprised of CDF-Mindat, CDF-Matupi Brigade-1, CDF-Kanpetlet, Maraland Defense Force (MDF), Zoland PDF, and Chin National Defense Force (CNDF) at around 5 am. CNA used 40 mm and 60 mm heavy weapons, drones, and small weapons following the capture of two CNF members by the Chin Brotherhood (CB). Two members of the Chin Brotherhood died in the fighting.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Narinjara News
notes: On 17 June 2024, in Har Bi (West) village (Maungdaw township, Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), the Myanmar military launched airstrikes and dropped bombs on the village using a fighter jet at around 7 am. On 17 June 2024, in Maungdaw town (Maungdaw township, Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), the Myanmar military arrested two men and two women from a family at a residence located behind the Myanmar Economic Bank for unknown reasons. The victims were then blindfolded and taken to the No.5 Border Guard Police battalion.

On 17 June 2024, in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), locals from Monywa and Ayadaw held a protest against the Myanmar military coup on the Monywa-Ayadaw road located in Monywa township and in honor of Aung San Suu Kyi's upcoming 79th birthday on 19 June.

One member of the local PDF died in the attack and the military troops captured another one. The military troops also siezed a type-81 firearm, an MK-12 rifle, a homemade shotgun, 27 rounds of bullets, two boxes of magazines, and a vehicle.

notes: Other: On 17 June 2024, at least 8 Philippine Navy officers were wounded after the Chinese Coast Guard intercepted a resupply mission conducted by the Philippine Navy at Ayungin Shoal (Kalayaan, Palawan, Mimaropa Region) in the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea). A Filipino soldier's thumb was dismembered when a Chinese rigid hull inflatable boat (RHIB) collided with their boat. The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) presented documentation of damaged RHIBs, communication devices, windshields, and navigational equipment. They said CCG intentionally rammed and illegally boarded AFP boats. CCG personnel also towed AFP's RHIB and looted firearms and personal belongings. They were seen deflating an AFP RHIB with knives and pikes and brandishing knives, axes, and sticks. The CCG used tear gas, sirens, and strobe lights. The AFP said that the Filipino soldiers were unarmed, and their service firearms were stored in cases to avoid any misconception that the resupply mission was an armed operation instead of a humanitarian mission. A scuffle reportedly occurred between Filipino and Chinese soldiers. The Philippines deemed the incident a violation of international laws and Philippine sovereignty. Meanwhile, China asserted that the Philippine vessels trespassed and described their actions as 'lawful'.

On 16 June 2024, rioters injured several people and ransacked the home of the sub-prefect of Kagbolodougou (Sinematiali, Poro, Savanes). The rioters were partaking in the Poro initiation ceremony (the Poro is a men's secret society abiding by strict rules). A disagreement with local teachers arose as the teachers refused to look away from the Poro mask. A scuffle ensued during which two teachers and a gendarme were injured and the Poro participants then ransacked the sub-prefect's house using bludgeons and rocks. The sub-prefect was targeted because the rioters said he shouldn't have allowed the teachers to lodge a complaint with the gendarmerie.

actors: Military Forces of the United States (2021-)
notes: On 16 June 2024, at an unspecified time, Houthi forces claimed a ballistic missile attack targeting a US Navy destroyer (name undisclosed) in the South Red Sea. There were no fatalities or injuries as the missiles likely impacted the water. The attack was not confirmed by other sources.

source: SynMax Maritime; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Houthi
notes: Around 16 June 2024 (between 14 - 18 June), Houthi forces planted and detonated several bombs on the stern of the Tutor bulk carrier (IMO: 9942627) after boarding the uncrewed ship in the South Red Sea around 69 nm west of Al Hudaydah. Houthi forces had previously targeted the Tutor on 12 June with a drone boat, resulting in significant damage, claiming affiliation with companies in violation of the Houthi ban to call at Israeli ports (coded as a separate event). The exact date of the Houthi booby-trapping is unclear, although the ship was abandoned by its crew on 14 June and sank overnight from 17 to 18 June.

source: Ansar Allah; MSCHOA; The Washington Institute; UKMTO; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Houthi
notes: On 16 June 2024, at around 4:30 am Sanaa time, Houthi forces fired at least 2 anti-ship missiles likely targeting the Captain Paris crude oil tanker (IMO: 9692844) in the Strait of Bab el Mandeb around 40 nm south of Al Mukha claiming affiliation with companies in violation of the Houthi ban to call at Israeli ports. There were no fatalities or injuries as the missiles exploded in close proximity around 50 - 100 m of the ship. The Captain Paris entered the Red Sea through the Suez Canal on 11 June and arrived at the port of Fujayrah in the UAE on 21 June.

source: Ansar Allah; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Houthi; Yemeni Army - Houthi
notes: On 16 June 2024, Houthi forces claimed a drone attack targeting the Happy Condor LPG tanker (IMO: 9368780) in the Arabian Sea (coded to West Arabian Sea) claiming affiliation with companies in violation of the Houthi ban to call at Israeli ports. There were no fatalities or injuries as the drones likely impacted the water. The attack was not confirmed by other sources. The ship was sailing from France to Qatar through the Cap of Good Hope to avoid the Red Sea. It passed the Cape of Good Hope on 2 June and reached the Strait of Hormuz on 20 June.

On 16 June 2024, a mob fight erupted between residents of Kendew and Lassia in Tuolu coded to Bulu (Wa West, Upper West). Three people were killed in the clash. The fatalities resulted from an exchange of gunfire between the two groups from the two communities over ritual practices.

On 16 June 2024, suspected ADF attacked the village of Sesa, on National Road number 4, between Komanda and Luna (Walese Vonkutu, Irumu, Ituri). 1 FARDC soldier (assumed unarmed) was killed and a woman injured.

On 16 June 2024, young demonstrators barricaded roads, blocking the passage of a MONUSCO convoy in Malende, 7km west of the city of Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). They demonstrated against the MONUSCO presence in the DRC.

On 16 June 2024, Ambazonian Separatists from ADF attacked and killed a former Separatist in Nchoubouh neighborhood in Bamenda - Mankon (Bamenda 2, Mezam, Nord-Ouest) who had recently joined the DDR center. The Separatists accused him of treachery.
On 16 June 2024, a grenade left by an unidentified armed group exploded when 2 children picked it up in Kerawa (Kolofata, Mayo-Sava, Extreme-Nord). 1 child died and another was injured.

Looting: Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), Wagner mercenaries looted cigarettes, tins of sardines, vegetables, tomatoes, and other items from the shop in Boda (Lobaye, Boda, Lobaye).

On 16 June 2024, an unidentified armed group abducted a Catholic priest at Ndiokpaleke (Orumba South, Anambra) as he was returning from a church were he attended morning mass. The priest was abducted alongside two persons who were able to escape, other sources report that one other person was abducted with the priest. There are no reports on ransom demands.

On 16 June 2024, a Katsina militia clashed with police forces who responded to a distress call at Kwata area of Jibia LGA (Katsina). Casualties are unknown, four abductees consisting of three women and a baby were rescued.

source: EONS Intelligence; Nigeria Punch; Sahara Reporters
notes: On 16 June 2024, Nigerian army troops on patrol killed a Kaduna militia commander's associate at Kidandan (Giwa, Kaduna). The militia member was trailed by the troops into a community.

On 16 June 2024, soldiers from Dan-Marke military camp attacked an off-duty policeman and his son at their residence in Maga village. The son was stabbed and wounded over his relationship with a woman whom a soldier was interested in and had warned him of. Kiosks and shops in the area were looted by the soldiers. Location coded to Marke (Tsafe, Zamfara) where the soldiers came from.

source: Blueprint; Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); New Telegraph
notes: On 16 June 2024, a Sokoto militia in large numbers attacked civilians at Tudun Doki (Gwadabawa, Sokoto) and killed 5 to 10 persons. Two others were abducted, other sources claim that scores were abducted.

The forest reserve serves as the operation base, source of finance, and convergence point for collaboration between homegrown and foreign groups.

On 16 June 2024, a mob beat up the chairman of Katch LGA at his residence in Saku village, coded to Katcha (Katcha, Niger) till he was unconscious. The mob beat him up after he assaulted the son of his creditor who attempted to collect a debt, the assaulted person invited his friends who beat up the chairman.

On 16 June 2024, residents of Ekosin took to the streets, burning tires in Ekosin (Odo-Otin, Osun) to denounce the appointment of a traditional ruler for the town by the state government. The demonstrators claimed that the appointment was an imposition.
On 16 June 2024, ISWAP militants clashed with Niger military in Chetima Wangou (Diffa, Diffa). A subsequent led to the arrest of 2 militants and their vehicule seized. Unknown casualties.
On 16 June 2024, the Malian air force carried out a drone strike against a civilian vehicle in the village of Tidjalalenee (Gao, Gao). There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 16 June 2024, FPL militants destroyed the Niger - Benin grude pipeline west of Tesker (Tesker, Zinder). In a statement, its leader Mahmoud Sallah claimed responsibility of the attack and asked the Chinese oil company WAPCO to cancel the $400 million loan granted to the junta, otherwise, all oil installations will be paralyzed.

On 16 June 2024, a group of NRM youth protested in the city of Gulu (Gulu, Gulu), against corrupt leaders.
On 16 June 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Mesno (Hagere Mariam, North Shewa, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

On 16 June 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Mehal Meda (Mehale Meda town, North Shewa, Amhara), killing an unknown number of ENDF soldiers (fatalities unconfirmed). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 16 June 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Wedajna Yamsa (near Gishen, Ambasel, South Wello, Amhara). The ENDF started moving from Mehal Meda towards Gishen direction and was ambushed by Fano before arriving in Gishen and forced to retreat. Casualties unknown.

Other: Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), ENDF (Northeastern Command) seized 120 uniforms printed with state police, riot police, and private companies' logos, bank account books, and 25,500 Ethiopian birr at a checkpoint in Hayk in Thehulederie Woreda (South Wello, Amhara). The materials were being transported from Shewa Robit to Lalibela. Two individuals were arrested.

source: BBC News; Borkena Ethiopian News; VOA; Wazema Radio
notes: On 16 June 2024, Fano forces ambushed ENDF patrol vehicles traveling from Dembecha to Jiga at Tikur Wuha in Jiga town (Jabi Tehnan, Western Gojam, Amhara), killing an unknown number of officers. The two forces exchanged gunfire that lasted for more than 20 minutes. Security forces attacked civilians in the town after Fano forces retreated and the fighting ended (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 16 June 2024, ENDF attacked civilians near the Goha Hotel, Dembecha neighborhood, in Jiga town (Jabi Tehnan, Western Gojam, Amhara). Conflicting reports mentioned fatalities ranging from 13 - 20 civilians, and 2 others were injured. The killing happened following a clash between Fano and ENDF forces (coded separately). Teachers and bankers were among the victims.

On 16 June 2024, unidentified armed group exchanged gunfire with Kebele militia at an unspecified location between Gende Wuha and Negade Bahir in Metema Woreda (location coded to Metema, West Gondar, Amhara). The gunmen attacked a public transport bus carrying passengers from Gende Wuha to Negade Bahir and attempted to abduct the passengers, triggering intervention from Kebele militia. 3 civilians including 1 female Sudanese refugee were killed.

Casualties unknown. 3 militants were captured. 3 Kalashnikov, 8 Kalashnikov safe boxes, 2 knives, and 200 Kalashnikov bullets were seized.

Casualties unknown. 4 Militants and 2 trainees were captured. 1 Kalashnikov along with 15 bullets, and various medicines were seized.

source: BBC News; Borkena Ethiopian News; VOA; Wazema Radio
notes: On 16 June 2024, ethnic Oromo residents (likely Oromo ethnic militia due to the nature of the incident) attacked ethnic Amharas in Biftu Jalela kebele in Nono Woreda (West Shewa, Oromia), following attacks on wedding attendants in the same kebele (coded separately). Casualties unknown. At least 20 ethnic Amhara houses were burned down. An unspecified number of ethnic Amhara residents fled the area.

source: Citizen (Kenya); Kenya Broadcasting Corporation; Kenya Standard; Kenyans.co; KTN News (Kenya)
notes: On 16 June 2024, residents of Banissa constituency protested in an unspecified location (coded to the nearest known location as Banissa, Banissa, Mandera) against their lack of representation in parliament, following the death of their member of parliament. Led by Banissa ward member of county assembly (UDM, Kenya Kwanza), the group demanded the government to set-up the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) to organize for the election of a new representative.

Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), judges, magistrates and judiciary staff members, gathered at the doorstep of the Nairobi's Milimani courts (Starehe, Nairobi) against poor working conditions, following the recent killing of their colleague (coded separately). The group demanded for a better working environment.
Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), residents protested in Ole Serini near Gilgil (Gilgil, Nakuru) against the poor state of the roads. The group demanded the county government to fix the roads.

On 16 June 2024, members of KNUT from West Pokot county gathered and sang solidarity songs in Kapenguria (West Pokot, West Pokot) against the shortage of teachers in the county. The group demanded the Teachers' Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter.
On 16 June 2024, a dahalo group attacked a house in Ambalalehibe (Ambositra, Amoron I Mania). They killed a 13-year-old boy and left stealing eight zebus and valuable objects.

actors: ATMIS: African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (2022-) (Uganda)
notes: Movement of forces: On 16 June 2024, ATMIS UPDF troops handed over the Forward Operation Base (FOB) in Southwest state to the government security forces in Bariirre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The event marks the start of the third phase of the ATMIS withdrawal of its over 2,000 soldiers to leave Somalia by the end of June.

Movement of forces: On 16 June 2024, SNA troops are deployed in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The deployment comes amid an increase in Al Shabaab members activity in Balcad district (coded separately).

On 16 June 2024, the youth wing of MACUA staged a protest by cycling to the head offices of various mining companies in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng), demanding that mining companies adopt more ethical, inclusive, and environmentally responsible practices that directly benefit and involve the communities affected by their operations. The protesters on bikes cycled to the head offices of various mining companies, including Anglo American, De Beers, Seriti, South32, and Glencore.

On 16 June 2024, police, military, and members of the Department of Home Affairs Immigration Services arrested 72 undocumented foreign migrants suspected of illegally mining in Kimberley (Frances Baard, Northern Cape). The 72 individuals arrested came from countries including Lesotho, Zimbabwe, and Nigeria.

On 16 June 2024, for the second day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county including in Pulturuk and Chuil payams (location coded to Pulturuk, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Three children aged five to seven were abducted. Fatalities split over the five days, coded as 2.

Other: On 16 June 2024, heavily armed police officers in riot gear stormed/besieged Masala Catholic Church in Ndola (Ndola, Copperbelt). They were preventing former president Edgar Lungu from attending the mass and claimed they were searching for opposition leaders. Some parishioners were searched.

On 16 June 2024, police responded to an unsanctioned gathering at the house of the CCC interim leader in Harare (Harare Urban, Harare). Police used tear gas and fired gunshots to disperse the crowd. CCC members threw stones at police officers and a damaged police vehicle. Police ordered the members to jump into a swimming pool, resulting in many being detained in drenched clothes. More than 20 members were injured and two officers were injured (extent of injuries unknown/not reported). 79 members were arrested.

On 16 June 2024, authorities (coded as SAF) arrested an unspecified number of Native Administration members, including the Mayor of Al Engriab and about 10 youths, in Al Bawga (Barbar, River Nile), after they accused an NCP member, who is also the Head of community committees, of corruption after he received mining companies social responsibility funds.
On 16 June 2024, RSF killed dozens of civilians based on their ethnicity (likely non-Arab groups) in Nyala (Nyala Janoub, South Darfur). No further information. Fatalities coded as 12.

Other: On 16 June 2024, Iranian Guidance Patrol police forces (morality police) detained a womanon charges of 'not observing the religious hijab' in Tehran city (Tehran) after using 'violence' on her. The Guidance Patrol enforces the Sharia (Islamic law) in Iran, often in the form of implementing the Islamic dress, such as ensuring women wear hijabs under the chastity and hijab program known as 'Noor.' After the Mahsa Amini protest movement, the 'hijab' became a sociopolitical matter, and the religious leaders whom the government and the police support tried to prevent anti-veil activities by Iranian women daily.

It is known that they had fled Delmas 9 due to the Viv Ansamn Gang violence. 4 fatalities.

During the chase, the victims' vehicle crashed, forcing them to leave the car. A third occupant was noticed by the police. He was said to have died in hospital. Relatives claimed that the victims were killed in cold blood and that they disobeyed the police halt because they did not have a driving license. The shooting is not ruled out to be a case of abuse of force by the police. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

notes: On 16 June 2024, RR, CRPF and SoG exchanged fire with an LeT/TRF militant during an operation at Aragam town (Bandipora district, J&K). One local militant was killed in the encounter.

Weapons seizure: On 16 June 2024, police forces and Assam Rifles personnel retrieved arms and ammunition belonging to unidentified armed assailants (likely Kuki based on geography) after a search operation along Gampijang ridges (likely Kuki based on geography) in Kangpokpi district (Kangpokpi, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Recovered items included one AK-56 rifle with a magazine, one 303 rifle, two Chinese hand grenades, one country-made hand grenade, two improvised projectile launchers, one 12-inch SBBL gun, 10 live rounds of ammunition and one Baofeng radio set.

On 16 June 2024, BJP members led by a legislator held a sit-in protest at Kulti city (Paschim Bardhaman district, WB) over claimed stoppage of water supply by TMC controlled municipal authorities to the area after the Lok Sabha elections to BJP held areas.

On 16 June 2024, job card holders held a protest at Kahara town (Doda district, J&K) against the Rural Development Department over delay in release of pending wages for MGNREGA work (a rural employment scheme).

Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), locals, students and Meira Paibi activists (women torch bearers) staged a protest rally with placards under the banner 'Stop Desertification of Green Fields' from Nongpok Sekmai NESA ground to Ukhongsang Kangjeibung Lampak in Nongpok Sekmai village (Thoubal, Manipur) condemning the negative effects of quarrying activities on the environment and raised awareness for its protection.

On 16 June 2024, Democratic Students' Alliance of Manipur (DESAM) staged a protest and burned the effigies of Education Minister, Education Director and Education Commissioner in front of Oriental College at Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) condemning the state government for not adhering to NEP 2020 guidelines in the recruitment of 1,140 pre-primary teachers and demanded the release of those arrested during a similar DESAM protest on June 13 (coded separately).

On 16 June 2024, military forces conducted an IBO and killed five militants (coded as TTP) in Khyber district (coded as Landi Kotal (Khyber, KPK)). Weapons, ammunitions, and explosives were also recovered. 5 fatalities.

On 16 June 2024, Democratic Students' Alliance of Manipur (DESAM) staged a protest and burned the effigies of Education Minister, Education Director and Education Commissioner at Pangei Bazar (market) in Pangei village (Imphal East, Manipur) condemning the state government for not adhering to NEP 2020 guidelines in the recruitment of 1,140 pre-primary teachers and demanded the release of those arrested during a similar DESAM protest on June 13 (coded separately).

On 16 June 2024, candidates of All Manipur State Power Development Company Limited (MSPDCL) and Manipur State Power Company Limited (MSPCL) examination staged a protest rally in different parts of the city and culminated in front of the Chief Minister's residence in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) condemning the delay in the announcement of exam results. Protesters were stopped at Nupi Lan Complex and a few of them were allowed to submit their memorandum to the CM's secretary.

On 16 June 2024, residents held a protest at Chingus town (Rajouri district, J&K) against illegal mining in the area claiming it was causing damage to local infrastructure and essential water resources.

On 16 June 2024, military force personnel and TTP militants exchanged cross border fire across the Afghanistan-Pakistan border in Kurram district (coded as Parachinar (Kurram, KPK)). 1 TTP militant was killed and at least six military personnel were wounded in the fire exchange. 1 fatality and 6 injured.

On 16 June 2024, militants (coded as TTP) on motorcycle opened fire at a deputy police superintendent in Dera Ismail Khan city (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK). The police personnel returned fire and the assailants fled the scene. There were no casualties.

On 16 June 2024, military forces were suspected to have conducted house-to-house searches and raids in Sahaki and Garnawah areas of Balgatar locality (Kech, Balochistan) and were claimed to have violently attacked residents (likely Balochi based on the location). There were no casualties.

On 16 June 2024, militants (coded as TTP) shot dead a police sub-inspector (off-duty) in Gulbahar area of Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK) after the personnel had finished his duty. The assailants and the police personnel engaged in a physical fight before he was shot due to suspected marks on the body. 1 fatality.

On 16 June 2024, a clash took place between two groups of Jatt and Solangi community, both groups attacked each other with sticks and metal rods, injuring 3 members of the Solangi community in Mujahid Colony in Tando Allahyar city (Tando Allah Yar, Sindh), over a property dispute.

On 16 June 2024, a clash took place between two groups of the Meghwar community, injuring several people in Harijan Colony near Kunri town (Umerkot, Sindh), over a land dispute. At least several people were injured.

Other: On 16 June 2024, TTP announced a temporary three-day ceasefire with the Government of Pakistan (coded as Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) on the occasion of the Eid al-Adha holiday. TTP said it would defend itself if acted by security forces. This is the second time TTP has announced a ceasefire after 2021, which ended in November 2022.

On 16 June 2024, residents staged protest outside the Frontier Corps camp in Buleda area (Kech, Balochistan) against the forced disappearance of two Baloch persons by military personnel (coded separately).
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Badin city (Badin, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Dadu city (Dadu, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Ghotki city (Ghotki, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Mirpur Mathelo town (Ghotki, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Jacobabad city (Jacobabad, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Karachi - Saddar town (Karachi City, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Kashmor city (Kashmore, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Hingorja town (Khairpur, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Matiari city (Matiari, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Odero Lal town (Matiari, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Jhuddo town (Mirpur Khas, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Mirpur Khas city (Mirpur Khas, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Naushahro Feroze city (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Khadro town (Sanghar, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Nawabshah town (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Shikarpur city (Shikarpur, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Tando Allahyar city (Tando Allah Yar, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Tharpakar city (Tharparkar, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Thatta city (Thatta, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.
On 16 June 2024, traders, residents and civil society members took out a protest rally in Umerkot city (Umerkot, Sindh), against prolonged electricity load shedding.

On 16 June 2024, members of the Solangi community staged a protest in Tando Allahyar city (Tando Allah Yar, Sindh), after 3 members got injured over a property dispute during a clash with the Jatt community (coded separately).

On 16 June 2024, a large number of civil society activists and political parties members, including women, staged protest outside Kharan Press Club in Kharan town (Kharan, Balochistan) demanding the arrest of criminal assailants behind the killing of a local resident.

On 16 June 2024, hundreds of residents on call of the Maidan Aman Committee staged protest in Kumbar Maidan area (Lower Dir, KPK) against the growing number of militant attacks and demanded the arrest of assailants behind the killing of the local cleric in the area on 30 May 2024 (coded separately).

On 16 June 2024, militants (coded as TTP) detonated a remote explosive near a security force vehicle (coded as police) in Khushkali village (North Waziristan, KPK) and injured two persons. 2 injured and no fatalities.

On 16 June 2024, activists of PTI held a demonstration outside Adiala Jail in Rawalpindi city (Rawalpindi, Punjab), demanding release of their leader. The demonstrators resisted police, damaged their uniform. 6 demonstrators were arrested.

On 16 June 2024, a PTI MPA and large number of residents from various villages pitched up tents and staged an encampment demonstration outside Rehman Baba grid station and blocked the Ring Road in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KPK). Demonstrators forcibly entered the grid station and shut down twenty-two feeders, halting electric supply in the area.

On 16 June 2024, residents wielding sticks on call of the Swabi Action Committee staged a demonstration and clashed with police personnel and company workers at the Peshawar Electric Company in Manari Bala village within Swabi city (Swabi, KPK) after company employees attempted to remove power meters from the area. Police are suspected to have violently grabbed demonstrators who in turn clashed with police personnel when they were forcibly removed.
On 16 June 2024, a policeman was suspected of assaulting a man (manager at Gawar Company) at the Shesh Netra Lake area in Badrinath town (Chamoli, Uttarakhand) after a dispute arose over parking.

Property destruction: On 16 June 2024, an unidentified group set fire to Bhrikuti School in Laljhadi rural municipality-4 (Kanchanpur district), causing damages to classrooms and property. The reason behind the vandalism has not been reported, while police are further investigating the incident.

On 16 June 2024, five members of a family attacked three members of another family with sharp weapons in Bhutadihi village (Nayagarh district, Odisha) after an argument turned an old dispute over land into a group clash. A 42-year-old man was killed and two others were injured.

On 16 June 2024, a former BSP district president accompanied by his sons and 10-12 associates assaulted members of a family, including women, and behaved 'indecently' at Rawatyana Govindnagar locality in Lalitpur city (Uttar Pradesh) over a dispute stemming from an old rivalry. A video of the incident was circulated online.

On 16 June 2024, four to five members of the TDP and the JSP pelted stones at a former YSRCP minister's residence on Feeryghat road in Ibrahimpatnam town (NTR, Andhra Pradesh) for unknown reasons. The assailants arrived in a car, pelted stones and fled.

On 16 June 2024, members of ABVP, led by its state joint secretary, staged a protest in Lohaghat town (Champawat, Uttarakhand) condemning the attack on a bus carrying Hindu pilgrims in the Rajouri district (Jammu and Kashmir) on 9 June and demanded the central government to take concrete steps to prevent such incidents.

On 16 June 2024, the IT Army, affiliated with the AJP, protested by picketing the Foreign Employment Department in the Tahachal locality of Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters made several demands, including justice for foreign employment victims and the return of money illegally taken from foreign workers.

On 16 June 2024, business owners (scrap dealers), led by AJP, staged a protest in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were expressing their discontent with the metropolis' actions towards business owners (scrap dealers), accusing the authorities of oppressing them by dismantling their scrap collection center.

On 16 June 2024, students, led by the chief secretary of the ANNISU-R, protested by burning an effigy and the chair of the registrar at Nepal Sanskrit University Central Ayurveda Vidyapeeth in the Bijauri area (Dang district). The protesters opposed financial irregularities and political corruption and demanded extending contract teachers' terms and arranging intern allowances for scholarship students.

On 16 June 2024, family members of the deceased and members of the Bhim Army staged a protest along the Akbarpur-Baskhari Road in Baskhari town (Ambedkar Nagar, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of a woman and her newborn which the protesters claimed was caused by the negligence of an illegally operating private hospital.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP, including its state president, staged protests at 14 locations across New Delhi (coded as Delhi - New Delhi city (Delhi)) against the AAP-led state government whom the protesters accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by the BJP state media chief, staged a protest in the Delhi - Chandni Chowk area (Central Delhi, Delhi) against the AAP-led state government whom the protesters accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by an MP, staged a protest in the Najafgarh area (South West Delhi, Delhi) against the AAP-led state government whom the protesters accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by an MP, staged a protest in the Delhi-Jahangirpuri area (North Delhi, Delhi) against the AAP-led state government whom the protesters accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP, led by an MP, staged a protest in the Delhi - Rama Krishna Puram area (New Delhi, Delhi) against the AAP-led state government whom the protesters accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJYM and the BJP including an MLC staged a protest at the Azad Park Circle in Chikkamagaluru city (Chikmagalur, Karnataka) against the INC-led state government's decision to increase the fuel prices in the state. The protesters held coconut shells, tucked flowers behind their ears and shouted slogans to mark their protest.

On 16 June 2024, members of the Kannada Sena Pade (Kannada group) staged a protest at a petrol bunk in front of the Regional Transport Office in Mysuru city (Karnataka) against the INC-led state government's decision to increase the fuel prices in the state. The protesters raised slogans to mark their protest.
On 16 June 2024, farmers staged a protest at the power station in Chendola Sujanpur village (Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh) against the power outages in the area.

On 16 June 2024, locals and farmers staged a protest in PMK Thanda village (Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh) after a wild elephant attacked and killed a farmer. The protesters demanded the government to take measures to stop wild animal attacks.

On 16 June 2024, members of the congregation of the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese of the Syro-Malabar Church staged a protest in front of the St. George Church in the Edapally locality in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) against the Church's new set of guidelines which directed priests to face the congregation during the introduction and conclusion of the mass. The protesters raised slogans to mark their protest.
On 16 June 2024, farmers staged a protest rally in Simraungadh municipality (Bara district) against the tax imposed on agricultural commodities.
On 16 June 2024, local people, joined by an INC MLA, staged a dharna (sit-in protest) in Rewari city (Haryana) against the slow progress in the construction of an underpass and a railway overbridge.

On 16 June 2024, members of the AIMIM including an MLC and a Corporator staged a protest in the Old City area in Hyderabad city (Telangana) after police detained two persons who were illegally transporting cattle after they were notified by cow vigilantes. The protesters said that the trucks were transporting bulls and not cows and demanded the two persons who had been detained.
On 16 June 2024, local people, including traders, in Sansarpur village (Kheri, Uttar Pradesh) against the power outages in the area.

On 16 June 2024, students including members of the Dalit Minority Students Union staged a protest at the Osmania University arts college in Hyderabad city (Telangana) against the lack of transparency on the INC-led state government's part in providing details about the Group 1 examination of the Telangana State Public Service Commission that was conducted recently. The protesters demanded the authorities to provide the number of candidates who appeared for the exam.

On 16 June 2024, members of farm workers' and farmers' unions, including Bhartiya Kisan Mazdoor Union, staged a protest along the Ludhiana-Jalandhar Highway at the toll plaza next to Ladhowal village (Ludhiana, Punjab) against the high toll fees.

On 16 June 2024, employees led by the Federal Parliament Secretariat Employees' Union staged a sit-in protest at the Secretary General's office in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters made various demands, including salary and allowance increases, as well as other service benefits.

On 16 June 2024, crusher businesspersons and members of the Federation of Nepal Crushers and Mining Industry Professionals staged a protest at Kalanki locality in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters demanded the renewal of crusher industry licenses, which have lapsed for the past 10 years, causing significant business and employment issues.
On 16 June 2024, unemployed graduates from Kandy, Nuwara Eliya and Badulla districts held a protest rally in Hatton town (Hatton, Central), demanding government jobs.

On 16 June 2024, members of the LGBTQIA+ community took out a protest march on Race Course Road in Coimbatore city (Tamil Nadu) to commemorate Pride Month and to demand LGBTQIA+ inclusive curriculum in educational institutes, protection through anti-discrimination laws and marriage and adoption rights for members of the community.

On 16 June 2024, many farmers, led by the KMS block president, staged a protest, raising slogans, in Pipalia Vijay Nagar village (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh) against the police whom the protesters accused of failing to take action against illegal soil mining in the area.

On 16 June 2024, seven protesters associated with the Chure (hill range) and Forest Conservation Campaign protested by raising slogans against the Prime Minister in Mirchaiya municipality (Siraha district) during a tree plantation event on the occasion of Chure Preservation Day. The protesters were demanding attention to issues of Chure (hill range) and river exploitation in the Madhesh region.

On 16 June 2024, hundreds of local people staged a protest, carrying placards, in Kharatiya Tola village (Sonbhadra, Uttar Pradesh) against the drinking water shortage in the area and demanded the implementation of the Pradhan Mantri Har Ghar Nal Yojana (prime minister's 'a tap in every house' program).

On 16 June 2024, family members of the deceased staged a protest under the Srinagar police station area (Mahoba, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of a young girl which the protesters claimed was caused by a wrong treatment provided by a private clinic.

On 16 June 2024, dozens of women and family members of the deceased staged a protest along the road in Bhagatar village (Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh) against the police for failing to find the body of a man who is assumed to have drowned in a canal.

On 16 June 2024, local people, including family members of the deceased staged protests at many places, including at Bighad Chowk (intersection), in Fatehabad city (Haryana) demanding action against the accused who shot and killed a man in a murder case.
On 16 June 2024, dozens of local people staged a protest, raising slogans, at the Badripur area in Paonta Sahib town (Sirmaur, Himachal Pradesh) against the lack of power supply in the area.

On 16 June 2024, local people staged a protest at the water tank in Sandey Kala village (Sant Kabir Nagar, Uttar Pradesh) against the lack of adequate supply of drinking water despite the construction of a water tank.
On 16 June 2024, members of the Bundelkhand Vikas Sena (a local group) staged a protest, raising slogans, in Lalitpur city (Uttar Pradesh) against power outages in the area.
On 16 June 2024, local people staged a protest at the Umrar Khera area in Orai city (Jalaun, Uttar Pradesh) against the decision to install a transformer in the area.

On 16 June 2024, parents and relatives of a boy who died after he accidentally held an electric wire at a residential school while he was playing staged a protest at the Morarji Residential School in Kuppalu village (Chikmagalur, Karnataka) accusing the authorities of negligence.

On 16 June 2024, villagers and relatives of an employee of NCL AllTek and Seccolor Limited who died by suicide by touching an electricity line when the security denied him entry into the factory for reporting late to duty staged a protest on the factory premises in Turkal Khanapur village (Sangareddy, Telangana) demanding action against the security guards and justice for the victim's kin.

On 16 June 2024, members of the BJP staged a demonstration and broke the glasses of the Delhi Jal (Water) Board office in the Delhi - Chhattarpur area (South Delhi, Delhi) condemning the AAP-led state government whom the demonstrators accused of failing to address the water crisis in the city.

On 16 June 2024, priests and members of the congregation of the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese of the Syro-Malabar Church staged demonstrations in various parishes in Ernakulam district (coded to Kochi city, Ernakulam district, Kerala) against the Church's new set of guidelines which directed priests to face the congregation during the introduction and conclusion of the mass. The demonstrators damaged and set fire to copies of the circular directing priests to follow the Synod-approved uniform.

Around 16 June 2024 (as reported), villagers detained the employees of the electricity department in Senteri village under Nuagaon block (Nayagarh district, Odisha) during a demonstration over the lack of supply of electricity for the past 3-4 days.

On 16 June 2024, family members of the deceased broke the glass panes of a hospital and staged a demonstration, raising slogans, and placed the deceased's body along Pushta Road at the New Usmanpur locality in Delhi - Shahdara area (North East Delhi, Delhi) demanding action against the accused involved in the shooting and killing a young man.

source: Afghan Islamic Press News Agency; Hasht-e Subh
notes: Explosive remnants of war: On 16 June 2024, 4 children including a 12 year girl and three boys were killed when a rocket round, remnants of the war, exploded while they were playing with it in the Dahan-e Darah village of Pashtun Kot district, Faryab.
On 16 June 2024, 8 barbers were arrested by the Taliban for shaving the hair and beards of their clients in Herat City. Their whereabouts remained unknown.

actors: Police Forces of Afghanistan (2021-) General Directorate of Intelligence
notes: On 16 June 2024, a former member of border police and current watchmen at Gurbuz district market was severely beaten then imprisoned by Taliban Intelligence forces at the Intelligence headquarters in Gurbuz district [coded to Sekhamir Kalay], Khost, for not preventing the public celebratory gunfire at Eid.

Around 16 June 2024, a senior TTP commander was killed by unknown gunmen in the Chugharsarai area of Asad Abad city, Kunar. His body was buried on 18 June in Dangam district, Kunar. He was a former member of the TTP Malakand Council and was the right-hand man of the council's head.

On 16 June 2024, around 700 citizens engaged in a 'march for life' in Split, protesting against legalizing abortion. A group of activists counter-protested, conveying that women have the right to do whatever they want with their bodies.

On 16 June 2024, workers of the Zhalgyztobemunay company gathered on the premises near the town of Fort-Shevchenko in Tupkaragan district of Mangystau region in protest of persecution of labor activists and illegal layoffs, demanding the dismissal of the company's General Director. Workers warned of another upcoming protest if their demands would not be met.

Security measures: On 16 June 2024, police refused to give permission to the World Confederation of Panmacedonian Associations to stage a protest rally in Athens outside the venue, where the 'Alexis Tsipras Institute' and the 'Zoran Zaev Foundation' were co-hosting an event the following day on the occasion of the 6th anniversary since the signing of the Prespes Agreement. Police also banned any other open air gathering during the event, citing public safety and disruption of the socioeconomic life of the area as reasons for the ban.

source: Jurnal; Moldpres; Newsmaker.md; Nokta.md; TV8; Unimedia; Ziarul de Garda
notes: On 16 June 2024, around 1,000 people participated in an LGBTQ+ march from the intersection of Ismail and Bucuresti streets to the Dinamo Stadium in Chisinau - Buiucani. The participants advocated for equal civil rights for all citizens of Moldova, emphasized the need for legal recognition of same-sex marriages, and the protection of rights for LGBTIQ+ individuals, highlighting issues such as inheritance, medical decision-making, and joint mortgages. The march was also attended by two members of parliament, representatives from the US Embassy, the Netherlands Embassy, the EU Delegation in Chisinau, the Great Britain Embassy, the Spain Embassy, the Sweden Embassy, as well as the UN, the Council of Europe, and the World Health Organization. Several counter-protests took place during the march, including several individuals affiliated with the 'Victory' bloc (banned SOR party and Revival party) dressed in white, 'disinfecting' the street.

On 16 June 2024, around 100 Christian Orthodox people gathered at the monument to Stefan cel Mare in Chisinau - Buiucani to protest against the LGBTQ+ community. Similarly, members of the Baptist Church 'Buna Vestire' organized a flash mob at the Stefan cel Mare si Sfant monument in Chisinau - Buiucani, to protest against the Pride March taking place in the capital. They emphasized their commitment to biblical values, expressing that homosexuality, viewed as a sin, is a burden from which God can free individuals, and promoted prayer and repentance for societal change and healing.

On 16 June 2024, Armenian forces fired with small arms in the direction of Azerbaijani forces near Shada, Shakhbuz region, Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic. The Ministry of Defense of Armenia refuted this report. No casualties.
On 16 June 2024, farmers continued blocking a local highway near Dunkowiczki, protesting against the proposed construction of a new infrastructure over arable land.
On 16 June 2024, conservative activists, including Catholic Christians, gathered for a march through Katowice, praising pro-life values and criticizing abortions.
On 16 June 2024, about 20 000 conservative activists, including Catholic Christians, gathered for a march through Gdansk, praising pro-life values and criticizing abortions.
On 16 June 2024, about 2000 conservative activists, including Catholic Christians and a local PiS deputy, gathered for a march through Krakow, praising pro-life values and criticizing abortions.

On 16 June 2024, several tens of people protested in Victory Square in Bucharest, demanding the recount of votes in sections with high percentages of irregularities and the resignation of the president of the Permanent Electoral Authority due to reported irregularities in the June 9 elections.

On 16 June 2024, people gathered in Aubagne (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to demand a ceasefire in Gaza, express solidarity with the Palestinian people, and condemn what they deemed a 'genocide' of Gazans by the Israeli army.

On 16 June 2024, about 30 people, including Ukrainian citizens (mostly Ukrainian women), protested against the public screening in Bologna (Emilia-Romagna) of the pro-Russia movie 'The Witness', whose production was financed by the Government of the Russian Federation. Protesters displayed Ukrainian national flags, sang the national anthem, and criticized the Russian Federation government and president.

On 16 June 2024, about 4,500 people participated in an antifascist march from the Kunstberg to Luxembourg Square in Brussels - Ixelles (Brussels) to denounce the progress of the far right in the last elections in Belgium, France and elsewhere in Europe. During the march, demonstrators tagged anarchist graffiti and threw smoke bombs and trash against the facade of Flemish Interest headquarters, damaging it. The event was an initiative of the Antifacist Coordination of Belgium and the ABVV-FGTB was present.

On 16 June 2024, more than 7,000 people, including CP affiliates, demonstrated in Caen (Normandie). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of Castellon City Council and the LGBTIQ+ Platform, hundreds of people, including the mayor (PP), the general director of diversity, the commissioner for the fight against violence against women, the territorial director of social welfare, the councilor for elderly people, the councilor for employment, the deputy for equality, and the general director of people with disabilities, protested in Castello de la Plana (Valencia) to celebrate pride and defend LGBTQ+ rights.
On 16 June 2024, striking Casino employees blocked access to the warehouse in Gael (Bretagne) to demand job security amid the sale of the company.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the citizens' initiative 'Countercurrent' (Gegenstrom), nearly 1,500 people participated in a protest in Redderse in Gehrden (Niedersachsen) against the planned multi-terminal power hub west of Gehrdener Berg. The context of the protest is the company Tennet's plans to construct power lines through the Gehrden area, participants want to keep the area for recreational activities and called on Tennet to find an alternative location.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the Albayzin Habitable Association (Asociacion Albayzin Habitable), more than 200 people protested in the Albaicin neighborhood of Granada (Andalucia) against tourist overcrowding, citing negative consequences on the daily lives of residents.
On 16 June 2024, people held a protest in Jerez de la Frontera (Cadiz, Andalucia) to celebrate the pride parade and defend LGBTQ+ rights.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the initiatives 'Star Ride Koln' (Sternfahrt Koln) and Kidical Mass, people participated in a cycling protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for a faster mobility shift. The participants demanded a faster expansion of safe pedestrian and cyclist crossings on bridges and pointed out that cycling is environmentally friendly and inexpensive, and called for better cycling infrastructure.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the students of the Widdersdorfer high school and their parents, 4,000 people, including 'Koln Against the Right' (Koln gegen Rechts), Grannies Against the Right, and GEW, participated in a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against the AfD and its district party conference, simultaneously taking place in their high school. The participants also called for tolerance and democracy, as well as for a discussion on the allocation of municipal premises for far-right political purposes.

On 16 June 2024, between 9,600 and 15,000 people, including members of the LGBTQ+ community and Antifa affiliates, demonstrated in Lyon (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 16 June 2024, 4,000 people, including the Podemos general secretary, two Podemos MEPs and the general coordinator of IU Andalucia and the SMR deputy in Congress, held a protest from Plaza de Colon, Puerta de Alcala and the Neptuno and converged at Puerta del Sol in Madrid - Centro (Madrid) to demand the abolition of the monarchy, coinciding with the ten years of the reign of Felipe VI.

On 16 June 2024, about 500 people staged a demonstration in solidarity with Wikileaks founder Julian Assange in Castello Square in Milano - Municipio 1 (Lombardia). Stella Assange, the wife of Julian Assange, was present. Actor Moni Ovadia, journalists Gianni Barbacetto and Germana Leoni, city councilor Carlo Monguzzi (PD), representatives of the Reporters of Lombardy, and former magistrate Armando Spataro also attended the event.

On 16 June 2024, people marched from San Babila Square to Sempione Park in Milano - Municipio 1 (Lombardia) to take part in Disability Pride 2024, an event in support of people suffering from disabilities and against discrimination against them.

On 16 June 2024, more than 200 people demonstrated in Nogent-le-Rotrou (Centre-Val de Loire). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the Mallorca Beach Tour (Mallorca Platja Tour), around 300 people held a protest at the Calo des Moro beach [coded to Palma de Mallorca (Islas Baleares)] against the current model of mass tourism, citing consequences on residents.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the Association for the Defense of the Estuary (APDR), people, including the mayor (BNG), a senator (BNG), a parliamentarian (BNG), and party affiliates (BNG), held a 'massive protest' in Pontevedra (Galicia) against the consequences of the Ence pulp factory in the estuary.
On 16 June 2024, hundreds of people held a protest in Porto (Porto) in solidarity with migrants and against fascism and an immigration-restrictive government initiative.

On 16 June 2024, between 2,350 and 3,000 people demonstrated in Saint-Brieuc (Bretagne). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 16 June 2024, at the call of the local Antifa movement, more than 100 people demonstrated in Saint-Etienne (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 16 June 2024, around 30 people demonstrated in Saint-Pons-de-Thomieres (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. On 16 June 2024, hundreds of protesters gathered outside Shannonside Foods Ltd factory in Straffan (Kildare) after disturbing footage of animal abuse filmed at the facility was aired in an RTE Investigates documentary earlier that week. Protesters called on the authorities to shut down the facility, with some hanging ribbons on the gates of the facility as a symbolic protest gesture.

On 16 June 2024, people, including representatives of Repubblika, took part in the monthly vigil for truth and justice in memory of murdered journalist Daphne Curana Galizia in Valletta (South Eastern).

On 16 June 2024, around 40 women participated in a protest in front of the women's prison in Vechta (Niedersachsen) in solidarity with Daniela Klette, against solitary confinement, and for freedom for all political prisoners and in support of anti-imperialism.

On 16 June 2024, about 5,000 people took part in the 2024 edition of the pride parade in Verona (Veneto). Mayor of Verona Damiano Tommasi (independent), Arcigay, Students Network, UdU, ARCI, Rainbow Families, Agedo, Legambiente, FFF, Emergency, ANPI, and Doctors Without Borders were present. Members of several local associations, including 'Pink Circle' (Circolo Pink), 'Sat', 'Eimi', 'Union of Rationalist Atheists and Agnostics' (UAAR), 'Social Assitents' Order' (Ordine degli Assistenti Sociali), 'Adi', 'Diplomart', 'Irene's world' (Il Mondo di Irene), 'Isolina is' (Isolina e), 'Order of Italian Psychologists' (Ordine degli Psicologi), members of the 'Afroveronesi' association, and people of African origin residing in the city, 'Planet B Festival', 'Arianna's Tread' (Filo di Arianna), 'RedLab', 'Radical Verona' (Verona Radicale), and 'Orie' were present.

On 16 June 2024, around 60 people participated in a protest in Wien - Floridsdorf (Wien) against patriarchal violence and femicides. The protest was organized after a femicide took place in Floridsdorf on 11 June 2024.
On 16 June 2024, people held a protest in front of Casetas Hospital in Zaragoza (Aragon) to demand measures against staff shortages, which are causing long waits for appointments.

On 16 June 2024, under the motto 'Protect Democracy! We will not give way! - Democracy first, the third' and at the call of a city council member (PARTEI), 150 to 200 people, including the mayor (SPD) and a city council member (SPD), participated in a protest in Zweibrucken (Rheinland-Pfalz) against the shift to the right visible in the recent elections, to call on the parties in the city council not to work with the AfD and for a ban of the TikTok platform, which they considered to spread lies and be harmful to young people.

On 16 June 2024, government officials detained a female petitioner in a homeless shelter, after taking her away outside a train station in Shanghai city (coded to Shanghai). She had just arrived from Beijing, where she had gone to file petitions against the Shanghai government. The abductions were ahead of the third plenary session of the 20th Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, scheduled to be in July 2024 in Beijing.

On 16 June 2024, about 300 activists, members of the National Power Party (NPP), and detainees' families from various provinces gathered outside the party headquarters in Tuek Lak Ti Muoy, Tuol Kouk (Phnom Penh) to demand civil liberties and the release of political prisoners. The protesters holding banners and photos of imprisoned individuals called for the release of the National Power Party President and other detained activists and leaders.
On 16 June 2024, protesters, including members of the Voices in Korea, held a rally in front of the Dongdaemun Design Plaza (Seoul City - Jung). They opposed the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

Displacement: Around 16 June 2024 (between 15 - 17 June), in Nam Say Mye village (Hsihseng township, Pa-O Self-Administered Zone, Shan-South state), about 700 villagers were forced to flee due to fighting between a joint force of the Myanmar military and the Pa-Oh National Army and the Pa-Oh National Liberation Army (coded separately).
On 16 June 2024, in Kawt Bein village (Kawkareik township, Kawkareik district, Kayin state), an unidentified armed group dropped two bombs on the village using drones. Casualties unknown.
