On 16 June 2024, in Thayarwady town (Thayarwady township, Thayarwady district, Bago-West region), after a heated argument, a policeman shot and killed his senior officer at the Myoma police station.

On 16 June 2024, near Inn Tein village (Tigyaing township, Katha district, Sagaing region), around 100 locals gathered at the village entrance and held a protest against the construction of the Su Pone Chaung - Inn Tein road which was being constructed by the Tigyaing township People's Defense Force, People's Administration Team and People's Security Force since it could destroy over five acres of farmland belonging to locals. Protesters held banners saying, 'We don't want the PaAhPha', and 'You won't get rice if you use our farmlands to construct a road'. A People's Defense Force (PaKaPha) and a People's Security Force (PaLaPha) intervened and arrested four men who participated in the protest. 3 of them were released later but one was still being detained.
On 16 June 2024, near Chaung Kauk village (Toungup township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), the Myanmar military conducted an airstrike and dropped bombs around 1 am. Casualties unknown.

On 16 June 2024, pro-Palestinian demonstrators rallied outside of the homes of employees at Real-Time Laboratories, an Elbit Systems Company, in Boca Raton (Florida) in solidarity with Palestine to demonstrate against the 'genocide' in Gaza. This demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 16 June 2024, pro-Palestinian students, including members of Students for a Democratic Society, rallied outside the home of a University of Colorado Regent, who is Jewish, in Englewood (Colorado) to demand an end to the 'genocide' in Gaza and to demand the university disclose and divest ties with Israel. Counter-demonstrators, including a Rabbi, also gathered in support of Israel and against Hamas, waving Israeli flags. This was a pro-Palestinian campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. This demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 16 June 2024, city leaders, community members, state lawmakers, and law enforcement gathered in Memphis (Tennessee) for the ninth annual 'Walk Against Gun Violence' aimed at finding solutions to reduce crime, prompted by Memphis's new homicide record in 2023.

On 16 June 2024, local residents rallied in Brownsville in New York - Brooklyn (New York) to call for an end to violence in the community and to demand safety following a fatal shooting of two people. A minister spoke at the rally.

On 16 June 2024, pro-Palestinian artists and theater employees rallied at Columbus square in New York - Manhattan (New York) to call for 'free Palestine' amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023.

On 16 June 2024, demonstrators picketed outside Sage Regenerative Kitchen & Brewery in Pasadena (California) to demand the restaurant not put meat and dairy back on its menu, claiming 'Meat is Murder.'

source: Left Coast Right Watch; Marin Independent Journal; San Francisco Chronicle; Twitter
notes: On 16 June 2024, about 500 pro-Palestinian students, including members of the Jewish community, staged a walkout during a commencement ceremony at Stanford University and rallied at Ueland Field at the University of California in Stanford (California) in a solitary with Palestine, to demand a ceasefire, and for the university to disclose and divest all ties with Israel. The walkout was staged by Stanford Against Apartheid in Palestine. This pro-Palestinian campus demonstration took place after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April and was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 16 June 2024, four men gathered outside of a church in State College (Pennsylvania) to protest against the church's support of the LGBTQ+ community. The men also said homophobic things to people entering the church.

On 16 June 2024, more than two dozen migrant workers held a rally outside MP Chrystia Freeland's office in Toronto - Old Toronto (Ontario) to demand a permanent residency program for the regularization of undocumented immigrants in Canada and to end deportations and immigration detention.

On 16 June 2024, a drug suspect was killed by another drug suspect in Barangay Inayawan, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). Police suspected the motive for the attack was related to illegal drugs. Their investigation showed the assailant sold drugs to the victim and became angry when the victim did not pay the full amount simply because they were friends.

On 16 June 2024, people, including a Palestinian activist, a journalist, and a member of the USyd Student Representative Council First Nations Officer, marched to the University of Sydney entrance and staged a sit-in (Sydney - Eastern, New South Wales), in solidarity with Palestine and the pro-Palestinian encampment at the university. They criticized the Israeli military action in Gaza.

This demonstration was in response to China's Premier Li Qiang's visit to Australia and China's gift of two pandas to the zoo. The protesters waved flags representing Uyghur, Tibetan, Hong Kong, Australia, and East Turkistan, and called on the Australian government not to be swayed by 'panda propaganda.' They encountered pro-China government groups holding flags and chanted 'Shame on China' and 'Shame on you' at them.
On 16 June 2024, people marched in Melbourne, Victoria, to express solidarity with Palestine. They criticized the Israeli acts.

On 16 June 2024, a group of ethnic Papuans protested in front of a military base in Fef district (Tambrauw regency, Southwest Papua province). They demanded justice against two Indonesian military soldiers who beat a Papuan man in Wayo village in April 2021. The victim sustained bruises and injuries on his torso, feet, and hands and died on 7 May 2021 (coded separately). They also sealed the gate of the military base with movable objects, opposing the military presence in the area.

On 16 June 2024, people marched in Aomori, Aomori against the plan to deliver spent nuclear fuel from TEPCO's Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant to an interim storage facility in Mutsu City, Aomori Prefecture. The Aomori Citizens' Association for Protecting the Future from Nuclear Waste organized the event. Three members of the Prefectural Assembly from the JCP and members from anti-nuclear and nuclear fuel organizations attended.

On 16 June 2024, people, including a Konosu City Council member from the SDPJ, protested in front of Konosu station in Konosu, Saitama, against the Israeli attack on Gaza. They called for peace in Ukraine and Gaza and demanded the government act for an immediate ceasefire.

The protest was called 'Anti-War Women's Rally - Women Reject War Mobilization.'
On 16 June 2024, 130 people marched in Sendai, Miyagi against the Israeli attack on Gaza. They expressed support for Palestine.
On 16 June 2024, about 10 people protested in front of Chofu station in Chofu, Tokyo, calling for the end of the killing of people in Gaza. They demanded peace in Gaza.

On 16 June 2024, people protested in front of Harajuku Police Station in Tokyo - Shibuya, Tokyo, to demand the right to protest. They called for the release of a figure known as 'Harajuku #1' and advocated for Palestinian freedom.
On 16 June 2024, people protested in front of Shinjuku station in Tokyo - Shinjuku, to express solidarity with Ukraine. The Stand With Ukraine in Japan organized the event.

On 16 June 2024, members of the National Wing movement within the DP gathered with banners outside the DP headquarters in Ulaanbaatar - Chingeltei. The protesters demanded the resignation of the party leader over allegations of embezzling funds from the Education Loan Fund and placing associates in key positions.

On 16 June 2024, over 500 people, including students and DPP Taichung City councilors held a rally with placards in Taichung City - Dali district (Taichung City). They demanded an end to the alleged constitutional abuses and undemocratic reforms pushed by the TPP and KMT.

On 16 June 2024, dozens of people, including a Danish-Palestinian protester, other international protesters, and members of Migrante Taiwan gathered with candles, keffiyeh, and paper birds with the names of deceased Palestinian children in front of the Taipei Grand Mosque in Taipei City - Da'an district (Taipei City). They demanded that the DPP sever ties with Israel and more actively provide support for Gaza, expressed solidarity with Palestinians, and spread awareness about the extent of the atrocities committed in Gaza.

source: El Norte; El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada; Reforma
notes: Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, an individual was killed and his mutilated body was found in two different neighborhoods with threatening messages. On 15 June 2024, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, over 3000 members of the LGBTQ+ community and allies joined the Pride march demanding no discrimination and respect. They gathered at the Independence Plaza and marched until the Reloj Monumental. They demanded laws and public policies to protect their community.

They gathered at the Glorieta Minerva and marched until the Cabanas Cultural Institute. Along the march, there were some flags demanding to stop the killings in Palestine.

Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, an individual was killed and the head was found in colonia Torreon Nuevo with gunshots. 1 fatality.

After a meeting with the authorities they didn't agree on the dismissal of the Secretary of Public Security.

source: Borderland Beat; La Voz de Michoacan; Milenio
notes: Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), near Uspero, Michoacan de Ocampo, the former leader of Los Caballeros Templarios gang was shot killed and his body was found on the Apatzingan-Nueva Italia highway. The victim was previously arrested for kidnappings and drug trafficking related crimes and was also part of self defense groups such as the H3. The killing is suspected to be related with a retaliation. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2024, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, according to witnesses, several armed individuals shot against a group of people inside a party in colonia La Pinera and they repelled the attack. Five people were injured and one died. 1 fatality, 5 injured.

On 15 June 2024, in Cuautla, Morelos, at least two armed individuals shot against the directors of the mall Plaza 12 Octubre. One man was injured and another died as a result. The attack is suspected to be related with extortion fees as there have been multiple attacks in other malls in the area related with extortion from criminal groups. 1 injured, 1 fatality.

Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in Carmen, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was set on fire and found in colonia Villas del Jaral. The victim's body was located before he was burned. fatality
On 15 June 2024, in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed inside a house in colonia Mision San Juan. The attack is suspected to be related with drug selling. 1 fatality.

Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in Pesqueria, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his handcuffed body was found in the Zacatequitas Municipal Pantheon in colonia Colinas del Aeropuerto. The victim's throat was slit. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2024, in San Francisco del Mar, Oaxaca, a man was killed during a graduation ceremony of the Institute of Baccalaureate Studies (IEBO). It is suspected that the victim was linked to the trafficking of undocumented migrants. According to the IEBO, the attack took place outside the institution, although other sources indicate that it happened during the graduation ceremony. According to initial investigations, the event is suspected to be related to a settling of scores between rival groups for control of human trafficking in the area. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2024, in Acatzingo de Hidalgo, Puebla, armed individuals shot and killed two men in colonia San Gabriel. It is suspected that due to the way in which they were killed, it could be a case of settling of scores between criminal gangs (affiliation of the victims unknown). 2 fatalities.

On 15 June 2024, in Acatzingo de Hidalgo, Puebla, street vendors clashed with the Municipal Police demanding to reinstall their posts in the Portal Hidalgo area, after the government evicted the street vendors to maintain the city's historic monument. Casualties unknown.

On 15 June 2024, in Palmar de Bravo, Puebla, residents of the community blocked the Puebla-Orizaba highway and set on fire tires as a demonstration against the results of the elections. They claimed that there was fraud by the independent candidate who won only by 23 votes. The rioters were suspected to act encouraged by the current mayor of the Green Ecologist Party of Mexico (PVEM) who was also running for reelection. During the elections, the officials of the Municipal Electoral Council abandoned the electoral packages and didn't showed up for fear of an attack. The territory is known to be located in an area with high numbers of gas stealing.
Around 15 June 2024, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, an individual was killed and the burned body was found on colonia Santa Lucia. 1 fatality.

Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), near Carrizalejo, Sinaloa, an individual was killed and the body was found wrapped in plastics and tape between El Carrizalejo and the road leading to La Huesera and Ejido Ayune. 1 fatality.
Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, a man was killed and his handcuffed body was found on Honduras Avenue and Reforma street. 1 fatality.
Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a blanket in Sinaloa alley between streets 13 and 14. 1 fatality.
Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), near San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, a woman was killed and her handcuffed body was found in the rural area. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2024, in San Luis Rio Colorado, armed individuals threw a Molotov cocktail and set fire to the house of a municipal police officer in colonia Mezquite. It is unknown if the police officer was in the house. There were no injuries.

On 15 June 2024, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, tens of members of the LGBTQ+ community and allies joined the Pride march demanding no discrimination and respect. They gathered at the Miguel Hidalgo Avenue at the municipal cemetery and marched until Plaza de la Libertad. They commemorated a woman who was killed some months ago.

On 15 June 2024, in Merida, Yucatan, people from the LGBTQ+ community and allies joined the Pride march demanding no discrimination and respect, as well as actions to stop to violence and abuses. They gathered at the Monumento a la Patria and marched until the La Mejorada neighborhood.

actors: FARC Dissident - 52nd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (52nd Front - Marco Aurelio Buendia)
notes: Around 15 June 2024 (weekend of), in the rural area of Acacias municipality (Meta), members of the Marco Aurelio Buendia FARC dissident structure kidnapped a driver from a transport company by luring him with a fake transportation request. The individuals threatened and detained the victim, and subsequently sent videos and intimidating messages to the transport company, demanding 28 million pesos for his release. In the messages, the perpetrators threatened to burn the vehicle with the driver inside if they did not receive the money. Hours later, police and military forces rescued the victim and arrested two members of the armed group in a joint operation.

On 15 June 2024, in Caucasia (Antioquia), two suspected members of the Gulf Clan who arrived on a motorcycle shot and killed a teenager and injured a man in the El Roble neighborhood. According to the police, the attack was aimed at the person who was injured, not the teenager who died. The victims were in an area known for high drug sales and consumption. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2024, in Arica (Arica y Parinacota), around 500 senior citizens held a march from the crossing of Patricio Lynch avenue and May 21 street through the center of the city to demonstrate in favor of elderly rights for the World Day of Awareness of Abuse and Maltreatment in Old Age. The marchers were made up of various Communal Unions, namely Elderly No1, the Arica Region Elderly , and the Amanecer Nortino Elderly. The march was supported and co-organized by the Regional Government of Arica and Parinacota. The marchers supported legislation for promoting elderly well-being.

On 15 June 2024, in Capiata (Central), residents marched to the front of a factory at kilometer 24 of route PY02 to protest against its foul odors and suspicions that it was responsible for the contamination of the Capiata stream.

On 15 June 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of local residents carrying torches and dressed in white carried out a peaceful demonstration against violence in the Chongon parish. The march also included the participation of merchants, government authorities, and police officers.

Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), in Oruro (Oruro), a group of locals and different animal advocacy organizations gathered at 10 de Febrero square to carry out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city demanding respect for animal's rights as well as a restructuring of a local animal shelter, denouncing animal abuse in the entity and calling for sanctions against the directors.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) Assam Rifles
notes: On 15 June 2024, a mob (likely Meitei, based on similar coded events), comprising of mostly women, stopped 4 trucks carrying construction materials to Churachandpur district and burned 2 of them at Tronglaobi village (Bishnupur, Manipur) resulting in police forces firing tear gas shells and mock bombs to disperse the crowd amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Sikh regiment, police forces and fire services were able to save the other 2 vehicles.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) District Reserve Group
source: Asian News International; Hindustan Times; Times of India
notes: On 15 June 2024, PLGA cadres clashed with Narayanpur-Kondagaon-Kanker-Dantewada District Reserve Guards (DRG), Special Task Forces (STF), and Indo-Tibetan Border Police's (ITBP) 53rd Battalion forces in the Kutul, Farashbeda, and Kodtameda areas of the Abujhmad forests (Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh), during the second day of 'Maad Bachao Abhiyan' an anti-Naxal operation. Eight Communist Party of India (Maoist) and PLGA cadres, including four women, with a cumulative bounty of Rs. 48 lakh, and 1 STF trooper were killed. Two STF troopers were injured. Police personnel claim that several other CPI (Maoist) cadres were either injured or killed, based on blood stains found at the site of the clash. Security forces recovered an Insas and .303 rifle, a grenade launcher, and explosives from the site

On 15 June 2024, a police constable was suspected of assaulting a teenage boy near Balwa Police Station in Janakpur city (Dhanusha district) after the boy requested a new cricket ball, having lost his while playing near the station. The boy suffered head and facial injuries and received treatment at the Advance City Scan and Diagnostic Center.

On 15 June 2024, a policeman (outpost in-charge) assaulted a man (shopkeeper) and took him to the police outpost at the Gandhi Park area in Firozabad city (Uttar Pradesh) after the man was suspected of having resisted the policeman's extortion attempts.

On 15 June 2024, a trainee police inspector and some constables were suspected of assaulting and detaining a man (gravel trader) at the Sarojini Nagar area in Lucknow city (Uttar Pradesh) in a suspected case of extortion.

Defusal: On 15 June 2024, the district force and the Bomb Disposal Squad of 231 BN CRPF defused a series of IED bombs of 30-30 kg explosives and 1 cooker bomb, planted by unidentified assailants (likely Naxal-Maoist rebels based on the location) in Bijapur district (Chhattisgarh) during a joint operation.

Weapons seizure: On 15 June 2024, police officials arrested six CPI (Maoist) cadres and recovered arms and ammunition from the Thadapala forest in Venkatapuram mandal (coded to Venkatapuram village, Mulugu, Telangana) while the CPI (Maoist) cadres were attempting to plant bombs inside the forest. The recovered items included a DBBL (Double Barrel Breech Loading) weapon, four kits, two walkie-talkies, 10 ammunition, 17 meters of Cordex wire, six detonators, 12 gelatine sticks, 20 batteries, one pressure cooker, one tiffin box, two backpacks, two knives, six chargers, five car keys, three torch lights, one radio and 20 iron spikes along with books.

Other: On 15 June 2024, authorities demolished 11 houses, belonging to Muslim families and suspected to have been built on government land, in Bhainswahi village under Nainpur tehsil (Mandla, Madhya Pradesh) with a bulldozer, after police claimed to have recovered beef, animal hides, and bovine skeletal remains from these houses.

On 15 June 2024, members of the Muslim community clashed (likely violent based on similar events) with members of the BJP, the BJYM and the Bajrang Dal in Medak town (Telangana) after the BJP and Bajrang Dal members found cows in the Jambikunta village and set them free ahead of Bakrid (Muslim festival).

On 15 June 2024, 6 people from two communities (likely from the Hindu and Muslim communities based on the issue) clashed with each other at Sector 23 in the Delhi - Dwarka area (New Delhi, Delhi) over a dispute regarding who gets to fill the water first (likely from a common tap at a slum area). 3 people were seriously injured.

On 15 June 2024, members of the Muslim community were suspected of assaulting a Bajrang Dal member and his friend and snatching their motor bike, near the State Bank of India in Aonla city (Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh) in a suspected case of communal violence. On 15 June 2024, residents of various villages staged a protest march (on tractor trolleys), raising slogans, to the Collectorate in Agra city (Uttar Pradesh) against the implementation of the Highway Facility Green Belt project in the area - which the protesters claimed will result in the demolition of the houses of many people.

On 15 June 2024, residents of Atarsuma village staged a protest at the Collectorate in Sultanpur city (Uttar Pradesh) against the police administration whom the protesters accused of constructing a police station on land allocated for a road in the village.

On 15 June 2024, local people staged a protest along the Maskanwa-Gaurachok Road in Bhopatpur village (Gonda, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of a man who died during a collision between two motor bikes.
On 15 June 2024, local people staged a protest, carrying and breaking water pots, in Bawani Khera town (Bhiwani, Haryana) against the shortage of drinking water in the area.

On 15 June 2024, residents of Chandpur village staged a dharna (sit-in protest) at the Collectorate in Muzaffarnagar city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding action against members of a family whom the protesters accused of assaulting them over the registration of a case against a member of the assailants family.

On 15 June 2024, local people staged a protest, raising slogans, at the Shivpuri locality in Orai city (Jalaun, Uttar Pradesh) after a man was electrocuted while going to the balcony. The protesters claimed that electric cables were close to the balconies of houses in the area, leading to fear and incidences of electrocution. There was an altercation between the protesters and a lineman.

On 15 June 2024, some local people staged a protest at the Akbar Nagar area in Lucknow city (Uttar Pradesh) against the demolition driver carried out by the Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) in the area.

On 15 June 2024, local people and family members of the deceased staged a protest and placed the deceased's body along the Banda Highway near Lohgara village (Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh) demanding the demolition of the house of the accused involved in the shooting and killing of a young man and demanded compensation for the family members of the deceased.

On 15 June 2024, members of INC led by the incumbent Member of Parliament, and a Member of the Legislative Assembly clashed with police in front of the Police Commissioner's office in Rajkot city (Gujarat) during a demonstration over various demands including removing the head of Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the game zone fire incident, and Rs 1 crore compensation for the affected families. Police detained a large number of INC members.

On 15 June 2024, a large number of students gathered, burned effigies, and tires, and held a demonstration in Patna city (Bihar) demanding the cancellation of the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test-(Undergraduate) examination.

Other: Around 15 June 2024 (as reported), Taliban district governor recruited at least 30 children aged 10 to 18 from religious schools to special military training center and provided them with training despite the opposition of the parents, in Tarbiya Moalem area of Nesay district [coded to Jamarj-e Bala], Badakhshan.

source: Hasht-e Subh; National Resistance Front of Afghanistan
notes: On 15 June 2024, 2 Taliban members were killed and 2 another were wounded following an attack by National Resistance Front militants at a Taliban base near the customs area in PD9 of Kabul city.
On 15 June 2024, journalists protested in Sofia, demanding that they be allowed to use the offices in their union building which are currently being rented out to private companies.

On 15 June 2024, protesters gathered in Sofia to voice their opposition to the Pride parade in the country, advocating for traditional families and claiming that traditional family values are being threatened by the LGBTQ+ community and other groups.

On 15 June 2024, protesters gathered in Plovdiv to voice their opposition to the Pride parade in the country, advocating for traditional families and claiming that traditional family values are being threatened by the LGBTQ+ community and other groups.

On 15 June 2024, protesters gathered in Varna to voice their opposition to the Pride parade in the country, advocating for traditional families and claiming that traditional family values are being threatened by the LGBTQ+ community and other groups.
On 15 June 2024, caregivers protested in Pula against discrimination against their profession, demanding that they receive equal salaries to other colleagues from other branches in Croatia.
On 15 June 2024, around 400 people participated in the Pride March in Sodankyla, Lappi, in support of the rights of the LGBTQ+ community.
On 15 June 2024, a rally was held in Gori City against a local landfill. Citizens complained about the smell coming from the landfill.

On 15 June 2024, thousands participated in the Athens Pride march, Athens - Central Athens, with the motto 'A law is not enough', reflecting the sentiment that while the legalization of same-sex marriage was a positive step, it had not sufficiently addressed homophobia in Greek society. The SYRIZA, PASOK and New Left (Nea Aristera) political parties were given a shared tent to engage with voters and express support for the LGBTQ+ community. A member of Proud Seniors Greece held a speech. Various politicians from across the political spectrum, including Athens Mayor Haris Doukas, New Democracy officials, SYRIZA and PASOK MPs, joined the march. Participants held Palestinian flags and chanted 'No pride in genocide'.

On 15 June 2024, Epaminondas Korkoneas, the special duty police guard who killed teenager Alexandros Grigoropoulos in Exarchia while on duty and sparked a month of riots in Athens and several other cities in 2008, was arrested in Mani and sent back to Domokos prison, following the Supreme Court's rejection of an appeals court decision that had reduced his life sentence to 13 years based on lack of prior criminal record.

source: IPN; Moldpres; Newsmaker.md; Nokta.md; TV8; Unimedia
notes: On 15 June 2024, tens of people marched from the Circus building to the Cathedral in Chisinau - Buiucani in an event organized by the Socialists' Party in support of the traditional family, protesting against the upcoming LGBT march. Participants expressed concerns about the imposition of non-traditional values on Moldovan society. Representatives of the Orthodox Church and several PSRM MPs participated in the event, while Igor Dodon delivered a speech.

On 15 June 2024, people marched in Oslo to show support and solidarity with Palestine amid the Israeli offensive in Gaza and Rafah. Activists from the Struggle Committee and the Red Party took part in the event, among others.
On 15 June 2024, SIAN movement activists staged an anti-Islam demonstration in Notodden, Vestfold og Telemark.
On 15 June 2024, people participated in the Pride March in Korgen, Nordland, in support of the rights of the LGBTQ+ community.
On 15 June 2024, farmers continued blocking a local highway near Dunkowiczki, protesting against the proposed construction of a new infrastructure over arable land.
On 15 June 2024, several tens of people protested in Victory Square in Bucharest, demanding the recount of votes in sections with high percentages of irregularities.

On 15 June 2024, about 3000 LGBTQ+ activists gathered for a pride march through Ljubljana, demanding equal rights for people of all genders. A minor group of counter-protesters praising conservative values gathered around the route.
On 15 June 2024, health workers and trade union activists marched in Ostersund, Jamtland, in support of the national health workers' strike, demanding higher wages and better working hours.
On 15 June 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Lidkoping, Vastra Gotaland, to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.
On 15 June 2024, health workers and trade union activists demonstrated in Jonkoping in support of the national health workers' strike, demanding higher wages and better working hours.

On 15 June 2024, 1,000 people, including students, demonstrated in Agen (Occitanie). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 15 June 2024, around 400 people gathered outside the Court of Justice in Cherbourg-en-Cotentin (Normandie) to demand the police officer who shot and killed Sulivan Sauvey on 9 June be placed in pre-trial detention.

On 15 June 2024, overnight, several dozen rioters set fire to a France Travail agency and around 15 vehicles before clashing with police forces in the Provinces neighborhood in Cherbourg-en-Cotentin (Normandie). The rioters were denouncing police violence and demanding justice in the wake of the shooting and subsequent death of youth Sullivan by a police officer on 9 June 2024.

On 15 June 2024, 3 underage individuals beat up, kidnapped, and raped a 12-year-old Jewish girl in a warehouse in Courbevoie (Ile-de-France). The victim reported that the perpetrators also verbally abused her with antisemitic insults, pointing to an antisemitic motive.

On 15 June 2024, Last Generation activists staged a protest in Halle (Saale) (Sachsen-Anhalt) and blocked a road for more climate protection and against right-wing extremism.

On 15 June 2024, around 500 people, including AWO affiliates, participated in a protest in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) for a tax-, duty- and credit-free inflation compensation of 3,000 euros for pensioners.

On 15 June 2024, about 250 people, including members of the Iranian community, participated in a protest from Schanzenstrasse to Johannes-Brahm-Platz in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) against the government of the Islamic Republic of Iran and its repressive course.

On 15 June 2024, Last Generation and XR activists staged a protest in the Schanzenviertel area of Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) and blocked a road for environmental reasons, calling for an end to fossil fuels, more justice, and a speed limit on highways. The police intervened physically, carried protesters off the road and encircled other activists in front of a pharmacy.

On 15 June 2024, under the motto 'Suffering of the Palestinians. Current situation in Gaza' and at the call of the 'Generation Islam' Muslim group, around 1,200 people participated in a pro-Palestine protest in Hannover (Niedersachsen) against what they claim to be a genocide in Gaza, German and Egyptian policies regarding the Gaza War, against nationalism and colonialism, and questioning Israel's existence. At the call of Grannies Against the Right, around 50 people participated in a counter-demonstration in solidarity with Israel.

On 15 June 2024, around 2,000 people, including 'Queer Feminist Collective Heidelberg' (Queerfeministisches Kollektiv Heidelberg), FFF, the mayor (SPD), 'Representation of the student body' (Vertretung der Studierendenschaft) and 'Queer Youth Heidelberg', participated in the Christopher Street parade in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) to defend LGBTQ+ rights and more equality, and denounce queerphobia. The participants also called for workshops to sensitize civil servants to violence against the LGBTQ+ community.

On 15 June 2024, at the call of a social alliance consisting of labor unions, social organizations and senior citizens' councils, around 200 people, including IGM, AWO, the 'German Social Association (SoVD)' (Sozialverband Deutschland (SoVD), 'VdK social association' (Sozialverband VdK) and the senior citizens' councils in Schleswig-Holstein and Hamburg, participated in a protest in Kiel (Schleswig-Holstein) for a tax-, duty- and credit-free inflation compensation of 3,000 euros for pensioners.
On 15 June 2024, people participated in a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for the preservation of the Holweide hospital and the children's hospital on Amsterdamer Strasse.

Participants argued the move would go against the interests of the pro-independence movement.

On 15 June 2024, people demonstrated in Saint-Die-des-Vosges (Nouvelle-Aquitaine). The event was part of a nationwide wave of demonstrations against racism, far-right ideology, and in support of an open society called by CGT, CFDT, FSU, UNSA, and SUD. The event took place after the National Rally (RN) came first in the European elections in France and President Emmanuel Macron announced the dissolution of the National Assembly on 9 June, raising fears of a government led by the far-right party. The demonstrators demanded all parties from the left to unite in a 'Popular Front' (Front Populaire) ahead of the upcoming legislative elections.

On 15 June 2024, activists occupied a vacant house on Imbergstrasse 3/Steingasse 24 in Salzburg (Salzburg) against the lack of conversion of vacant properties into living space and to raise awareness about what they consider the failed housing policy of the state government and the worsening housing situation. The activists also demanded a city with decent and affordable housing for everyone and a city in which non-commercial spaces and social centers are promoted.

On 15 June 2024, under the motto 'The Hunsruck is colorful' and at the call of an alliance consisting of several political parties, the church and other organizations, between 500 and 600 people, including CDU, SPD, The Greens, FDP, the mayor (Independent), local politicians, representatives of the protestant church, and members of the Youth Parliament, participated in a protest in Simmern/Hunsruck (Rheinland-Pfalz) against an AfD state party conference and right-wing extremism and for tolerance, human rights, diversity, solution-oriented action despite discussions, cohesion regardless of origin, religion and skin color, and democratic values.

On 15 June 2024, 350 people, including regional councilor Brigitte Fournier-Turquin (The Ecologists) and national deputy Aurelien Gall (PCF), demonstrated in Soissons (Hauts-de-France) to protest against the construction of the Rockwool factory, which they deemed damaging to local biodiversity.

On 15 June 2024, at the call of the association 'Strasbourg a Velo' and others, around 700 people biked from several localities and converged in Strasbourg (Grand Est) for the so-called 'Velorution', to demand more safe bike lanes in French cities. Around 200 German protesters biked over from Germany and joined the protest.

On 15 June 2024, about 1,000 people, including No TAV activists, took to the streets of Susa (Piemonte) to protest against the Turin-Lyon high-speed railway project, pollution, and the adverse effects the project would have on the environment. During the march, the protesters unloaded manure in front of police vehicles near the headquarters of the Sitaf company. Protesters also displayed a sign comparing the company (and the project) to the mafia.

On 15 June 2024, at the call of the association 'Free Sea' (Mare Libero), people demonstrated in the Tirrenia fraction of Pisa (Toscana) to protest against the extension of expired beach concessions granted to owners of hotels, cafes, and restaurants located on the Italian coasts, and demand public beach fronts remain free and accessible for all.
